story:
No More Chains 2: It's Time For Change

Filming NO MORE CHAINS 2 has been a thrilling adventure for several months. We're mighty excited to be at the finish line and have every intention of raising all the funds needed to assist in the healing of people who silently suffer from childhood and adult experiences that have traumatized them.

For this second series, we will be sharing stories of men and women who have overcome the odds of poverty, mental illnesses, homelessness, family shame and daddy issues, (to name a few), by tapping into their inner powers so that they could break chains to rewrite their stories and eventually achieve their purpose(s) in life.

No More Chains 2: It's Time for Change teaches through history and story-telling how to take steps to release the chains to create changes from the inside out, by facing your emotional, mental and generational chains, as well as healing and forgiving. 

The No More Chains movement was erected to advance the intellectual and educational dialogue between members of the African-American race in a strong effort to bring solutions to the forefront and the problems to the back.

We are traveling across the country interviewing experts and sharing relatable inspirational stories of people who made the bold it's time for change decisions, discussing topics such as:

  • The history and downfall of the African-American father
  • Overcoming family shame in the African-American community
  • Taking responsibility for your actions and decisions which have led to self-inflicted personal trauma
  • How to reach deep into your energetic power to make change
  • How to heal from deep-rooted emotional, generational and relational wounds
  • How to unlearn societal expectations, traditions, and fallacies
  • Solutions to these issues

...and so much more.

HOW WILL THE MONEY BE USED?

Film-making is a labor intensive and expensive task. Here's a breakdown of our immediate needs and how the money will be used:

PRODUCTION - This includes the purchase and rental of equipment and any other fees incurred during the course of production.  

TRAVEL- A large portion of our production costs relate to travel for interviews with the key people in the film including experts. Costs include flights, accommodations, car rentals and gas for our team.  

LICENSING AND RIGHTS USAGE - For the music & any footage used in the film that is archival, and the ability to distribute the final product across all relevant platforms upon its release.

COMPENSATION - We'll need to hire other talented collaborators such as a motion graphic designer, a music composer, and sound mixer so we can bring you the best film possible.

 

We will utilize:

Traditional distribution into major cities.

Targeting more regional cinemas where there are clusters of fans of the MOVEMENT.

Tugg.com screenings (crowdsourcing audiences for theatrical screenings).

Special event screenings with cultural institutions etc.

 

The order of distribution is:

NOW - PRODUCTION

DECEMBER: FILM FESTIVALS

JANUARY - SPECIAL EVENT SCREENINGS

FEBRUARY - THEATRICAL RELEASE STARTS + LISTING ON TUGG.COM

EARLY SPRING - OFFICIAL DVD/BLURAY RELEASE

STREAMING PLATFORMS A WHILE AFTER THAT

The Impact

The first series of No More Chains documentary is shown and taught in schools, universities, and training's all over the country. And we want to maintain the cultural and empowering movement that this film series has begun with a dynamic follow-up with No More Chains 2.

WHAT WE NEED TO COVER

Distribution fees and costs 

EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS, RETREATS AND SEMINARS

We are creating life-changing group masterminds and seminars for people seeking to stand in front of their story and use it not as a crutch, but a stepping stone to help heal the next person. These trainings by our cast will teach people how to build “wealth” around their story and no longer be binded by their past (or future).

MANUFACTURING & MASTERING

For DVD's, Blu-ray and transport storage for DCP's.

SUBTITLES

We need to cover the costs of English closed caption subtitles so the film can be used in the education market (required by law) and also foreign language subtitles so the film can play in as many countries as possible.

PUBLICITY

We will need professional help to get publicity and reviews in the press for the film’s release and put the film on the map.

The money will also be used to create re-enactment scenes for the film. There are also hardware and software that we need in order to create everything at a high resolution so that the finished film will be able to screen theatrically.

Risks & Challenges

After the indigogo campaign has been completed, be sure to give all of your correct information so that we can quickly send your rewards to you in a timely manner.

Other Ways You Can Help

Let's continue to work together for the increase of more positivity in our culture. Don't forget to help us spread the word and share this project on facebook and other social media outlets with all your friends. Go to www.nomorechainsfilm.com for updates.

P.S. Be sure to click on each perk to see your detailed rewards for your support.

story:
" I’ve worked in dozens of short films in major and secondary roles and have felt that King Of The Road is my time to stand up steer the ship. "

                                - Joshua Vellis, Director, and Writer ~

King of The Road is a story that is inspired by old-school Looney Tunes and Hanna-Babera cartoons. With this child-like vision in mind, I plan to create a short film that brings a nostalgic feeling to the older audience, but also creates a humorous and comedic atmosphere that makes you turn to the person next to you and say, ‘Oi, that was actually mad’. We want our audience to feel like they’re watching an episode of their favorite cartoon mashed with a realistic perspective and adult comedy.

 

SYNOPSIS 

We follow Frank, a man who, when he pulls to the side of an isolated road to relieve himself, encounters a wild Lion. Being stuck in the middle of the Australian nowhere, he must find ways to survive without being mauled by this beast. Frank realizes he has something the Lion desperately wants and uses this newfound knowledge to fuel his plans of escape. 

 

Heres the breakdown!  

We're asking for $3,000. The donations that you give will go towards funding the production of King of The Road. This includes costs for locations, catering, transport for crew and most importantly, THE LION! These funds are being brought together with your help to cover the costs of council approval for  a rural road, amenities on set, feeding cast and crew, transport to and from the set, and most importantly, THE LION! (Which will be a two-man costume)

 

YOUR REWARD!

$10

A Special Thanks in the film's credits!
A personal Thank You email from the Director!

$15

A Special Thanks in the film's credits!
Access to an exclusive Behind-The-Scenes video!

$25

A Special Thanks in the film's credits!
Access to an exclusive Behind-The-Scenes video!
A signed copy of the script by the cast and crew!

$50

Executive Producer credit!
Access to an exclusive Behind-The-Scenes video!
Access to exclusive Behind-The-Scenes stills!
A digital copy of the completed film!

$75

Executive Producer credit!
Access to an exclusive Behind-The-Scenes video!
Access to exclusive Behind-The-Scenes stills!
A digital copy of the completed film!
Invite to a private screening of the film!
Invite to an exclusive wrap party!

Due to the nature of the production, we face multiple risks & challenges. These include:

Location - We are in the midst of finding the perfect location! We plan to counter our issues with locations by finding a secluded, quiet road that is easily accessible to our crew and meets the needs and vision of the producers and director!

Lion Costume - Our lion costume will need to fit two people for its proper perspective and proportions. We're in contact with highly skilled and very capable costume artists and production designers to come to a very extensive design and make.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know of anybody, or you yourself can help to chip in via our Indiegogo campaign, we would be 'forever in your debt'! 

Other ways you can help us is;

- Donating 

- Passing on our story and campaign to others

- Sharing contacts for sponsorship

- Donating needed supplies or tools! 

Contact kingoftheroadfilm@gmail.com for enquiries and questions!

 

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/kingoftheroadshortfilm/

story:
Why We believe "Perpetuity" is Both Timely and Important

With the exposed allegations of Harvey Weinstein that shook our nation, and the consequent rise and empowerment of women sharing their abuses of the past, came next the fall of some of America's most prominent men.  The proliferation of "Me Too" and other movements have changed the course of history, not only in American, but worldwide. 

This story is of a woman who had no chance to lead a productive life, as like many women, she has no recollection of the youthful trauma she experienced. They are buried memories she's repressed in order just to survive and exist.  "Perpetuity" is how this woman, in the most extreme and dire of circumstances, gets a second chance at life by finally facing the horrors of her youth as those painful memories stream unbidden back into her consciousness.

Jennifer Tremain is a maintenance worker at a large high-end office building, one of a string of jobs she's had as she struggles to maintain her self-destructive lifestyle. 

On this particular morning, Jennifer has only just arrived at work when the room she's in suddenly implodes. The mirrors shatter, sending fragments in a hundred directions. The fire extinguisher dislodges and slams into Jennifer's throat, her body already thrown back across the room from the violent lurch of the entire room. The ceiling caves, the walls bend, the room is chaos. Jennifer lands on her back unconscious along with myriad debris.

When she wakes, Jennifer begins her fight for survival.  Almost mortally wounded, a shaft of metal having embedded her leg, a broken arm, and with no power of speech from her damaged throat, Jennifer must navigate the continually decaying room, fighting fire, falling water, building fragments, glass shards and smoke inhalation, all the while trying to seek some kind of rescue while dressing her own wounds in an attempt to stay alive.

It is in this hell . . . that she starts to remember.  To recall, little by little, the forgotten memories of the one other instance in her life that she had had to fight to survive.  

This story is about how a woman, faced with the most incredible crisis, fights for a chance to not only survive her current circumstances, but along the way finds surprisingly, and excruciatingly, the opportunity for the healing she has never experienced. 

    Producer/Writer/Director

    Patrick James Carson's recent screenplay was adapted into the motion picture "9/11" starring Whoopie Goldberg and Charlie Sheen, released theatrically worldwide late last year with video rights picked up and released this year by Fox Entertainment.  Mr. Carson has directed in the past, most notably the movie "Deadly Ritual," but has focused on script writing for the past many years.  His works "Elevator" and "The New American Candidate" were produced into plays (Elevator is what was adapted into "9/11"). 

    While several of his scripts have been purchased in recent years, his script "Perpetuity" renewed his desire to direct again, especially with the rise of abuse victims speaking out of late and after witnessing how his script for "9/11" was so drastically changed, and frankly destroyed, for the making of the film.

    Mr. Carson has written over thirty screenplays, many that have sold and been made, and has directed over 20 films (shorts, corporate, feature) and dozens of commercials. He founded a film actor's workshop in Tucson, and also founded the "personal and business newspaper" tech company "Makemynewspaper.com."  

    Producer/Director

    Alan Williams, with a film degree from the University of Arizona, has been shaping the Arizona film community for 20 years, with his career actually heating up of late.  He's won film festival awards for both writing and directing for his shorts, including "Best of Arizona" for his film, "The Avenue" at the Arizona International Film Festival. He is directing a web series (being made for Netflix) "You Only Live Twice" and just won "Best Action Short" at the Chandler Film Festival.

    Alan's activity in the Southern Arizona motion picture world is well known, and even started the non-profit "Picture Arizona" to help bring the business and film communities to a better working relationship.  Alan, his wife and three children live in Tucson, Arizona. 

    About the Production

    Even though "Perpetuity" is paced and action oriented, it actually only takes place in one location, with only one main actor.  This allows for a superior opportunity to make a low-budget, yet high production value looking motion picture.  Only one set is needed, and a minimal crew, to make this exciting, insightful film.  Shooting is scheduled to start this December.

    Mr. Carson, through his founding of the Film Actor Workshops, has had the opportunity and honor of meeting the best filmmakers, film artists and film technicians in Arizona.  It is only with their support, and expertise, that this film can be made.  Together with Alan Williams and his reach and history with the collective film community, there is virtually no one in Arizona that won't be part of this endeavor.  

    The money raised will go to:

    • Paying the actor(s) and crew appropriately and feeding them.
    • Rent for location building.  A warehouse that has high ceilings and can facilitate interior rain (and even fire) shots (needs a drain).
    • Set construction material, including removable walls, ceilings, and decoration, both before the explosion and after.
    • Broadcast camera equipment, lighting, sound and post are all supplied by the hired crew.
    • Site Insurance

    Please Share Our Film With Others

    We appreciate not only any financial support, but please share our Indiegogo page with your social media friends to help us achieve our goal.  

    Indiegogo share tools are available on this page.

Paying the actor(s) and crew appropriately and feeding them.
Rent for location building.  A warehouse that has high ceilings and can facilitate interior rain (and even fire) shots (needs a drain).

Site Insurance


Please Share Our Film With Others

story: 2

About:

  • This film is being produced by The Orthodox Fellowship of the Transfiguration, which has been proclaiming the ecological mission of the Orthodox Church for 20 years.
  • The Face of God bears witness to a critical issue at a critical time (more about the project here). 
  • All contributions will pay for travel expenses and editing fees -- and allow the team to continue to gather stories from a wide and representative swath of Orthodox Christians both in the US and around the world.
  • A 60 minute, 30 minute, and a 5 minute version of The Face of God will be realized.

 

Northern California-  a still from our footage exploring ecosystems and biodiversity 

CONTENTS

The Living Icon of the Face of God

  • Orthodox Theology of Creation
  • The Liturgy and Creation/Nature
  • Sacramental Ecology
  • God’s relationship to creation / creation’s relationship to God
  • The face of God in creation
  • The world is charged with the grandeur of God
  • Love-beauty-Christ
  • The earth as prophet
  • Listening to our co-creation

Ecosystem Health is Human Health

  • Nature as ecological and spiritual relationship
  • The healthy ecosystem
  • The human place in the ecosystem
  • The earth system
  • The human impact
  • Climate change
  • The challenges of a changing climate air-water-food-health-migration

Metanoia

  • Accepting the times - Godly vs ungodly grief
  • Responding as a Church / Responding as an Orthodox Christian
  • Returning to an Orthodox praxis on earth
  • Transforming the heart transfigures the cosmos
  • But the problem is big, and I am only an individual
  • What the ascetic and lenten teachings of the Church reveal about how to live in these times
  • Becoming stewards and priests
  • “We can live very well upon the earth…”
  • Living liturgically is living ecologically

A Cloud of Witnesses

  • Direction and guidelines for clergy, for parish life and for individuals
  • The work of the Church now
  • Voices for change
  • Finding the courage to respond in the saints and history of the Church
  • The strength to respond in the beauty, the power, the love of God always present in Creation
  • The Way to respond in the Way of the Cross (non-violent, kenotic, co-suffering, love)

 

Santa Rosa, California -  a still from Divine Liturgy 

Santa Rosa, California -  a still from Divine Liturgy 

Kwethluk, Alaska-  a still from our footage interview with Fr Martin


Crestwood, NY -  a still from our footage interview with Fr Chad, President of St Vladimir's Seminary

What We Need 

  • We are asking for 50k USD to expand this film's reach and impact. 
  • This will go toward 1) Location filming. 2) Editing and sound engineering. 3) Distribution. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will go to editing and distribution. 

 

The Impact

  • This film takes an intimate look at what His All Holiness, the Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew, has called the defining problem of our time. With only a decade left to radically decrease our emissions (and effectively change every aspect of our lives), it's an urgent call back to stewardship and prayer. 
  • This is a film about beauty, ecology, theology, sanctity and our relationship to the natural world. Always, it is about the radiant living icon of the face of God in creation. As such, it is unprecedented and deeply necessary (see more below). 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us spread the word! Follow along on Instagram. 
  • Follow our progress and share our story on the website and the blog!
  • Email us if you would like to volunteer, or if you want us to come film at your church! aloha@faceofgodfilm.com

 

New York City -  a still from our interview with Nick Anton at The Greek Orthodox Archdiocese

More about the film

The Face of God is a film about God and nature, faith and climate change, the experience of Orthodox communities around the world facing and experiencing changes in their lives now; this is a film about beauty, ecology, theology, sanctity, our relationship to the natural world, love, asceticism, and always it is about the radiant living icon of the face of God in creation. We are showcasing our most important Church voices, highest ranking hierarchs, scientists, politicians, lay leaders, theologians, and communities around the world, and gathering the witness of the whole church on the defining issue of our time.

Produced by The Orthodox Fellowship of the Transfiguration, and written and directed by Fr Kaleeg Hainsworth, the Face of God will be released world-wide on September 1st, 2019. Join us here for footage, news, interviews, and to follow the global journey of this film through the wealth, beauty, and transformative power of our Church’s witness to nature, climate change, and ecological stewardship. We are making this film with love, prayer, personal sacrifice, and with integrity. We would all dearly love your support and prayer.

 

Northern California -  a still from our footage exploring creation as a revelation of God
 
Grand Central Station -  a still from our footage exploring human systems and ecosystems
story_txt:
About:

This film is being produced by The Orthodox Fellowship of the Transfiguration, which has been proclaiming the ecological mission of the Orthodox Church for 20 years.


The Face of God bears witness to a critical issue at a critical time (more about the project here). 
All contributions will pay for travel expenses and editing fees -- and allow the team to continue to gather stories from a wide and representative swath of Orthodox Christians both in the US and around the world.
A 60 minute, 30 minute, and a 5 minute version of The Face of God will be realized.

 

Northern California-  a still from our footage exploring ecosystems and biodiversity 
CONTENTS
The Living Icon of the Face of God

Orthodox Theology of Creation
The Liturgy and Creation/Nature
Sacramental Ecology
God’s relationship to creation / creation’s relationship to God
The face of God in creation
The world is charged with the grandeur of God
Love-beauty-Christ
The earth as prophet
Listening to our co-creation

Ecosystem Health is Human Health

Nature as ecological and spiritual relationship
The healthy ecosystem
The human place in the ecosystem
The earth system
The human impact
Climate change
The challenges of a changing climate air-water-food-health-migration

Metanoia

Accepting the times - Godly vs ungodly grief
Responding as a Church / Responding as an Orthodox Christian
Returning to an Orthodox praxis on earth
Transforming the heart transfigures the cosmos
But the problem is big, and I am only an individual
What the ascetic and lenten teachings of the Church reveal about how to live in these times
Becoming stewards and priests
“We can live very well upon the earth…”
Living liturgically is living ecologically

A Cloud of Witnesses

Direction and guidelines for clergy, for parish life and for individuals
The work of the Church now
Voices for change
Finding the courage to respond in the saints and history of the Church
The strength to respond in the beauty, the power, the love of God always present in Creation
The Way to respond in the Way of the Cross (non-violent, kenotic, co-suffering, love)

 

Santa Rosa, California -  a still from Divine Liturgy 

Santa Rosa, California -  a still from Divine Liturgy 

Kwethluk, Alaska-  a still from our footage interview with Fr Martin

Crestwood, NY -  a still from our footage interview with Fr Chad, President of St Vladimir's Seminary

What We Need 

We are asking for 50k USD to expand this film's reach and impact. 
This will go toward 1) Location filming. 2) Editing and sound engineering. 3) Distribution. 
If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will go to editing and distribution. 


 
The Impact

This film takes an intimate look at what His All Holiness, the Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew, has called the defining problem of our time. With only a decade left to radically decrease our emissions (and effectively change every aspect of our lives), it's an urgent call back to stewardship and prayer. 

This is a film about beauty, ecology, theology, sanctity and our relationship to the natural world. Always, it is about the radiant living icon of the face of God in creation. As such, it is unprecedented and deeply necessary (see more below). 


 
Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word! Follow along on Instagram. 
Follow our progress and share our story on the website and the blog!
Email us if you would like to volunteer, or if you want us to come film at your church! aloha@faceofgodfilm.com



 

New York City -  a still from our interview with Nick Anton at The Greek Orthodox Archdiocese
More about the film
The Face of God is a film about God and nature, faith and climate change, the experience of Orthodox communities around the world facing and experiencing changes in their lives now; this is a film about beauty, ecology, theology, sanctity, our relationship to the natural world, love, asceticism, and always it is about the radiant living icon of the face of God in creation. We are showcasing our most important Church voices, highest ranking hierarchs, scientists, politicians, lay leaders, theologians, and communities around the world, and gathering the witness of the whole church on the defining issue of our time.
Produced by The Orthodox Fellowship of the Transfiguration, and written and directed by Fr Kaleeg Hainsworth, the Face of God will be released world-wide on September 1st, 2019. Join us here for footage, news, interviews, and to follow the global journey of this film through the wealth, beauty, and transformative power of our Church’s witness to nature, climate change, and ecological stewardship. We are making this film with love, prayer, personal sacrifice, and with integrity. We would all dearly love your support and prayer.

 

Northern California -  a still from our footage exploring creation as a revelation of God
 

Grand Central Station -  a still from our footage exploring human systems and ecosystems

story:
Gisette

As a group we have been making films at Solent University for the past 3 years and we want to make this film the best one yet. We are raising money for:

- Locations

- Costumes

- Actors

- Props 

- And marketing.

We aim to raise £1500 however if we gain more that will be incredible.

We know this is a lot to ask so we are offering various rewards and gifts in exchange for your support. Ranging from a digital copy of the film up to tickets for a special premiere event in the summer. More details can be found further down our campaign. 

Even if you can't donate, please share our campaign on social media and help spread the word about Gisette.

 

(left to right)

Kheamah Powell - Production Designer 

Becky Dennis - Producer

Aarif Chumber-Ali - Sound Designer

Calum Matthews - Director

Liam Calvert - Writer 

Brandon ODonovan - Director of Photography

Matt Liechti - Editor 

Charlie Richards - Camera Operator

 "I have always been fascinated by World War II, the atrocities and barbarity that took place create complex narratives. I want to create a film that depicts the brutality and horror of war in the most realistic way possible. "- Calum Matthews (Director)

"We want to portray our story with as much authenticity as possible, and therefore we chose to look at other pieces of media for inspiration on certain shot types and the visual style as a whole. Son Of Saul (2015) is a major influence on the style we want to replicate, as shots are focused on the lead character with a heavy depth of field masking the background, which allows the story to heavily focus on our characters than the setting around them. We try to steer heavily from action sequences as we would rather show the human side of war, rather than the glorification of it." - Charlie Richards (Camera operator)

"It is really important to me to ensure the film reflects the look of the 1940s. After thoroughly researching, the costumes, props and set design will all collaboratively show what France was like in the middle of world war 2, and be true to the time period."- Kheamah Powell (Production Designer)

"For me sound design is so important to Gisette, due to the use of silence. This is in a quiet area during WW2 although that only intensifies the suspense ad tension. Therefore the juxtaposed moments from the 'calm before the storm' and the instant loud gun firing makes for a fantastic moment of surprise. Not just that use of silence from the drama creates so much tension keeping viewers immersed throughout".- Aarif Cumber- Ali (Sound Designer)

story:
"In Praise of Love" is a participatory, social-cultural documentary discussing the topic of love. Potrero is a village on a desert plateau of the Mexican state San Luis Potosi. In addition to being physically isolated, the village has no internet access, no landline or cell-phone coverage.

The perseverance of the population in their attempts to preserve their lives in a place they inherited from their ancestors, outside of time and space but still not completely devoid of social pressures, stirred in me a strong and precise allegory of what happens to each of us as we attempt to preserve our small, intimate worlds in this moment of history.

Potrero teenagers accept my idea to enact Shakespeare’s Romeo and Juliet. In hands of adolescents, the story of young love becomes a medium for the participants to tell their own story. Their attempts and progress in presenting the characters build the language of this film. At the other hand, in the hands of adolescents, close in age to the tragedy’s protagonists, Shakespeare’s work unveils meanings that are mostly lost in the numerous existing interpretations. It becomes a coming of age story, unrestricted by the area in which it was created. Through the attempts of our protagonists to present their peers tragedy becomes a medium that gives them a chance to express, directly or indirectly, their fears, desires, problems and dreams. 

I use the observational study of movement as my fundamental method. Two processes, the learned, established text and the improvisation of its physical interpretation are placed in a mutual context. I expect that its dialectics will bring endless information on the attempts we call communication, translation, understanding.
 

 

The scenes of the tragedy will be filmed in wide, static shots. The presence of the camera is not hidden but is not emphasized either.

Inside of this frame we seek the elements of an intimate world, the uniqueness of which is, at the same time, both the space for mutual differences and the basis for mutual understanding.

 

This project was supported by Creative Europe Media

Film Center of Serbia

story:
My name is Cory Xenos.  I attended The University of Kansas for Theatre/Film.  I found my forte to be directing, but I gained a vast knowledge of all parts of the creative process.  I've lived in LA for about 7 years, and am ready to use my voice and get behind the camera for my own project. By contributing to the campaign, you will be helping a longtime dream of filmmaking come true.  I believe I have an important and original story to tell.  Let's make it happen!

We are asking for $3000 for this project.  It is low budget, but we believe we can make an amazing film for this amount.  The goal is flexible, so we will receive the funds even if we don't quite make our goal.  The funds would go to pre-production, post production, cast, crew, festival entry fees and equipment. 

There are some amazing perks to grab if you would like to help make our film a reality.  We are featuring HD digital copies of the film, an amazing Invisible Struggle t-shirt,  There is an opportunity to get a special Skype call and to be an associate producer/producer/executive producer.

I believe this video will resonate with a lot of people dealing with depression.  I want the video to help those who are feeling alone, and to help urge friends and family members to reach out to loved ones going through the same thing.

We are set to film for one day in July.  If any mishaps occur, we would need one day to reshoot.  

If you can't donate money, you can still help us! Word of mouth is so important for our story.  Help us share the word to as many people as possible.  Tweet it, repost it, share it on facebook.  The more people that are informed about our campaign, the better chance we have at making this a reality.  Thank you all so much.

story:
Short Summary

It's 1986 and Alyson, a young aspiring model, will do anything to find success in the modeling world. After coming across a casting call she is finally given the chance to shine. 

1986 Vogue. 

While coming up with the concept for this film I wanted to create not only a compelling story, but a compelling visual landscape. To get this "vibe" across, our team will be looking to use anamorphic glass paired with vibrant color lighting to truly showcase the neon era of the 80's.

  • This campaign has been put into action so we can make Vogue the best film it can be. 
  • By raising more money we will be able to create a more authentic and clean cut film.

 

Why fund this totally rad film?

Vogue may just seem like another student film, however, our crew is highly dedicated to creating a work of art unlike any other. Coming from a small university in central Florida we have learned how to create quality and original films without the support of a looming top tier film school.

  • To make this film possible we are looking to crowdsource our budget. To make "Vogue" a reality we are asking for $5000.
    • This total amount is enough for us to create the film without restrictions.
    • The budget will allocate money towards the following. 
      • Equipment Rentals
      • Production Design
      • Costuming
      • Makeup
      • Score/Music
      • Locations
      • Craft Services/food
      • Production Expendables
      • Actor Expenses

PERKS

Obviously, everyone loves "free stuff." Along with donating to this project you have the ability to receive some pretty sweet stuff. Check out the sick perks on the right of this page!

The Impact

 By donating to this campaign you are providing a path for the worlds future filmmakers to show off their talents and creative stories that otherwise may go unnoticed. 

Your money is in good hands.

Last year my crew and cast of less than eight people was able to create a film in a weekend on virtually no budget. This film went on to sweep Southeastern University's film festival taking home 9/14 total awards.

Risks?

The best part to funding this project is you are guaranteed to see the film by December 2018! Our crew has no choice but to make this film a reality or we will fail our film thesis.

Can't afford to donate?

That's okay! You can help by spreading the word and sharing our campaign on your social media and by word of mouth.

story:
Who am I?

My name is Natércia Lameiro and I was born in a little town in Portugal called Leiria.

Since I was a baby I attended music, theater and dance classes. During my free time I usually do volunteer work, play the accordion, piano, guitar or harp, write, do photography and paint.

Professionally I am a dancer for the "Concerts for Babies" project by the MUSICALMENTE company, give regular classes of tradicional dance and teach workshops in festivals. I have a folk band called NATuRA for which I play, sing and compose. To add to this I work as an independent filmmaker.

After graduating high school in Arts Matters I am concluding my bachelor in the Superior School for Theatre and Cinema of Lisbon. My most significant cinematographic works are "Anna", "Zemlya" and "Assobializo". "Anna" was selected for the Estilhaços festival in 2016 and "Assobializo" was competing at the Leiria Film Fest and at the Short Cutz Figueiró dos Vinhos. I've also worked as second camera assistant in movies like "No Trace Of Accelerator" from Emily Ward and for the documentary "Mulheres de Água Salgada" directed by Raquel Teixeira.

As a Film Director

I am very interested in the theme of Identity. Because of that, I like to build my stories around people that I know and that inspire me. Those people I try to preserve on screen. Through their characters, and their way of being, but also through their names. If my actress is Matilde then the character shall be Matilde!

Since my high school I really love and care for Art Direction, I specially have a strong passion for paper as a prop material. It started when I decided to do my first short movie, before enrolling in university. My friend scenographer Carla and I ended up using it to create scenarios and even clothing to fulfill the ideas I had. Was it a good movie? Well, I think any diretor who does her or his first movie will end up with something different from what they had in mind. One thing surprised me, however: The paper costumes and scenarios turned out to work incredibly well.  It was with this short film that character Matilde was born.

   " MATILDE" 2014 - Making Of
 
Later in Cinema School I learned more about direction, production, writing, editing and above all cinematography which was the subject of my degree. 
 
Completing my degree, I realized that I wanted to make a movie that can represent me as a diretor on screen. So, I picked up this script that I had been writing for about four years and decided to turn it into a movie. Actually it was a funny story that convinced me to make this film. I was on a bus when I found an old friend of mine from cinema school who had just returned from Cannes, where he had a film competing. We talked and eventually he asked me what I was doing. I told him that I had been writing a movie for a few years and that I kept dreaming about it. It seemed that the scenes were being played in my head. It seemed that the movie was talking to me. The bus stopped and my friend left wishing me the best of luck. I carried on with my bus travel until the lady sitting in front of me gets up and turned to me: "You know young lady, if that dream follows you for that long it must have a meaning. Your heart is telling you that you really want to do this. So DO IT. If it goes wrong at least you've tried. If it goes well even better. But don't delay it anymore" And she went off the bus. After that last push I knew that I just had to make this film .
 

What is this movie about?

Theme

"Matilde and the Invisible Bird" is a movie that explores themes like teenagehood, childhood and family. Inside the movie we have other secondary plots that explore the creativity between a child and his mother in writing a bedtime story, the relationship between brothers, friends, the community and the environment. 

Storyline

It's bedtime for Marco so his mother and him invent a bedtime story about a girl named Matilde. But, as they go deeper into the story, the characters start coming to life, beginning to make their own choices and changing the final destiny of the history.

Sinopsis

Marco and his mother invent a bedtime story. Matilde is our main character and is on her summer vacation. She likes to spend her time riding her bicycle and making picnics with her friends. During one such picnic, Matilde hears a bird whistling like she never heard before. She knows a lot about birds but she can't recall what kind of species this one might be. Later that night Matilde dreams about the whistling bird and a small paper bicycle. On the following day, to her big surprise, Matilde finds the exact same bicycle from her dream standing right on her front door. From that moment on Matilde's life takes an even stranger path. Gradually Marco and his mother start losing control over the plot, while the characters inside the story gain it. And I will stop here because I do not want to spoil the rest of the plot but lets just say that the big challenge for the characters inside the story, Marco and his mother is to figure out what kind of bird is that and what is its relation to the tiny paper bicycle. 

 

What is the Visual and Artistic concept of the movie?

The action is none verbal, this is, only the Mother's and Marco's voice narrate the story. The acting characters have no voice.

Usually bedtime stories come in books for parents to read to their children. Books that are made out of paper. I remember, as a child, that my favorite were the ones that had 3D illustrations made out of origami, that would pop up right after we turned a page. Picking up this ideia, I decided to create an universe parallel to our reality where everything made by human hand, like clothes, furniture or bicycles, is made out of paper, completely or partially. More natural things like trees, the soil, streets or flowers resemble from our world, without any artistic man made intervention. 

Three movies that inspired "Matilde and the invisible bird" are:

"Kubo and the two strings" - Travis Knight (the type of narration, the use of origami technic)

"The illusionist" - Sylvain Chomet (a movie non verbal, the relationships)

"Surprise" - Paulo Patrício (the type of narration)

 

Where will the funds go?

When you finish cinema university you actually have a lot of fresh contacts of people who might be interested to work with you. Usually they help you, but then we end up with a bad habit, which is, doing movies by favors and always finding excuses for not paying the crew: "Well ... I am only 22 years old, I have no money, so please I just ask for a little of your time",  "You will not be paid, but at least you will be able to show your artistic vision", or, " I have a small budget but it is only for costumes, transportation and food".

Yes, some of these things might be true, and it's very difficult to be able to pay your crew members when you only are a recent graduated cinema student, but that doesn't mean that you cannot find a way, even if it only is symbolic, to pay them at least something for their precious help.

So, my main goal with this campaign is to get funds to be able to pay my team and break the circle of working for free in your first years as an artist.

Here is a simple graphic of how I would divided the funds:

Ways You Can Help

  • Doing a donation;
  • Sharing the campaign with others that might be interested in backing this project;
  • Show your interest and support, now and after the movie is done;
  • Share some of your expertise and interests with us:
    • Do you know of Paper Techniques that might be useful? We have a set of ideas for building scenarios, clothes, etc. but more are always welcome.
    • Other things you might find useful for this project you might want to advice us.

 

If you wish to know more about my work, my portfolio, my contact, and an article made by the phoblographer on my photography work are listed below.

PORTFOLIO
https://nlameiro.wixsite.com/bucolica/fullscree...

CONTACT
https://www.facebook.com/natercia.lameiro

INTERVIEW PHOBLOGRAPHER
https://nlameiro.wixsite.com/bucolica/

   " MATILDE" 2014 - Making Of

 
Later in Cinema School I learned more about direction, production, writing, editing and above all cinematography which was the subject of my degree. 
 
Completing my degree, I realized that I wanted to make a movie that can represent me as a diretor on screen. So, I picked up this script that I had been writing for about four years and decided to turn it into a movie. Actually it was a funny story that convinced me to make this film. I was on a bus when I found an old friend of mine from cinema school who had just returned from Cannes, where he had a film competing. We talked and eventually he asked me what I was doing. I told him that I had been writing a movie for a few years and that I kept dreaming about it. It seemed that the scenes were being played in my head. It seemed that the movie was talking to me. The bus stopped and my friend left wishing me the best of luck. I carried on with my bus travel until the lady sitting in front of me gets up and turned to me: "You know young lady, if that dream follows you for that long it must have a meaning. Your heart is telling you that you really want to do this. So DO IT. If it goes wrong at least you've tried. If it goes well even better. But don't delay it anymore" And she went off the bus. After that last push I knew that I just had to make this film .
 
What is this movie about?

Theme
"Matilde and the Invisible Bird" is a movie that explores themes like teenagehood, childhood and family. Inside the movie we have other secondary plots that explore the creativity between a child and his mother in writing a bedtime story, the relationship between brothers, friends, the community and the environment. 
Storyline
It's bedtime for Marco so his mother and him invent a bedtime story about a girl named Matilde. But, as they go deeper into the story, the characters start coming to life, beginning to make their own choices and changing the final destiny of the history.
Sinopsis
Marco and his mother invent a bedtime story. Matilde is our main character and is on her summer vacation. She likes to spend her time riding her bicycle and making picnics with her friends. During one such picnic, Matilde hears a bird whistling like she never heard before. She knows a lot about birds but she can't recall what kind of species this one might be. Later that night Matilde dreams about the whistling bird and a small paper bicycle. On the following day, to her big surprise, Matilde finds the exact same bicycle from her dream standing right on her front door. From that moment on Matilde's life takes an even stranger path. Gradually Marco and his mother start losing control over the plot, while the characters inside the story gain it. And I will stop here because I do not want to spoil the rest of the plot but lets just say that the big challenge for the characters inside the story, Marco and his mother is to figure out what kind of bird is that and what is its relation to the tiny paper bicycle. 
 
What is the Visual and Artistic concept of the movie?

The action is none verbal, this is, only the Mother's and Marco's voice narrate the story. The acting characters have no voice.
Usually bedtime stories come in books for parents to read to their children. Books that are made out of paper. I remember, as a child, that my favorite were the ones that had 3D illustrations made out of origami, that would pop up right after we turned a page. Picking up this ideia, I decided to create an universe parallel to our reality where everything made by human hand, like clothes, furniture or bicycles, is made out of paper, completely or partially. More natural things like trees, the soil, streets or flowers resemble from our world, without any artistic man made intervention. 
Three movies that inspired "Matilde and the invisible bird" are:
"Kubo and the two strings" - Travis Knight (the type of narration, the use of origami technic)
"The illusionist" - Sylvain Chomet (a movie non verbal, the relationships)
"Surprise" - Paulo Patrício (the type of narration)
 

Where will the funds go?
When you finish cinema university you actually have a lot of fresh contacts of people who might be interested to work with you. Usually they help you, but then we end up with a bad habit, which is, doing movies by favors and always finding excuses for not paying the crew: "Well ... I am only 22 years old, I have no money, so please I just ask for a little of your time",  "You will not be paid, but at least you will be able to show your artistic vision", or, " I have a small budget but it is only for costumes, transportation and food".
Yes, some of these things might be true, and it's very difficult to be able to pay your crew members when you only are a recent graduated cinema student, but that doesn't mean that you cannot find a way, even if it only is symbolic, to pay them at least something for their precious help.
So, my main goal with this campaign is to get funds to be able to pay my team and break the circle of working for free in your first years as an artist.
Here is a simple graphic of how I would divided the funds:


Ways You Can Help

Doing a donation;
Sharing the campaign with others that might be interested in backing this project;
Show your interest and support, now and after the movie is done;
Share some of your expertise and interests with us:
Do you know of Paper Techniques that might be useful? We have a set of ideas for building scenarios, clothes, etc. but more are always welcome.
Other things you might find useful for this project you might want to advice us.



 
If you wish to know more about my work, my portfolio, my contact, and an article made by the phoblographer on my photography work are listed below.
PORTFOLIOhttps://nlameiro.wixsite.com/bucolica/fullscree...
CONTACThttps://www.facebook.com/natercia.lameiro
INTERVIEW PHOBLOGRAPHERhttps://nlameiro.wixsite.com/bucolica/

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tay Montgomery, creator of The Adventure of Teddy Love. At the age of 8, I wrote my first screenplay and never looked back. My influences are Chris Rock,  F Gary Gray & Robert Townsend. Since 2015 my production company Nightowl TV strictly created content for producers and production companies for purchase. As of January 2018, Heather Nicholas and I kept The Adventures of Teddy Love for ourselves to develop. It took my co-writer, Heather Nicholas and I almost a year just to revise it. 

As of today, we have the script completed, attached an executive producer and director. Our partner Prodigium Pictures, a social impact production company based out of Los Angeles, is ready to go into production. However, Nashville is know for it's music, not film. Filmmakers in this area have to rely on personal funding for projects (Hey Dad!) 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least 30k to finish production of The Adventures of Teddy Love.                          As you can see we have big plans for the potential television series!

Your donations will go towards:

  • Legal Fees
  • Cast / Crew
  • Insurance
  • Equipment
  • Food & Supplies
  • Set & Wardrobe

In return, our sponsors have helped us create AMAZING rewards for those who choose to donate. From a social media shoutout to becoming a producer on the film, you will benefit greatly when you join the Teddy Love family!

The Impact

We support social impact projects! We'd love to include you! Hollywood is not only lacking in original content but it aso suffers from lack of diversity. The passion for film doesn't only reside in Los Angeles, New York and Atlanta, but nationally.  

Help us create jobs for minority cast, crew and even local business that normally wouldn't have an oppurtunity like this in the south. Help us contribute to television  in a positive way while bringing another hit series to Nashville. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. We plan to distribute this nationally. If you'd like to sponsor your services, email us. If you can't donate or sponsor, spread the word! Anything and everything helps!

story:
My name's Rhyannon, I'm a British filmmaker. I've fallen deeply under the spell of Bounce music in New Orleans.

Bounce music is a New Orleans offshoot of late 80's hip hop. Cut off from mainstream America the city cultivated it's own original beats and high energy regional dance styles. As today's incarnation retaining the New Orleans Jazz spirit, Bounce is thriving right now and encompasses all the hypnotic sounds and spirit of the 'Big Easy'.

 

 

I first heard of Bounce with a friend while in an old pub in London. He played me a Bounce beat. It had a strange energy to it. He showed me some leaders in the Bounce game, such as Big Freedia and Sissy Nobby. They were refreshingly original characters; upfront, brass, transgender rappers from the ghetto whose creativity and mesmerizing 'twerking' aka 'shakin' dance style blew me away.

Inspired, I wanted to learn everything I could, but couldn't find the story. The only mainstream narrative from the projects was one of violence and fear, yet these were the streets where Jazz was created. What about the people, the culture and their voice?

Quitting my job I went on a one woman mission to find the heart of the beat, uncover the story and create an immersive film experience for the outside world. A raw and authentic cultural celebration of life in the projects. Covering all shades of Bounce from the most passionate sweaty dancefloor highs to the artists private fears and personal stories.

It's taken a village to make it. I collaborated with an extraordinary array of talented local artists: filmmakers, rappers, musicians, dancers and graffiti artists. One by one we dug out the Bounce legends past and present, uncovering lost footage, old mixtapes and anecdotes, enabling THIS incredible STORY to be told.

After 3 years we struck gold and convinced local Bounce legend, DJ Jubilee, aka 'King of Bounce' to come on-board and narrate the movie. Becoming the star of the movie, he would guide us into his world, on an audio-visual ride through the story of Bounce from the 80's through to today.

Resulting in a story woven with beautiful footage, a killer Bounce soundtrack and legendary artist's stories in a call and response style true to the Bounce spirit.

 

 

 

YOU ALREADY KNOW resonates deeply with me. Meeting these artists has changed my perspective, showing me first-hand how important it is to express yourself, fearlessly; to dance, to let go in the moment and to have community. Most importantly, it has opened my eyes to the New Orleans philosophy of actively choosing the positive over the negative. Let the good times roll, and....even in the darkest hour, get up and shake that booty.

Offering viewers around the world the exclusive, niche opportunity to enter their worlds, for a life affirming story of life in the city. Packed with history, flavour, unprecedented characters and regional style.

Life, death and dat B.E.A.T in New Orleans.

 

MY EXPERIENCE

I'm a seasoned Producer, working in London for ten years across feature films and producing music videos for bands including The Rolling Stones, Elton John, Sigur Ros, Red Hot Chilli Peppers and Rihanna, working with large budgets from concept to completion.

This is my self-funded Directorial debut (gulp).

NOW WHAT?

Now, five years in the making, and a lot of blood sweat and tears, it's gone above and beyond what we could have wished. Having worked unpaid on this project and pulling a lot of strings. We're at a pivotal turning point. The creative 90 minute edit is in place and it looks incredible, but we're at a standstill and cannot complete this movie without your support.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU'LL GET

Funding is needed to complete post-production, clear music licenses and prepare the film for worldwide distribution.
All of your financial support will go directly to completing the forthcoming post-production stage including:
- Perfecting the Final Edit - 2 weeks
- Creating Graphics and Animations - 9 days
- Sculpting an Original sound Design and Mix - 2 weeks
 -Legals - 3 months
- Music clearances and Content Licensing - 3 months

WE ARE SO CLOSE BUT WE CANNOT COMPLETE THIS PICTURE WITHOUT YOUR SUPPORT.

Every penny you contribute counts in helping us bring YOU ALREADY KNOW to the you and the world, preserving Bounce culture forever while spreading that feel-good around the planet....hopefully getting a few more asses shakin'!

THE MORE FUNDING THE BETTER

For this campaign, we are asking for the minimum amount needed to complete post-production and broadcast the picture.

The more funding we can raise, the richer we can make it; more can be achieved creatively and we can push distribution and marketing further giving it greater outreach.

WHAT ELSE? THE FINE PRINT.

Should we not reach our entire goal, the funds raised will go into getting the edit perfected, ready to be packaged for distribution.

Should we go in to profit following the release, profits will go straight back into the city's youth program, The Benjamin Foundation.

We want the film to reach the widest audience possible across platform. We are in talks with the major broadcast channels and distributors who are keen to see a finished edit. We would like to see YOU ALREADY KNOW licensed for broadcast and VOD platforms such as Netflix.

The hardest logistical hurdles are now overcome, from gaining access, filming over 30 interviews and gaining beautifully shot 4K high definition footage in hard to reach locations, to getting the edit in place.

Your contribution will help us get over the next big hurdle!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the word. Tell your friends, spread the hype.

Use the Indiegogo share tools. Follow us on Facebook or Instagram.

INSTAGRAM: @beatgoesontv

FACEBOOK: @beatgoeson.tv

Any creatives that would like to get involved, PR, production or distribution professionals please get in touch at rhyannonhanbury@yahoo.co.uk.

 

Thank you. With your help we can make this happen!

 

Rhyannon.x

story:
Short Summary 

Picture this: It's night - an elderly woman screams in shock and runs in panic around her house, while an old, naked man lies dead in his armchair, in front of a gay website.

This is a true story. But it is also the beginning of our movie, inspired by these true events. 

'La Petite Mort' focuses on Irene, the widow, who needs to deal with the uncomfortable and shocking discovery of her husband's hidden sexual orientation in the upcoming days after his demise. 

Feeling betrayed, astonished and shocked, she has to face a dilemma: should she tell her family and friends about it, drastically changing the consideration they had of her husband, or should she preserve the secret just as he did throughout his life?

The situation gets worse when, during the funeral, his secret lover turns up: it's Chastity, a flamboyant drag queen...

Trust me here: if you want to know more, if you are not afraid of the unconventional and of breaking boundaries, you'd better watch the rest rather than read it.

 

Our Team - A few of our creative minds!

Director: I am Jack Salvadori, and I'm the captain of this ship. 'La Petite Mort' is my vision, and I believe in its potential with all my soul. When I casually bumped into this true story one year ago, I was shocked by its intensity, its surrealism, its emotional drive, and thus its cinematic power. I couldn't help but laughing, but at the same time I was feeling terrible about it. The dramatic charge brought by the woman's burning pain in finding her husband's corpse, combined with the irony of the man's pathetic death, authomatically leads to a unique, cynic and tragicomic situation.

Everyone has their own secrets, but the idea that they will all be revealed on the verge of death, when you cannot hide them anymore, is simply terrifying.

I want to entertain the public, providing unconventional comedies intrinsic with reality, immersed in a very dark humour. I love to put my characters in difficult, awkward circumstances, and this time more than ever the audience will struggle with them. 

In terms of style, this will be a Swedish comedy... shot in the UK!

Director of Photography: Greetings! My name is James Bendkowski and I shall be the cinematographer for 'La Petite Mort'! Like many on this project I have also worked with Jack previously on 'The Liar' and enjoyed the way in which our vision materialised in front of us! I think the project stands to be a wonderfully dark take on death and what a person leaves behind. I look forward to seeing the project grow and urge you to help it become a reality

Screenwriter: Hello! I’m Laurence Smither, the writer of La Petite Mort and I am very excited to share with you, this new and exciting project! Working with Jack previously on 'The Liar', we have created a great creative relationship which has allowed us to work together on boundary-pushing projects. 'La Petite Mort' is no exception and shall prove to be our most ambitious work to date. Please help us realise this bizarre little film, so we can continue to do what we love and bring you into our world!

Set Designer: Hi there! I'm Vinay Chambore and I'm dying to be part of this amazing production! Working with the same team is a dream, and the idea of setting something so tragic in a comical way is beyond exciting!

Cast: 

Michael Lipman, protagonist of 'The Liar', will play Seth, Irene's mentally disabled son, affected by Savant syndrome.

Chris Bearne, co-protagonist of 'The Liar', will play Mr. Mortimer, the funeral director. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

£3000 is our goal. Why?

A film is more expensive than what it may seem...

We will shoot 'La Petite Mort' in just 4 days, and in terms of locations, we need to rent a house and a church. Thus, we will need to transport cast, crew and equipment over there.

Most importantly, we need amazing actors to properly bring the script to life.

And let's not forget that we must stage a fake funeral, so we will need some extras, lots of props like a coffin and flowers, and costumes. 

And of course, we need to cater the cast & crew, who apparently work much better if they are fed!

But to thank you for your generosity, we got some exciting and unique perks for you! From copies of the film to some of the props we actually used, from special screenings to VIP festival invitations! And don't miss the chance to get a unique picture of a crew member of your choice dressed as a drag queen!

In the unfortunate case we don't reach our goal (because you have not been generous enough...), we will not  yield! The funds would be distributed to what we have listed, but in essence we would need to compromise and lower our quality expectations... which would really be a shame for this amazing project. But, regardless, we will do our best with what we have.

 

The Impact - A Short Film with a Huge Value:

With 'La Petite Mort', we are not afraid to openly address some very controversial topics, giving a voice to whom is usually cast aside.

First of all, the protagonist of this story is Irene, and we are proud to present such an original strong, female character. Unfortunately, elderly actresses are often confined to minor, secondary and flat roles, while we are giving our character 360° depth. 

This is a short celebrating diversity, where the notion of identity is questioned in every frame. In the age where Coming Out is celebrated, we explore the impact of someone who has not been brave enough, and perhaps never fully accepted his sexual orientation. But his decision to hide his true identity has drastic consequences on the lives of the people around him. 

Our previous film 'The Liar' has been selected and won in more than 15 international film festivals, including the Southern Shorts Awards (Best Film), Orlando Film Festival, Fargo Film Festival, and Los Angeles Independent Film Awards. If it managed to be successfull is thanks to your support.

But while 'The Liar' is a more commercial production, 'La Petite Mort' is addressing a more selected, mature audience. 

That is why your contribution can really make a difference: with the appropriate production value, festivals will be fighting for it!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!

Get the word out and make some noise about 'La Petite Mort' and this crazy campaign! Share, share, and share again!

We need you to make this film happen, so thank you for all your help.


Jack & 'La Petite Mort' Team

And don't miss the chance to get a unique picture of a crew member of your choice dressed as a drag queen!

The funds would be distributed to what we have listed, but in essence we would need to compromise and lower our quality expectations... which would really be a shame for this amazing project. But, regardless, we will do our best with what we have.
 

The Impact - A Short Film with a Huge Value:
With 'La Petite Mort', we are not afraid to openly address some very controversial topics, giving a voice to whom is usually cast aside.
First of all, the protagonist of this story is Irene, and we are proud to present such an original strong, female character. Unfortunately, elderly actresses are often confined to minor, secondary and flat roles, while we are giving our character 360° depth. 
This is a short celebrating diversity, where the notion of identity is questioned in every frame. In the age where Coming Out is celebrated, we explore the impact of someone who has not been brave enough, and perhaps never fully accepted his sexual orientation. But his decision to hide his true identity has drastic consequences on the lives of the people around him. 
Our previous film 'The Liar' has been selected and won in more than 15 international film festivals, including the Southern Shorts Awards (Best Film), Orlando Film Festival, Fargo Film Festival, and Los Angeles Independent Film Awards. If it managed to be successfull is thanks to your support.
But while 'The Liar' is a more commercial production, 'La Petite Mort' is addressing a more selected, mature audience. 
That is why your contribution can really make a difference: with the appropriate production value, festivals will be fighting for it!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!
Get the word out and make some noise about 'La Petite Mort' and this crazy campaign! Share, share, and share again!
We need you to make this film happen, so thank you for all your help.
Jack & 'La Petite Mort' Team

story:
Welcome!

Hello and welcome to the Indiegogo campaign for I Believe! This short film was written by Alyson Seeger who is also directing and producing. This is Aly's first directing project since graduating Columbia College Chicago in 2010. She has produced other shorts since graduation, including "Grim," and "Elf Employment".

Aly feels the film industry needs a stronger female presence, and this is her way of contributing to that. Additionally, she is a member of the LGBT community and would like her film to represent that community in a positive way.

Aly has been working on this project for four years, and is finally ready to finish it. As you probably know, it isn't easy nor cheap to make a film, so one of the main struggles for this project has always been funding. If you contribute, you are making Aly's four-year dream come true!

Inspiration

Aly was bored one day, yet feeling creative. She looked up some quotes to see if anything would inspire her. She found the Audrey Hepburn quote you see above, and this beautiful tale following two women through their ups and downs in life is what came out. This film is unique in that it is silent with the exception of a voiceover reading that quote.

What We Need & What You Get

The main purpose of this Indiegogo campaign is to raise enough funds to produce the film and send it on the film festival circuit.

Some examples of the things we are spending the money on:

  • We are flying our incredible Director of Photography up from Phoenix, Arizona.
  • Hair and makeup to age the actors appropriately.
  • Purchasing beautiful wedding outfits for our two lovely brides.
  • Feeding our hungry and hard-working cast and crew.
  • The film festival submission fees that can add up quickly.

If we exceed our goal, we would like to pay our very deserving cast and crew.

To show appreciation for your donations, we have plenty of unique rewards available to those who contribute financially, including thank you postcards, the opportunity to be an extra in the film, and the opportunity to be listed as an executive producer on the film.

Risks & Challenges

One of the major challenges in producing this film is going to be finding a hospital location for the elderly versions of our characters. Additionally, it is not going to be easy to find actors who look alike enough to age our characters from young teens to elderly women.

We have hired a very qualified makeup artist who we are confident will do the job just right when it comes to aging the women appropriately. We also have an experienced casting director who will find the right fit of actors. The hospital location will be a challenge, but we are looking into finding that location as we speak!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help at all! You are certainly welcome (and encouraged) to share this link with those you feel might be able to assist in getting this project made. We appreciate every share.

story:
The Plot

The combat robot: Androktasiai is designed in good faith – to protect good people and fight against bad people, just as guns for home defense, nuclear weapons for the world peace.

However, Androktasiai is not a mindless automated combat machine. She has artificial general intelligence or AGI (the industry term for human-equivalent intelligence), which allows her to think and make her own decisions with her artificial consciousness. Thus, during her alpha version, she has already questioned her directive: who are good people and who are bad people?

How will her creators answer her question? What if they are bad people themselves? Will Androktasiai become a guardian of justice or a killing machine? This film will give you the answer.

Why Making This Film?

I strongly believe that animated films are not only children’s entertainment, but also suitable for serious themes and discussing sensitive social issues. Therefore Androktasiai is to bring a new vision to animated films by rising controversial topics. This film is also closely related to the contemporary social issues by touching on mass shooting incidents, religious conflicts and of course, potential threat from AI.

 

Inspirations & Features

Androktasiai is named after the Androktasiai (Ancient Greek: Ἀνδροκτασίαι) in Greek mythology, according to Wikipedia, they were the female personifications of manslaughter, and daughters of the goddess of strife and discord, Eris. This name hints the robot could be a potential menace. Interestingly enough, the last two characters of the word “Androktasiai” are “AI”.

Androktasiai is a robot animation featuring robot fighting, however, the protagonist, Androktasiai is different from other combat robots on-screen. She does not look ferocious like the Terminator. Instead, she has an adorable and fragile appearance. What’s more, unlike other silent killer robots, she is built with an inquiring mind, which makes her talkative and like to ask questions.

However, once the target is confirmed, Androktasiai will act in a traditional robotic way –determined and no mercy. Due to her size and durability, she tends to defeat her enemies using tactics, usually surprise attack other than head on confrontation. As you can see in the trailer, she shows her professional close-quarters shooting technique such as double tap, Mozambique drill and contact shooting.

 

About Me

My name is Yufeng Li. Feel free to call me Lincoln. I am a New York–based independent filmmaker and CG artist.

Born in China in 1990, I have been influenced by both traditional culture and modern computer graphics from childhood. I got my foot in the door in the field of CG animation at age of 10. After earning my MFA in Digital Arts Animation from Pratt Institute in 2015, I continued my animation career in New York.

I began to make my path of independent animation filmmaking in 2008, after graduating from high school. My previous notable work of animated film is You Are Not Alone (2015), with awarded or selected by more than 30 film festivals and reached around 900,000 views on YouTube. Apart from independent animated films, I also engage in many high-level commercial works of CGI. Some of my past projects include the animation of Yummiloo, Itsy Bitsy Spider, and the VFX of The Blacklist: Redemption, Bull, Orville and Underground.

My previous animated film: You Are Not Alone

https://youtu.be/q3dnux4G-jU

 

Budget Breakdown

It is well known that 3d animated films are expensive and time-consuming. Thus I need approximately $ 5,000 to complete the rest of this film. Here’s how the budget breaks down:

By donating to this campaign, your generous donation will help to make this film the best it can be. The faster the goal is reached, the earlier the final film will come out. What’s more, it will bring confidence to me and my perspective producers, which will make my future plans of animated films come true! This is my first campaign on Indiegogo and more will come!

 

Other Ways to Help

Like/share the Facebook page! 

https://www.facebook.com/AndroktasiaiAnimated/ 

Share this campaign page!

https://igg.me/at/androktasiai/x/17615092

Thank You!

story:
Hello!

Ricardo Burgos will be directing a new short film, My Wife.  Daniel Blanda, a talented New York based writer, developed this story and everyone involved is so excited about it. It's a very fun and surprising story, set in a high end restaurant in Manhattan, where two men find themselves in a situation full of tension, trying to resolve the future of their lives.

Rod Luzzi will be acting alongside with Ricardo in this short, his career is coming up right now, so we are so grateful and lucky to have him in this picture.

This is Ricardo's directorial debut in New York. As an actor for the last 10 years, he has performed in several leading roles in productions with the reassemble of the 1970's success "Dzi Croquettes", also a critical role as the antagonist for the acclaimed feature film "After the Rain".

As friends of the arts and of independent film, We are asking for your help, hoping to raise the funds to be able to tell this story the right way. 

What We Need:  $8,000 by January 1st!

We are trying to raise a minimum of $8,000 in 40 days!  We'd love to raise $10,000 to $12,000!  We know we can do it!  And we can do it with your help!

The budget specifically goes to our production and post production costs: equipment rental (camera, lights & sound), crew, permits, secure locations and festival submissions fees (which can be very expensive and that's how we get our film to be seen).

We have some really unique needs for this film, including filming on a high end restaurant in Manhattan, which makes the rental cost near absurdity. To get this film made right we need your help!  

At the end of the day, your contribution means you can say you helped get this film made, and that's pretty awesome!
 

Perks

Every single dollar helps and we appreciate everyone for whatever contribution you can make.  We wanted to add some incentives and thank people with some perks for contributing more to our campaign.

For contributions of:

  • $1 Social Media Shout Out!
     
  • $5 Private link to watch the film after it's done, before everyone else.
     
  • $10 Personalized hand written letter from the cast.
     
  • $25  Get your name listed in the "Thank You" end credits of the film.
     
  • $50 Invitation to come watch the movie in New York or Philadelphia (you pick the city).
     
  • $100 Associate Producer title card in the end of the film. 
     
  • $1000 Private Q&A with cast & producer (with drinks).
     
  • $2500 Receive an Executive Producer credit. 
     
  • $5000 or more will get you a single line Executive Producer credit.
     

The Impact

When producing an independent film, every single dollar counts.  So whether you can contribute $1 or $1,000, you will be helping us to get this movie made!  I guarantee we will get this film made and it will be something everyone will be proud to have been a part of or helped contribute to it's success!  But we need you to be awesome and contribute!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by spreading the word!  Please forward this to other art and film loving family, friends and associates via email or the great Indiegogo share tools!  

Help us make some noise about this movie!
