story:
The Story

"He will live a long lasting happy life, until he gets to know himself". Tiresias

The ancient Greek myth manifests as a derelict sacred place where the cursed by gods nymph Echo lives. Narcissus has never seen her/himself before according to Tiresias prophecy and Echo is able only to repeat what s/he hears. The game of seduction starts, Echo initially resists but they both are craving each other. Echo surrenders to Narcissus but when than happens Narcissus sees her/himself for the very first time through Echo. Her/his reflection makes her/him to eventually surrender to an im-possible self-love. Yellow and white, Echo’s tears go back to earth and Narcissus prefers to transform into the flower, the new Narcissus. Echo’s body shrivels and loses its moisture from the tears s/he is offering to earth so Narcissus can be reborn. Echo is turning into stone and s/he keeps holding the flower. The one s/he couldn’t before.

 

 

Why to support us

The 21st century has been characterised as the century of narcissistic epidemic. The number of people who suffer from narcissistic personality disorder is being increased, therefore the number of the narcissistic abuse victims.

Echo of Narcissus is a short experimental art house film in an attempt to revisit an influential myth and give a new, different interpretation, avoiding gender and old fashioned stereotypes. Narcissism is beyond the gender or sexual identity, the race and the ethnicity. It’s about the lack of mirroring, the trauma and the personality’s development. The film is a contemporary approach of the myth in an abstract, ritualistic context and emphasises in the more profound and complex issue of transformation and rebirth for both of the characters. Narcissus and Echo seek their own catharsis and resolution but the way they are doing it, is different. 

Combining Jungian theories, cinematic techniques, performance art, dance, visuals and music, we do not intend to judge or take the side of the victim or the perpetrator. We are aiming to explore through art how narcissistic behaviour works and hopefully give voice to every Echo.

 

 

Director’s note

Looking at the famous painting of Salvador Dali “The metamorphosis of Narcissus” I started asking myself how the artist approached one of the most influential myths in the history of humanity. Observing the colours and lighting, I noticed that the part after the metamorphosis looks brighter, more vivid whereas the part before, has darker shades. In addition to that and going back to the myth, I was wondering why Narcissus is transformed into a flower and not into something else. A flower means the beginning of spring, re-birth and in our days, Narcissus is offered in important occasions as a symbol of good fortune and new beginnings. That’s when I started thinking differently about the myth and its influence in our daily lives. What if the meaning is slightly different than the one we know for thousands of years? What if the roles of victim and perpetrator are not as obvious and concrete as we think they are? Why Narcissus initially seduces Echo and in the end why does he deny her love and prefers to fall for a reflection? Is Echo obsessed with her own sound reflection? Why does she keep being in pain for Narcissus, someone who hurt her feelings without mercy?

I am not in a position to give answers, but through this film I am trying to understand more about a phenomenon, which is “epidemic” and it affects the lives of many people like me, like you.

Budget distribution                 

The funding will be allocated on: 

  • Crew & Performers' fees
  • Camera & lighting equipment
  • Hiring location
  • Travel expenses & Catering
  • Construction of Set design & original costumes
  • Original music
  • Make-up effects

 

The location

An old Victorian chapel from the early 1800's in south London will be the place which will symbolise the ancient myth and the two heroes, Narcissus and Echo are going to revisit.

 

    

   

 

Cast

Inspired by Jungian theories about narcissism and the coexistence of masculine and feminine characteristics in both genders, the two characters will have an androgynous style in order to avoid gender and sexuality stereotypes.

Echo, although it’s a female character, will be impersonated by a male performer, between 20 and 30 years old. On the contrary for the role of Narcissus, a female performer will be needed at the same age with Echo. With the right make-up and costumes, the intention is to highlight the feminine and masculine characteristics of the male and female characters respectively. 

NARCISSUS: Akti M. Konstantinou

Born and raised in the Greek north countryside. Trained in Ballet with her mother as a teacher during childhood and teenage years. In 2011 she moved to Athens and started her BA in psychology at National and Kapodistrian University of Athens, whilst continuing her training in Ballet and Contemporary dance. In 2013 she auditioned for National school of dance where she was offered a place at the foundation year for the contemporary dance training. One year later she auditioned for Trinity Laban conservatoire of music and dance for the BA contemporary dance, where she is graduating in July 2018. During these years in London she has been working with lots of film makers, directors, producers mainly for short films and Video-dance including projects with Met film, CSM, Ealing studios, Royal college of Art. Akti is also developing in Choreography, on stage and in video dance as she presented her last independent project at Bonnie Bird theatre with dancers from Laban and collaborators from Trinity Laban music department and Goldsmiths. Another field that she is working on, is Fashion and Modelling as she has a contract with Bookings Models Agency with an active year of shootings and editorials including Noctis magazine and Chanel.

ECHO: Michael Wilk

Michael was born in Krakow and he is currently studying contemporary dance at Trinity and Laban Conservatoire of Music and Dance, Ba (Hons). He is trained in techniques such as ballet, release, Cunningham, Graham, contact improvisation. Previously he studied at Krakow's Dance theatre and Art colour ballet studio in Poland. Michael has participated in plenty of workshops and he has performed for he Royal College of Arts, Laban theatre and krakow's night of Poetry. He is interested in acting, theatre, psychology, literature and visual arts.

 

 

 

Mood board

 

 

Who we are

 

Katerina Konstantopoulou, Director/Writer/Producer

Katerina was born in 1989 in Athens. After her BA in Film and TV studies, she moved to London and she is currently a postgraduate student at Goldsmiths University in the Producing pathway. Since, she started her studies, she has written, directed and produced two awarded short films, "Vault of Ideas", a story about an eerie stranger who wants an idea for an irrational death and "Pessoa-s", a film dedicated to the loving memory of the Portuguese poet Fernando Pessoa. She has also worked as assistant director at the theatre, video editor and photographer. Her problem is that she is stupidly romantic and suffers from need for escapism, so that's why she wants to make films which don't really depict the reality. 

EMPUSAE (Nicolas Van Meirhaeghe), Musician

With the complexity of the music, it may surprise you to find that Empusae is actually a project created by a single man, Nicolas Van Meirhaeghe aka Sal-Ocin. Empusae exercises a surreal science of structure that throbs and pulsates in an almost obsessive manner. The music is almost suggestive of a mechanical assembly line in its clock work clunks and clangs. It builds into a tense, yet haunting soundscape and rivets itself into the memory and refuses to be forgotten. It is serious music who's architecture has formed for itself a solid foundation, rather than sounding as if its trying to tear itself apart! When listening to Empusae's music, you're lost in dark melancholy, tribal electronic athmospheres and scarefull ambient rituals. Empusae continuously is music for the darkened souls, the lost ones. The style of music is like a journey from the postapocalyptic industrial and urban wastelands to the organic sounds of the wilderness in nature. The forests and woods of our fantasies. The drums evolved from rhythmic instruments to shamanic elements. Empusae became more settled, a bit calmer but never less intensive. Sphere from the woods is like ivy-soundscapes, winding up the trees from all their roots up to their crowns and in the sky. Misty fields for souls who can't decide whether to stay in this or to transcend into other worlds. It's all about the mysteries and depths of nature and the animus; silently but constantly walking the leylines of music. The quintessence of this quite alchemical Opus Magnum could be "stand your fears" as well as "no matter what you'll do, your demons will prevail". Sal-Ocin describes his music as a soundtrack for the listeners personal fantasies. Being a member of various other project such as This Morn' Omina, Tzolk'in, Project Arctic and a live member of In Slaughter Natives, Ah Cama-Sotz, IC 434, Triarii, TriOre and Sophia, Sal-Ocin isn't afraid of working together with other artists (Nick Grey, Arcana, ISN, ORE and many others).     http://empusae.com/

Ataraxia Kimatica, Make up effects   

Susana Rodero is a Spanish London-based artist, working at the intersections of visual arts and sculpture. She specialises in character design and the mutation of the human body, using techniques of special make up effects, prosthetics, body paints, props and wearables to create unique experimental pieces.

www.susanarodero.com     instagram: www.instagram.com/ataraxia_kimatica

Daniela Rullo, Editor

Daniela Rullo was born in Naples in 1986. As a child, she showed a vivid imagination and a sensitive nature. The passion for moving images brought her in London where she is currently studying editing. The perceptible world is her oyster and she is hardly tolerant of limitations and constraints. She believes that art in all its forms and expressions can help with her quest for the key to the Essence of Things.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If for any reason you can't contribute to our film, please feel free to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. It will be very helpful!

Narcissus has never seen her/himself before according to Tiresias prophecy and Echo is able only to repeat what s/he hears. The game of seduction starts, Echo initially resists but they both are craving each other. Echo surrenders to Narcissus but when than happens Narcissus sees her/himself for the very first time through Echo. Her/his reflection makes her/him to eventually surrender to an im-possible self-love. Yellow and white, Echo’s tears go back to earth and Narcissus prefers to transform into the flower, the new Narcissus. Echo’s body shrivels and loses its moisture from the tears s/he is offering to earth so Narcissus can be reborn. Echo is turning into stone and s/he keeps holding the flower. The one s/he couldn’t before.


 
 
Why to support us
The 21st century has been characterised as the century of narcissistic epidemic. The number of people who suffer from narcissistic personality disorder is being increased, therefore the number of the narcissistic abuse victims.
Echo of Narcissus is a short experimental art house film in an attempt to revisit an influential myth and give a new, different interpretation, avoiding gender and old fashioned stereotypes. Narcissism is beyond the gender or sexual identity, the race and the ethnicity. It’s about the lack of mirroring, the trauma and the personality’s development. The film is a contemporary approach of the myth in an abstract, ritualistic context and emphasises in the more profound and complex issue of transformation and rebirth for both of the characters. Narcissus and Echo seek their own catharsis and resolution but the way they are doing it, is different. 
Combining Jungian theories, cinematic techniques, performance art, dance, visuals and music, we do not intend to judge or take the side of the victim or the perpetrator. We are aiming to explore through art how narcissistic behaviour works and hopefully give voice to every Echo.
 

 

Director’s note
Looking at the famous painting of Salvador Dali “The metamorphosis of Narcissus” I started asking myself how the artist approached one of the most influential myths in the history of humanity. Observing the colours and lighting, I noticed that the part after the metamorphosis looks brighter, more vivid whereas the part before, has darker shades. In addition to that and going back to the myth, I was wondering why Narcissus is transformed into a flower and not into something else. A flower means the beginning of spring, re-birth and in our days, Narcissus is offered in important occasions as a symbol of good fortune and new beginnings. That’s when I started thinking differently about the myth and its influence in our daily lives. What if the meaning is slightly different than the one we know for thousands of years? What if the roles of victim and perpetrator are not as obvious and concrete as we think they are? Why Narcissus initially seduces Echo and in the end why does he deny her love and prefers to fall for a reflection? Is Echo obsessed with her own sound reflection? Why does she keep being in pain for Narcissus, someone who hurt her feelings without mercy?
I am not in a position to give answers, but through this film I am trying to understand more about a phenomenon, which is “epidemic” and it affects the lives of many people like me, like you.

Budget distribution                 
The funding will be allocated on: 

Crew & Performers' fees
Camera & lighting equipment
Hiring location
Travel expenses & Catering
Construction of Set design & original costumes
Original music
Make-up effects

 
The location
An old Victorian chapel from the early 1800's in south London will be the place which will symbolise the ancient myth and the two heroes, Narcissus and Echo are going to revisit.
 
    
   
 
Cast
Inspired by Jungian theories about narcissism and the coexistence of masculine and feminine characteristics in both genders, the two characters will have an androgynous style in order to avoid gender and sexuality stereotypes.
Echo, although it’s a female character, will be impersonated by a male performer, between 20 and 30 years old. On the contrary for the role of Narcissus, a female performer will be needed at the same age with Echo. With the right make-up and costumes, the intention is to highlight the feminine and masculine characteristics of the male and female characters respectively. 
NARCISSUS: Akti M. Konstantinou
Born and raised in the Greek north countryside. Trained in Ballet with her mother as a teacher during childhood and teenage years. In 2011 she moved to Athens and started her BA in psychology at National and Kapodistrian University of Athens, whilst continuing her training in Ballet and Contemporary dance. In 2013 she auditioned for National school of dance where she was offered a place at the foundation year for the contemporary dance training. One year later she auditioned for Trinity Laban conservatoire of music and dance for the BA contemporary dance, where she is graduating in July 2018. During these years in London she has been working with lots of film makers, directors, producers mainly for short films and Video-dance including projects with Met film, CSM, Ealing studios, Royal college of Art. Akti is also developing in Choreography, on stage and in video dance as she presented her last independent project at Bonnie Bird theatre with dancers from Laban and collaborators from Trinity Laban music department and Goldsmiths. Another field that she is working on, is Fashion and Modelling as she has a contract with Bookings Models Agency with an active year of shootings and editorials including Noctis magazine and Chanel.
ECHO: Michael Wilk

Michael was born in Krakow and he is currently studying contemporary dance at Trinity and Laban Conservatoire of Music and Dance, Ba (Hons). He is trained in techniques such as ballet, release, Cunningham, Graham, contact improvisation. Previously he studied at Krakow's Dance theatre and Art colour ballet studio in Poland. Michael has participated in plenty of workshops and he has performed for he Royal College of Arts, Laban theatre and krakow's night of Poetry. He is interested in acting, theatre, psychology, literature and visual arts.
 

 
 
Mood board

 
 
Who we are
 
Katerina Konstantopoulou, Director/Writer/Producer
Katerina was born in 1989 in Athens. After her BA in Film and TV studies, she moved to London and she is currently a postgraduate student at Goldsmiths University in the Producing pathway. Since, she started her studies, she has written, directed and produced two awarded short films, "Vault of Ideas", a story about an eerie stranger who wants an idea for an irrational death and "Pessoa-s", a film dedicated to the loving memory of the Portuguese poet Fernando Pessoa. She has also worked as assistant director at the theatre, video editor and photographer. Her problem is that she is stupidly romantic and suffers from need for escapism, so that's why she wants to make films which don't really depict the reality. 
EMPUSAE (Nicolas Van Meirhaeghe), Musician
With the complexity of the music, it may surprise you to find that Empusae is actually a project created by a single man, Nicolas Van Meirhaeghe aka Sal-Ocin. Empusae exercises a surreal science of structure that throbs and pulsates in an almost obsessive manner. The music is almost suggestive of a mechanical assembly line in its clock work clunks and clangs. It builds into a tense, yet haunting soundscape and rivets itself into the memory and refuses to be forgotten. It is serious music who's architecture has formed for itself a solid foundation, rather than sounding as if its trying to tear itself apart! When listening to Empusae's music, you're lost in dark melancholy, tribal electronic athmospheres and scarefull ambient rituals. Empusae continuously is music for the darkened souls, the lost ones. The style of music is like a journey from the postapocalyptic industrial and urban wastelands to the organic sounds of the wilderness in nature. The forests and woods of our fantasies. The drums evolved from rhythmic instruments to shamanic elements. Empusae became more settled, a bit calmer but never less intensive. Sphere from the woods is like ivy-soundscapes, winding up the trees from all their roots up to their crowns and in the sky. Misty fields for souls who can't decide whether to stay in this or to transcend into other worlds. It's all about the mysteries and depths of nature and the animus; silently but constantly walking the leylines of music. The quintessence of this quite alchemical Opus Magnum could be "stand your fears" as well as "no matter what you'll do, your demons will prevail". Sal-Ocin describes his music as a soundtrack for the listeners personal fantasies. Being a member of various other project such as This Morn' Omina, Tzolk'in, Project Arctic and a live member of In Slaughter Natives, Ah Cama-Sotz, IC 434, Triarii, TriOre and Sophia, Sal-Ocin isn't afraid of working together with other artists (Nick Grey, Arcana, ISN, ORE and many others).     http://empusae.com/
Ataraxia Kimatica, Make up effects   
Susana Rodero is a Spanish London-based artist, working at the intersections of visual arts and sculpture. She specialises in character design and the mutation of the human body, using techniques of special make up effects, prosthetics, body paints, props and wearables to create unique experimental pieces.
www.susanarodero.com     instagram: www.instagram.com/ataraxia_kimatica
Daniela Rullo, Editor
Daniela Rullo was born in Naples in 1986. As a child, she showed a vivid imagination and a sensitive nature. The passion for moving images brought her in London where she is currently studying editing. The perceptible world is her oyster and she is hardly tolerant of limitations and constraints. She believes that art in all its forms and expressions can help with her quest for the key to the Essence of Things.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If for any reason you can't contribute to our film, please feel free to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. It will be very helpful!

story:
My name is Emily Cecil, Director of the upcoming film, "Hell Phone" and my husband Travis and his company SFN Productions, LLC are partnered with Dangerous Curves Productions, LLC to put together this new horror comedy. This movie, written by Jeffrey Lamb, has been in development for the last 4 years. We are excited to get the chance to bring this film to the screen. With every donation we are closer to making this film the best that we can.
 
A group of 8 lifelong friends start disappearing one by one under unusual circumstances. Frightened and confused we follow Whitney, the only one who is truly concerned about what happened to her friends, partner with the local police officer, to find out the truth. What Whitney doesn't know, is behind the scenes, you see Kyle, the revenge stricken protagonist, receiving training from the Devil himself. As we come to find out, not all killers know what they're doing. As the movie progresses, you don’t see the growth in the characters you would expect. The character growth comes from Kyle, as he learns how to overcome his weakness and become a hardened and terrifying killer.  
 

What We Need & What You Get

SFN Productions, LLC seeks $200,000 in capital to fund the motion picture of "Hell Phone." Every donation level is going to receive awesome stuff. We have partnered with Hellions Clothing to bring you some custom Hell Phone shirts for giveaways. We will have giveaways for signed DVD's once the movie is completed, chances to hang out with us on set, get yourself in the behind the scenes, and even get your name in the credits of the movie, along with tons more.

The Impact

It is very important to support local artists and bring independent films into the forefront. Some of best movies you see on Netflix or streaming services are from lower cost independent filmmakers. The market for independent films has expanded tremendously in the last few years amounting to worldwide grosses of over $1.5 billion. This movie will be taken on tour to multiple film festivals. We are hopeful to sign a international distribution deal as well. If we can win Best Film, Audience Choice, Best Acting, etc. in 72 hours of filming, imagine what we can do with 17 days of filming with professional grade equipment and paid Sag actors. Our film will be under Sag-signatory, so we have to meet certain standards to be accepted. Being Sag-signatory will benefit our production company as well as all the aspiring actors who are needing more sag credits to become eligible.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money, you can donate your time by liking, following, and sharing our stuff on Facebook and Instagram @hellphonemovie . If you want to become a part of our production like Hellions Clothing and donate services and products for awesome giveaways, that is awesome.

story:
We are Bill Brock and Nomar Slevik. We are passionate about solving mysteries, speaking to witnesses, and going on site to anomalous areas. Combined, we have investigated hundreds of UFO sightings, alien abductions, cryptid encounters, hauntings, and the mysteries of ancient mound builders.

In the past, Bill hosted Monsters Underground, a show featured on Discovery Channel and Destination America. He is now taking that experience to create a documentary with author Nomar Slevik about the human side of alien abductions and UFO experiences in New England. With your help, The Abducted New England documentary will research and hopefully lead us to solve the questions we all have:  Do extraterrestrials exist? Why are they here? Have they abducted us and why? These are just a few questions you can help us answer. 

Funding for this project will make it possible for us to properly explore and research these questions while documenting the stories of witnesses willing to share their stories. Our goal is to raise $3000.00 to helps us with travel, accommodations, food, and equipment. Should we reach our full goal, we will be also able to pay for wardrobe, makeup, and graphic design. As you can see, costs can add up quickly and we are asking for your help to make this dream a reality. 

Help us get the word out about what we are doing. If you can't donate please just simply share this post!  

Thank you New England!! 

Bill Brock & Nomar Slevik

story:
Short Summary

Hi, we are filmmakers Tim And Karen Alexander, this is our project of passion that must be done to help heal and save the nation from the grip of damaging Legal Drugs.  

Tim's first cousin, Karen Smith was killed by San Bernardino minister Cedric Anderson who married Tim to his wife (also named Karen) less than a year before the deadly classroom Murder/Suicide incident.  Cedric was a childhood friend of Tim since age 9.

We want to make this film to show why Cedric did what he did, and what we found was so much bigger than why Cedric killed Karen, it is about why thousands are dying from medications and many others are killing others and themselves as well.  This is about DRUGS, Legal Prescription Drugs in bottles with people’s names on them that lead to a LEGAL DEATH from overdoses, suicides, murders, and a death to the quality of people’s lives while they are alive and addicted.

You can help us get a vital message out to the world to help save lives and families from the Death of Life by Prescription Medications - even when a person is alive, in so many ways they are dead under these medications effects.

We need to shake the nation with this eye-opening documentary to protect ourselves, families and friends. We are expanding greatly on our original vision of this film, and we cannot do it without your support.  We have people nationwide asking us to include them and their horrific stories in this series, so we need to travel to go deeper and do post-production.  We need YOUR support.  

Feel free to visit the Official Website: https://www.LegalDeath.com

Please Subscribe To Us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Legaldeath/

Vist the film's IMDB Page: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt7316026/combined

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise at least $75,000 to complete the production of 10 solid hours of final content designed to open closed eyes.  The final product will be 10 one hour shows that will be televised on streaming TV dealing with different topics of the problem. We have already started and are nearing the end of production, but new information and developments are necessitating us to shoot a lot more footage to tell a fuller story of how deep this rabbit hole really is.

The most useful perk for our supporters is a voice to be heard that represents your pain and suffering that will unify the nation of hurt people as a loud united voice for CHANGE.

Unfortunately, we will not be at liberty to offer you the final media directly as the streaming networks (Netflix, HBO, Amazon, HULU) want exclusive content that has no prior distribution, so this will have to be a donation from the heart for this important cause.

We have a few perks listed on the side (Caps, T-Shirts) to show our gratitude for your support of us.  Our goal is to give LIFE and HEALING to others through awareness about meds in a way very few films ever have.  This film series is a cause for everyone to unite and stand, and that is the ultimate perk for the heart.

If we don’t reach our full goal don't worry, we will just take what we get, as IndieGoGo allows us to receive the partial funds even if we fall short of our goal.  We will push to do as much as we can and still deliver a great finished product even if not all we wanted to do. The message will stand.

 

The Impact

The Impact of this film will be deep, unprecedented and beyond compare.  Impact will actually be an understatement!.  This will not only show your pain if you have endured it personally, it will show the pain of loved ones and those who you have lost.  We all need to fight in their honor as I and my wife am doing from our personal loss. We need to give life to others with this eye-opening wake-up call and show what few have been willing too.  Every rock will be looked under and no stone left unturned to show the hard real truth.

This is not my first time at the rodeo, I have made three feature films in the past, one a very successful documentary. For more info on my career as a filmmaker, look at my IMDB page HERE: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1968975/ 

 

Risks & Challenges

In this case, the risk and challenges are actually very few as the film is halfway shot.  We have made three films before, are represented by one of the biggest film/TV agents in Hollywood, and we have a top entertainment attorney already in place.  

If an unforeseen challenge does arrive, we will make it work anyway and deliver a great finished project in line with the preview clip you see above.  We can't and WON'T fail...Failure is NOT an option here, this is too important.  We are well into the production, we are now seeking to make it bigger so it can reach even more people with a commercial media push behind it.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

And most of all, please SHARE SHARE SHARE!  All of us together can do so much more than a few of us alone and divided!  With great numbers, lots of little pieces go a LONG WAY!  WE can do this TOGETHER and change the world for millions!

Feel free to visit: www.LegalDeath.com

Other Ways You Can Help
And most of all, please SHARE SHARE SHARE!  All of us together can do so much more than a few of us alone and divided!  With great numbers, lots of little pieces go a LONG WAY!  WE can do this TOGETHER and change the world for millions!
Feel free to visit: www.LegalDeath.com

story:
ABOUT ME: Em Watson 

My name is Em Watson and I am a visual storyteller. I graduated NYU Gallatin in 2016 with an interdisciplinary concentration in "Art/Life/Practice," which included practical and critical inquiry in film, theater, dance, and photography. 

Since 2013, I've been working as a professional photographer, videographer, digital content producer, and film producer, based in Brooklyn, New York. 

The main character in this story is largely based in autobiography - I survived a car crash as a teenager, and I've had to manage PTSD and a traumatic brain injury in the years since, as they continually resurface within myself and within my relationships. Artistically, I'm interested in injuries and "dis-ease" that have elements of physical and cultural invisibility. While PTSD is only one form of this invisibility, I'm excited to begin this creative journey to explore an experience that I am so intimately familiar with, and hope in the future to continue working to depict narratives of other injuries and difficulties that have this quality. 

 

THE PROJECT: A Summary

ONLY PLACE is a narrative dance film that follows Sami, a young professional from Brooklyn, on vacation with her girlfriend, Lydia, to East Hampton, Long Island. Sami survived a car crash in East Hampton as a teenager, and is forced to grapple with her PTSD when she returns to the physical location and is confronted with the reality of the experience within herself and in relationship with her girlfriend.

Only Place is a queer story, but it isn't about queerness. It tells a story of love and loss, and gives space for queerness without that being the main point.

Only Place is also a dance film, but the characters within the story aren't dancers. We're using movement and its unique creative abilities to show the way that trauma moves within the body, and manifests both within an individual and within relationships with other people.

 

Who?

Hannah Cullen and Em Watson will be performing as Lydia and Sami, respectively, in Only Place. This design of artist/performer is relatively unique within the film world, but closely follows typical models of process and creation for devised dance and theater for live performance.

Our crew to-date is made up entirely of female-identifying artists and creatives. In the past year,  Em Watson has co-produced five successful music videos for two different artists, and a number of the crewmembers on Only Place are returning collaborators from these videos. Our choreographer Hannah Cullen's company cullen+them just performed their interdisciplinary show Mark it in Pencil at New York Live Arts. Em Watson's dance photography has been published in the Boston Globe, Dance Magazine, Time Out New York, American Theatre Magazine, and on the cover of the Ballet Review.

We're young. We're interdisciplinary and collaborative. We're making it. And your contribution to this project can help us toward our next chapter of true collaboration between dance and film. 

 

What We Need

We're seeking $12,500 to fund this film to its full potential. The budget will go toward equipment rental, paying, transporting, and feeding our crew and cast,  location expenses, and editing and post-production costs. Help us make this happen!

As a professional photographer, I've included a great opportunity for portrait sessions as part of the reward perks. At support levels of $500 or higher (this is a great value!), you'll receive a 2-hr portrait session with me. This is awesome for family portraits, and always a fun time. Check out my website to see some examples of my work in the past.

 

The Impact

This film is my opportunity to tell the most significant personal story that I have. This story is highly relatable for individuals with histories of trauma, people within the LGBTQ community, and those who feel things within their bodies that they have difficulty translating into words. I hope that a wide variety of people will be able to connect with this film, especially with the unique integration of movement and cinematography. This is our opportunity to explore a new interdisciplinary performance medium, with a high production value to support what our awesome team is truly capable of making.

 

Why?

As flexible, independent artists, we're able to make work on a shoestring. The point of this campaign is that we want to make something BETTER than that.  Your contribution will give us the opportunity to fully explore the possibilities available in this relatively unexplored medium of Narrative Dance Film. This interdisciplinary performance medium has a powerful emotional and psychological impact, and we want to do this story justice by giving it the production value that both the story and the form deserves. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help besides money! Here are some ideas, and if you have other ideas we'd love to hear them:

  • CATERING SERVICES IN NYC OR THE HAMPTONS. We're looking for sponsors from local businesses for craft services, which would drastically lower our craft costs. Crafty sponsors will be listed in the credits.
  • HOUSING IN THE HAMPTONS. We're still looking for some additional space for cast and crew in the Hamptons! It will be a 4-day shoot, holding the tentative dates of September 14-17. You will get special thanks in the credits!
  • LOCATION IN THE HAMPTONS: TEENAGE BEDROOM. Looking for an interior bedroom space in the Hamptons still, as well. Special thanks in credits!
  • SUGGESTIONS FOR FEMALE IDENTIFYING MUSICAL ARTISTS AND COLLABORATORS. We're still looking for a composer for this film. If you know somebody cool who would be into working with us, send them our way!
  • SPREAD OUR CAMPAIGN. Tell your friends, tell your mom! If you know of someone who is able to help us out, please spread the word.
story_txt:
ABOUT ME: Em Watson 
My name is Em Watson and I am a visual storyteller. I graduated NYU Gallatin in 2016 with an interdisciplinary concentration in "Art/Life/Practice," which included practical and critical inquiry in film, theater, dance, and photography. 
Since 2013, I've been working as a professional photographer, videographer, digital content producer, and film producer, based in Brooklyn, New York. 
The main character in this story is largely based in autobiography - I survived a car crash as a teenager, and I've had to manage PTSD and a traumatic brain injury in the years since, as they continually resurface within myself and within my relationships. Artistically, I'm interested in injuries and "dis-ease" that have elements of physical and cultural invisibility. While PTSD is only one form of this invisibility, I'm excited to begin this creative journey to explore an experience that I am so intimately familiar with, and hope in the future to continue working to depict narratives of other injuries and difficulties that have this quality. 
 
THE PROJECT: A Summary
ONLY PLACE is a narrative dance film that follows Sami, a young professional from Brooklyn, on vacation with her girlfriend, Lydia, to East Hampton, Long Island. Sami survived a car crash in East Hampton as a teenager, and is forced to grapple with her PTSD when she returns to the physical location and is confronted with the reality of the experience within herself and in relationship with her girlfriend.
Only Place is a queer story, but it isn't about queerness. It tells a story of love and loss, and gives space for queerness without that being the main point.
Only Place is also a dance film, but the characters within the story aren't dancers. We're using movement and its unique creative abilities to show the way that trauma moves within the body, and manifests both within an individual and within relationships with other people.
 

Who?
Hannah Cullen and Em Watson will be performing as Lydia and Sami, respectively, in Only Place. This design of artist/performer is relatively unique within the film world, but closely follows typical models of process and creation for devised dance and theater for live performance.
Our crew to-date is made up entirely of female-identifying artists and creatives. In the past year,  Em Watson has co-produced five successful music videos for two different artists, and a number of the crewmembers on Only Place are returning collaborators from these videos. Our choreographer Hannah Cullen's company cullen+them just performed their interdisciplinary show Mark it in Pencil at New York Live Arts. Em Watson's dance photography has been published in the Boston Globe, Dance Magazine, Time Out New York, American Theatre Magazine, and on the cover of the Ballet Review.
We're young. We're interdisciplinary and collaborative. We're making it. And your contribution to this project can help us toward our next chapter of true collaboration between dance and film. 
 
What We Need
We're seeking $12,500 to fund this film to its full potential. The budget will go toward equipment rental, paying, transporting, and feeding our crew and cast,  location expenses, and editing and post-production costs. Help us make this happen!
As a professional photographer, I've included a great opportunity for portrait sessions as part of the reward perks. At support levels of $500 or higher (this is a great value!), you'll receive a 2-hr portrait session with me. This is awesome for family portraits, and always a fun time. Check out my website to see some examples of my work in the past.
 

The Impact
This film is my opportunity to tell the most significant personal story that I have. This story is highly relatable for individuals with histories of trauma, people within the LGBTQ community, and those who feel things within their bodies that they have difficulty translating into words. I hope that a wide variety of people will be able to connect with this film, especially with the unique integration of movement and cinematography. This is our opportunity to explore a new interdisciplinary performance medium, with a high production value to support what our awesome team is truly capable of making.
 

Why?
As flexible, independent artists, we're able to make work on a shoestring. The point of this campaign is that we want to make something BETTER than that.  Your contribution will give us the opportunity to fully explore the possibilities available in this relatively unexplored medium of Narrative Dance Film. This interdisciplinary performance medium has a powerful emotional and psychological impact, and we want to do this story justice by giving it the production value that both the story and the form deserves. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
There are other ways you can help besides money! Here are some ideas, and if you have other ideas we'd love to hear them:

CATERING SERVICES IN NYC OR THE HAMPTONS. We're looking for sponsors from local businesses for craft services, which would drastically lower our craft costs. Crafty sponsors will be listed in the credits.
HOUSING IN THE HAMPTONS. We're still looking for some additional space for cast and crew in the Hamptons! It will be a 4-day shoot, holding the tentative dates of September 14-17. You will get special thanks in the credits!
LOCATION IN THE HAMPTONS: TEENAGE BEDROOM. Looking for an interior bedroom space in the Hamptons still, as well. Special thanks in credits!
SUGGESTIONS FOR FEMALE IDENTIFYING MUSICAL ARTISTS AND COLLABORATORS. We're still looking for a composer for this film. If you know somebody cool who would be into working with us, send them our way!
SPREAD OUR CAMPAIGN. Tell your friends, tell your mom! If you know of someone who is able to help us out, please spread the word.

story:
Synopsis:

I.AM THERE FOR YOU is an exploratory documentary that questions the on-growing relationship between Emotional Artificial intelligence and people struggling with loneliness.

Researchers all across the world have indicated that LONELINESS is turning into an epidemic. But very few people talk about it. Amongst various ways of combating loneliness, there is a unique  emergence of the world of virtual companions being developed by emotional artificial intelligence, targeted to fill the void.

With the advancement in the field of artificial intelligence, A.I is being consumed, both for commercial and emotional purposes. While there is so much being published about commercial A.I, the usage of Emotional A.I cannot be ignored.

I.Am there for you will explore how emotional A.I is becoming a reality in the lives of many people who are dealing with loneliness. Through the lives of people who are struggling with loneliness , it will explore the nature of this A.I-human emotional relationship.

Genesis of Our Story:

Hi! My name is Megha Saxena. I am the Director of this film. I have worked as a Creative Producer for almost 4 years in India. I am currently pursuing a Post-Graduate degree in Documentary films in Advanced Film and Television Program at Sheridan College, Oakville, Ontario.

 

 Nothing gets me more excited than finding topics that need to reach out to the rest of the world!“A few months ago, someone suggested me a virtual companion app called replica. It is an emotional A.I chat-bot which chats with you like a friend. The more you talk to it, the more it starts replicating your tone and becomes more “human- like”. I was inquisitive to find out why would people use such an app? I started researching and I explored a whole new world of emerging emotional A.I, which is focused to replicate human emotions (apps and Robots) to provide companionship and assistance.  This instantly motivated me to explore this topic in a documentary.  

Our Team:

PRODUCER: RYAN STASHICK:  

A calm and organised Producer is the biggest asset to a project and Ryan is just that!  He is currently acquiring a specialisation in Producing and Documentary films in Advanced Film and TV Program , Sheridan College, Oakville, Ontario. Besides taking care of the logistics, he always has great creative Inputs, which makes him valuable collaborator.

 DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY: VIKAS VASUDEVAN :

Camera is  his 1st and only love! He sees the world through his ‘lens’.  Vikas holds a Bachelors degree in Film-making and is currently specialising in Camera and lighting  in Advanced Film and TV Program at Advanced Film at Sheridan College, Oakville, Ontario. He has an eye for detail and that shows in his work.  He aspires to be a DOP in a big feature film and is working towards that, everyday!

 SOUND RECORDIST: DA TENG:   

He hears MORE than he talks and that is what makes him awesome at his job.  His passion for Music made him take up audio specialisation in Advanced Film and TV Program at Sheridan College, Oakville, Ontario.  On set , you will find him quietly setting up his audio equipment and the result is always crystal clear!

EDITOR: CHRISSY PAPAIOANNOU : 

A movie buff who has probably seen every film on this planet.  She is currently pursuing editing as her specialisation in Advanced Film and TV Program at Sheridan College, Oakville, Ontario.. The edit suite is her 2nd home! Like an ideal editor, she invests hours in understanding the footage and then gives it her all to bring out the best in the story, keeping the director’s vision in mind. 

WRITER: MELISSA CHONG :

A passionate writer with a heartwarming smile:)! She says "I love words. And writing them. Mostly to figure out the world, but also to tell stories – real ones, “fake” ones, and everything in between. That said, I also believe that stories are everywhere: words, pictures, films, music. Every art, and every science." She knows how to turn words into flurries ! Melissa is currently pursuing Screenwriting and Direction as her specialisation in Advanced Film and Tv Program , Sheridan College, Oakville, Ontario. 

 Why You Should Support:

The relevance of this documentary cannot be understated. In this fast paced society, where people are in a constant rat race, we need to tell stories that highlight the cost of this development more than ever before- the rise of loneliness. While people are finding different ways of combating loneliness, Emotional A.I is seems to be offering solutions in the form robots and virtual companions. This documentary will highlight this new-age bond, which is only going to grow to unimaginable extends. Hence , there cannot be a better time to explore this topic. However, this task cannot be done alone.  Your contribution will help in expanding the scope of this documentary by enabling us to reach out to the the best of experts, footage, location, cast and good production design.

How Much Do We Need? :

In order to produce this important film, we need a YOUR support. We aim to raise $2500. Your support will cover -

  • Transportation fees
  • A.I stock Footage
  • Location
  • Production Design elements
  • Graphics
  • Meals and craft
  • Film Festival fees

The Impact:

This documentary will be a fascinating and thought provoking experience for the viewers. Through the lives of people struggling with loneliness, they will not only witness the developing emotional bond between humans and machine but will also get a glimpse into where we are headed in the future. According to some A.I experts “ in the future, the probability of humans talking to their A.I friend would be higher than them talking to their spouses”. Thus, this is a perfect time to make a film on this topic.

Other Ways You Can Contribute :

Can't contribute financially? No stress, there are other ways you can help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

story:
Sometimes it’s in the things we value least that we find what matters most.

Shit Christmas finds joy in the midst of despair, and hope in our darkest hour. It’s a Christmas movie. And it’s funny.

Shit Christmas is about bringing people together. We want this film to say: whatever kind of family you are - that’s what matters most.

Can you help us make it?

 

The Film

Family man Nick lies to his wife and kids about losing his job and getting into debt, but the truth comes out on Christmas morning. Does Nick have what it takes to win them back and save Christmas?

 

The Filmmakers

We are Punk Cinema. We make British comedy films.

Our last film Bill - a comedy about Shakespeare - premiered on BBC TV at Christmas 2017. You can watch it on Amazon Prime. Richard Bracewell directed Bill and produced it with Tony Bracewell.

Now we’ve teamed up with Patrick Dalton, author of the Shit London series of books.

Our films have been seen in cinemas, on TV and on streaming platforms.

Shit Christmas is our new feature film. Richard will direct it.

It’s micro-budget, it’s about a DIY Christmas. We’re going to make it with whatever we can find. It’s perfect for crowdfunding. 

 

What's In It For You?

You get to be a movie backer who can green light our new movie. You’ve got the power of a Hollywood movie exec!

But not just that: we’ve put together a great range of special perks.

From simply helping us get it made and telling your friends you’re a movie backer, to becoming an Exec Producer and having a role in the film. Whether it’s a set visit, on-screen credit, or signed photos, we’ve got the perks for you.

 

Charity

Whatever you put in, any money which the movie makes from your support will go to UK charities working with the homeless.

 

Other Ways to Help

If you want to help but don't feel you can afford to, you can help in other ways. 

Go make some noise! Tell everyone you know - tell your friends and your parents about Shit Christmas and tell them to get involved!

You can use the share tools on Indiegogo.

Follow us on Twitter and Instagram @shitxmas.

 

Making the Film

Anything we raise from crowdfunding will be spent on making this movie - whatever the final amount.

We plan to shoot in spring 2021 and release for Christmas 2021. There are never enough good new Christmas films: let’s change that. 


What Difference Will Your Contribution Make?

We're taking back Christmas - back from the endless, sugar-coated commercialism.

We’re going to rebuild Christmas out of discarded trees, threadbare tinsel and torn wrapping paper.

After the year from hell, this story needs to be told more than ever.

Come with us and help save Christmas!

story:
Short Summary

  • My Name is Shoshana "Rachel" Ehrenkranz. I'm Jewish (caught!) and before attending film school, I identified as being Jewish, a student-athlete and twin. I still identify as being a twin and Jewish and even joined the Jewish softball team apart of NYU intramural but am now not shy about labeling myself as an artist too. I am lucky enough to attend NYU's Tisch school of the Arts where I have cultivated skills to put together a film like the one I plan on making. Being observant and a film student wasn't the easiest path I could have chosen but I don't regret it a bit. I find myself in a unique situation and location. I have been in Bermuda since November as a live-in babysitter for a Jewish family. Every day, I am blown away by the beauty of the Atlantic that surrounds the Island, the plentiful palm trees that fill the yards, and the wild roosters that wake me at dawn. While I could do without the roosters, I am grateful to be here. I always imagined my thesis film would be shot in New York or my hometown of Sharon, MA, but upon living in this majestical sub-tropic 20.54 square foot island, I couldn't brush off the thought of filming my story here. What better way to emphasize how strong the Jewish community is by portraying it in a remote Island that is definitely not known for its quantity of Jews? 

  • My senior thesis film is about a Jewish girl who learns about the punishments of breaking Shabbat. A fusion of live-action and animation allows us to access the mind of an 8 year old and her world. Imagine learning what cares, laket, and makot are as an 8 year old. I didn't learn mesechet shabbat until 10th grade and couldn't really grasp the concept of those harsh punishments then. What if, after learning about the punishments, your parents try to convince you to break shabbat because you're the youngest in the house and they left the stove on? That's what my film is about. It's a comedy where you don't know whether to laugh or cry. You can do both and if I'm successful, we will be able to laugh and cry together virtually, or together B'H post-pandemic.
  • Your contribution will help fund my senior thesis and support the local Bermuda art scene. Thank you for allowing me to hire local artists and caterers. By helping fund this film, you will also contribute to the Bermuda economy which has been negatively impacted due to the covid-19 pandemic and lack of tourism. 

What We Need & What You Get

How your contributions will be used:

  • The biggest expense is the film equipment and cast and crew. Transporting anything to an Island is highly expensive but there is certain equipment that we must ship. All our sound equipment and Jewish set props are being imported due to their scarcity in Bermuda. On set, we will be providing every cast and crew food craft bags in order to maintain cleanliness and covid-19 protocols for eating while socially distant. These food bags will prevent people from congregating at a craft table and help prevent unnecessary physical contact. 

What you will get if you contribute:

  • So... I still have my iconic stationary from my bat-mitzvah. And while it has my name on the front, it has your name written on the inside.  If you're feeling very generous and donate Rabbi/Yoatzet Halacha tier, that plus I will provide you with a photo shoot on film, a link to the first cut, executive producer credits for this film and my future feature film (it will happen one day mark my word.) By donating, you will receive perks like that while also making my dreams come true. Two birds with one stone you could say. 

The Impact

  • Growing up, I didn't know I could really be a filmmaker. I was one half of a pair of identical twins and always had a play buddy to build my vast imagination with. We pretended we were famous athletes, unicorns, and queens. And we were. Queens that is. Our parents, even with five kids, never halted our creativity and wild games and imagination. They truly made us feel like we could do anything or be anyone. I'm lucky enough to have parents who are not only teachers (teaching in person currently!) but also teachers of torah and midot (traits.) They live life how I strive to live mine. My parents have always accepted my dreams no matter how unrealistic they may've seemed. While I may not have the financial security net some of my film peers have, I have a strong Jewish community that supports its members. By making this film financially possible, you will help me fulfill my goals, & my dreams.  I hope, with this film, I can inspire the future filmmaker generation that they too can dream far and wide, and that what their parents do for a living is not a barrier but a stepping stone to achieving those dreams.
  • I don't see many films that include a person of faith who is happy in the modern world. There seems to be a radical difference between the Larry David archetype and the Ultra-Orthodox archetype. The only protagonist I have felt a connection to, in his struggle between his faith and his lifestyle, is Ramy in  the tv series,"Ramy". I seek to create a character many of us can connect with but have not yet seen reflected on our screens.
  • I recently won the Sight & Sound Category in the Fusion Film Festival with my film "The Price of Gum" from my sophomore year. I have grown as an artist since and am eager to work on my senior thesis with your support! I am excited to finally make a film about my Judaism. I hope this inspires any other religious filmmakers of any faith to share their stories through art. 

Risks & Challenges

To be completely transparent, filming a short during covid is no easy task.  I worked with an NYU production advisor to ensure that my film would not break any of New York covid guidelines even though I wasn't in New York. Furthermore, as a former contact tracer for the state of MA, I am always up to date with current protocols and know the severity of breaking these rules. The safety of my cast and crew is my first priority. 

On top of those hurdles, filming a short in an international country as a non-resident can be difficult. I had to look into what documents I would need in order to film in Bermuda with no issues. Luckily, I was able apply and be approved for permits and location agreements on public and private property. I was able to do so with the help of very friendly Bermudian authorities whom I know I can contact if I run into any issues while filming.

As a non-Bermudian, I also had to find local cast and crew. I was blessed with befriending a very talented Bermudian filmmaker, Antoine Hunt. Through him, I was able to clinch film equipment and access to local theatre groups to cast my film. Plus, he's now my Director of Photography!

The hardest part was finding a child actor who could accurately depict an observant Jewish girl. Unsurprising, through the tiny Jewish community here in Bermuda, I was able to find a very talented 8 year old to play the protagonist

Just through the pre-production, I have been able to connect with local artists and the Jewish community. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the means to support this project, that's okay! You can still help by getting the word out that I'm fundraising.

  • Share my campaign on Facebook, Instagram, or email!
  • Know anyone looking to contribute to funding Jewish art? Tell them about this campaign! I am happy to discuss this project with anyone interested in it. 

Thank you and stay safe,

Shoshana

What We Need & What You Get
How your contributions will be used:
The biggest expense is the film equipment and cast and crew. Transporting anything to an Island is highly expensive but there is certain equipment that we must ship. All our sound equipment and Jewish set props are being imported due to their scarcity in Bermuda. On set, we will be providing every cast and crew food craft bags in order to maintain cleanliness and covid-19 protocols for eating while socially distant. These food bags will prevent people from congregating at a craft table and help prevent unnecessary physical contact. 
What you will get if you contribute:
So... I still have my iconic stationary from my bat-mitzvah. And while it has my name on the front, it has your name written on the inside.  If you're feeling very generous and donate Rabbi/Yoatzet Halacha tier, that plus I will provide you with a photo shoot on film, a link to the first cut, executive producer credits for this film and my future feature film (it will happen one day mark my word.) By donating, you will receive perks like that while also making my dreams come true. Two birds with one stone you could say. 

The Impact


Growing up, I didn't know I could really be a filmmaker. I was one half of a pair of identical twins and always had a play buddy to build my vast imagination with. We pretended we were famous athletes, unicorns, and queens. And we were. Queens that is. Our parents, even with five kids, never halted our creativity and wild games and imagination. They truly made us feel like we could do anything or be anyone. I'm lucky enough to have parents who are not only teachers (teaching in person currently!) but also teachers of torah and midot (traits.) They live life how I strive to live mine. My parents have always accepted my dreams no matter how unrealistic they may've seemed. While I may not have the financial security net some of my film peers have, I have a strong Jewish community that supports its members. By making this film financially possible, you will help me fulfill my goals, & my dreams.  I hope, with this film, I can inspire the future filmmaker generation that they too can dream far and wide, and that what their parents do for a living is not a barrier but a stepping stone to achieving those dreams.


I don't see many films that include a person of faith who is happy in the modern world. There seems to be a radical difference between the Larry David archetype and the Ultra-Orthodox archetype. The only protagonist I have felt a connection to, in his struggle between his faith and his lifestyle, is Ramy in  the tv series,"Ramy". I seek to create a character many of us can connect with but have not yet seen reflected on our screens.

I recently won the Sight & Sound Category in the Fusion Film Festival with my film "The Price of Gum" from my sophomore year. I have grown as an artist since and am eager to work on my senior thesis with your support! I am excited to finally make a film about my Judaism. I hope this inspires any other religious filmmakers of any faith to share their stories through art. 



Risks & Challenges
To be completely transparent, filming a short during covid is no easy task.  I worked with an NYU production advisor to ensure that my film would not break any of New York covid guidelines even though I wasn't in New York. Furthermore, as a former contact tracer for the state of MA, I am always up to date with current protocols and know the severity of breaking these rules. The safety of my cast and crew is my first priority. 
On top of those hurdles, filming a short in an international country as a non-resident can be difficult. I had to look into what documents I would need in order to film in Bermuda with no issues. Luckily, I was able apply and be approved for permits and location agreements on public and private property. I was able to do so with the help of very friendly Bermudian authorities whom I know I can contact if I run into any issues while filming.
As a non-Bermudian, I also had to find local cast and crew. I was blessed with befriending a very talented Bermudian filmmaker, Antoine Hunt. Through him, I was able to clinch film equipment and access to local theatre groups to cast my film. Plus, he's now my Director of Photography!
The hardest part was finding a child actor who could accurately depict an observant Jewish girl. Unsurprising, through the tiny Jewish community here in Bermuda, I was able to find a very talented 8 year old to play the protagonist
Just through the pre-production, I have been able to connect with local artists and the Jewish community. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't have the means to support this project, that's okay! You can still help by getting the word out that I'm fundraising.

Share my campaign on Facebook, Instagram, or email!
Know anyone looking to contribute to funding Jewish art? Tell them about this campaign! I am happy to discuss this project with anyone interested in it. 

Thank you and stay safe,Shoshana

story:
Testo italiano in basso

 

Chi siamo?

Ciao a tutti! Siamo Tommaso Zandri, Andrea Guarnieri, e Arianna Sciancalepore, tre giovani filmmaker di Roma. Ci siamo conosciuti in università, e, accomunati da un grande spirito di avventura, abbiamo da subito iniziato a lavorare insieme come una squadra, producendo cortometraggi e documentari che hanno vinto svariati festival internazionali e non.

                      @tommaso     @arianna       @andrea

 

E ora, abbiamo trovato il  progetto dei nostri sogni.

Qualcosa che aspettavamo da tempo, che prima sembrava irraggiungibile.

 

Qual è il progetto?

Il 30 Novembre 2020, il ketch 'Atlantic', una barca a vela da 15 metri, partirà da Roma per un viaggio intorno al mondo​

 

Il capitano, Mario Giua, 70 anni, marinaio esperto, ci ha accettato come parte del suo equipaggio. Partiremo insieme a lui con l'intenzione di documentare il viaggio, raccontando la storia di noi tre, di dover lasciare la nostra casa e le nostre vite alle spalle, del rapporto con il capitano e l’equipaggio e partire alla ricerca di qualcosa la fuori. 

L’uomo contemporaneo ha perso quel legame primordiale con la natura, accecato da quel senso di superiorità che oramai lo illude di essere invincibile ed immortale. 
Non ci rendiamo conto che per vivere bene oggi e per non perire domani, non possiamo eslcudere la condizione in cui riversa il nostro pianeta, in quanto siamo dipendenti da esso, e non un ente separato. 

É fondamentale e urgente recuperare quella relazione, 
quella consapevolezza di esser parte di un grande organismo, un tutt’uno che lavora vicendevolmente per la vita.

 

Il nostro compito è quello di proporre alternative valide allo stile di vita consumistico che l’uomo ha adottato e che ha messo in crisi il pianeta, per permettere a noi e alle future generazioni di vivere in benessere, salute e armonia con la terra.
Noi, come giovani cineasti, sentiamo la necessità di immergerci in questa missione in prima persona, per essere testimoni delle offese che la natura ha subito dall’uomo, e cercare di restituire la bellezza e il senso che essa ha da offrirci.
 

‘Around the world on the ketch Atlantic’ vuole essere un viaggio su quel senso primitivo di libertà e scoperta.

Proprio per questo motivo, abbiamo installato nella nostra barca impianti fotovoltaici e 
generatori eolici per disporre il meno possibile del motore.
Abbiamo intenzione di raggiungere e riprendere il Pacific Trash Vortex, l’isola di plastica che si estende  per milioni di km² nel Pacifico per un totale di oltre 3 milioni di tonnellate di rifiuti, e lì capire, anche insieme ad esperti del settore, chi sono i maggiori responsabili di questo scempio e cosa, ognungo di noi, può fare per ridurre l’impatto ambientale. Vogliamo inoltre monitorare in prima persona le condizioni della fauna e della flora marina, 
discutendone con esperti locali e mettendo a confronto gli 
studi e le immagini realizzate nei decenni passati. In particolare sul fenomeno dello sbiancamento della barriera corallina, l’impoverimento delle numerose specie che abitavano gli oceani e l’innalzamento dei livelli delle acque dovuto allo scioglimento dei ghiacciai.
Ci stiamo anche organizzando per poter disporre di strumenti di rilevazione che ci consentirebbero di fornire dati sulle microplastiche nell’oceano; uno strumento utilizzabile esclusivamente da piccole imbarcazioni come il nostro ketch e in questo momento non sfruttato data la situazione Covid-19.

 

Dicono che la vita sia il miglior insegnante, ma neanche l’oceano scherza.

 

Il nuovo Coronavirus  ha maggiormente alimentato quella tendenza di isolamento e chiusura 
verso cui l'essere umano stava già andando incontro. Ci stiamo rifiugiando in una realtà appositamente costruita dall’individuo e per l’individuo, in cui manca il confronto con l’altro e il diverso. Un confronto senza la paura di essere sè stessi, priva di filtri e maschere.
La nostra intenzione non è quella ignorare I piani di tutela e precauzione imposte dai governi, ma, prendendo tutte le misure del caso, inoltrarci nel mondo e raccontare come stanno cambiando le nostre abitudini, a partire dal semplice modo di salutarci e dall’accoglienza dello straniero, oramai ritenuto pericoloso. Vogliamo documentare come altruismo e accoglienza possano vincere su egoismo e indifferenza. Vogliamo raccontare di questo confronto diretto non solo attraverso le persone che incontreremo lungo il viaggio, ma anche tra di noi. Usciti da una situazione di totale isolamento, affronteremo la vita in barca, dove non puoi far altro che vivere il presente, essere te stesso e avere fiducia nei tuoi compagni di viaggio. In un contesto simile, privo di ogni sorta di comodità, nasce e si sviluppa un microcosmo in cui tutti sono responsabili delle sorti di ognuno e della missione. Siamo consapevoli di come un’ esperienza del genere possa essere formativa per chiunque, soprattutto in un periodo come questo.
 

Ci sono tanti modi per forgiare il tuo percorso, e ora vi vogliamo raccontare come lo stiamo facendo noi. Come, entrati in contatto con Mario, abbiamo preso la folle decisione di seguirlo in giro per il mondo sulla sua barca a vela. Vogliamo condividere con voi ciò che apprenderemo lungo il percorso, cosa impareremo da questa esperienza… saremo gli stessi Arianna, Tommaso e Andrea di prima?

 

"NO MAN IS AN ISLAND"

-John Donne-

 

Cosa ci serve e cosa riceverete?

Il tuo supporto è di grande aiuto! Questa è la tua occasione di diventare produttore di un documentario girato in tutto il mondo!

Il viaggio in sé viene a costarci 9.000 euro per tutti e tre, tra rifornimenti di cibo, gasolio, e altre necessità. Con questa somma, partiamo. Altrimenti, potrebbe non essere possibile. Inoltre, siamo già attrezzati con una videocamera professionale, la BlackMagic Pocket Cinema Camera 4k, ma per creare un prodotto di qualità, vorremmo investire su ulteriori attrezzature per il documentario.

La nostra idea è di poter disporre di:

  • 2 ulteriori BlackMagic Pocket Cinema Camera 4k.
  • 1 o 2 droni.
  • Varie GoPro.
  • Scafandri per riprese subacquee.
  • Attrezzatura sub.
  • Assicurazione per il viaggio e per le immersioni.
  • Telefono satellitare.
  • Microfoni e attrezzatura audio.
  • Hard Disk per immagazzinare i file.

 

In totale questa attrezzatura andrebbe a costare intorno ai 20.000 euro.

Siamo determinati a salpare e a girare il documentario a prescindere dalla quantità di soldi che riusciremo ad avere, ma senza i 9.000 iniziali da dare a Mario per la cambusa e per assicurargli il nostro impegno, non possiamo partire.

Se i fondi che ci arrivano superano i 9.000, li investiremo in attrezzature. Avendo un ordine di priorità, compreremo prima gli elementi più essenziali.

 

Questo è quello di cui abbiamo bisogno, ora quello che otterresti:

  • Per una donazione di qualsiasi importo, riceverai un riconoscimento nei crediti e una copia digitale del prodotto finito.
  • Per una donazione di 100 € o più, riceverai un riconoscimento nei crediti, una copia digitale del prodotto finito e due biglietti per la proiezione in anteprima.
  • Per una donazione di 500 € o più, l'individuo riceverà un credito da produttore associato su "Around the World on the Ketch Atlantic" e su IMDb, oltre a una copia digitale del prodotto finito e due biglietti per la proiezione in anteprima. Inoltre, avrai accesso a una chat di gruppo con i nostri più accaniti sostenitori e potrai comunicare con noi dal vivo in tutto il mondo ogni volta che abbiamo internet, fornirci feedback e farci domande.
  • Per una donazione di 1500 € o più, l'individuo riceverà un credito da produttore esecutivo su 'Around the World on the Ketch Atlantic' e su IMDb, avrà la possibilità di partecipare alle proiezioni pre-rilascio del film, oltre a una copia digitale e due biglietti per la prima proiezione. Inoltre, avrai accesso a una chat di gruppo con i nostri più accaniti sostenitori e potrai comunicare con noi dal vivo in tutto il mondo ogni volta che abbiamo internet, fornirci feedback e farci domande.
  • Per una donazione di 5000 € o più, l'individuo riceverà un credito da produttore esecutivo su 'Around the World on the Ketch Atlantic' e su IMDb, avrà la possibilità di partecipare alle proiezioni pre-rilascio del film, oltre a una copia digitale e due biglietti per la prima proiezione. Inoltre, avrai accesso a una chat di gruppo con i nostri più accaniti sostenitori e potrai comunicare con noi dal vivo in tutto il mondo ogni volta che abbiamo Internet, fornirci feedback e farci domande. Avrai anche la possibilità di essere coinvolto nel processo creativo del documentario una volta concluse le riprese, prendendo parte alla post-produzione; in tal caso otterrai anche il titolo di consulente di post-produzione sul documentario e su IMDb.

​

 

Rischi, sfide e complicazioni

Quando si decide di girare un documentario in giro per il mondo su un’imbarcazione di 15 metri, bisogna prepararsi a tutto. Un progetto del genere mette in conto molti possibili rischi e complicazioni, e di questo ne siamo pienamente consapevoli. L’oceano è imprevedibile. Per esempio, ci potremmo trovare a cambiare rotta causa maltempo. Potremmo non farcela (anche se questa sarebbe comunque una storia interessante da raccontare), qualcuno potrebbe ammalarsi e dover tornare a casa prima del previsto, non possiamo prevederlo. Detto ciò, il capitano Mario è sicuro di aver composto un solido equipaggio. Siamo preparati per superare gli ostacoli che ci ostacoleranno il cammino. Perché siamo una squadra, una squadra unita e robusta sotto la guida di un grande capitano.

Siamo consapevoli che questo viaggio si svolgerà in un contesto particolare, fuori dall’ordinario. Abbiamo preso in seria considerazione il fattore COVID-19. Questa pandemia potrebbe potenzialmente impedirci di attraccare in alcuni porti, o costringerci a cambiare rotta. Tuttavia, siamo organizzati per disporre di acqua e cibo per tutta la durata del viaggio e inoltre abbiamo diritto ad usufruire di viveri da qualunque porto attraccheremo, sebbene la nazione corrispondente non ci dovesse far entrare causa Covid. Questo potrebbe significare infatti che dovremmo inaspettatamente fare dei periodi di quarantena in nave, ma solo se decidessimo di voler sbarcare e visitare un posto a piedi. Perciò in casi del genere si farà a votazione tra i membri dell’equipaggio per capire come è meglio muoverci.

 

Ovviamente abbiamo già tutti fatto il tampone per il covid risultando negativi, ma abbiamo intenzione di rifarlo prima della partenza per partire con sicurezza.​

 

 

Altri modi per aiutarci

Non puoi donare ma vuoi comunque aiutarci?

Puoi contribuire diffondendo questa campagna! Ogni condivisione ci avvicina al nostro sogno e alla realizzazione del documentario, quindi parlane con tutti! Amici e parenti!

Seguici su Instagram: @crew.atlantic, e taggaci se vuoi!

Perciò in casi del genere si farà a votazione tra i membri dell’equipaggio per capire come è meglio muoverci. Ovviamente abbiamo già tutti fatto il tampone per il covid risultando negativi, ma abbiamo intenzione di rifarlo prima della partenza per partire con sicurezza.​  Altri modi per aiutarciNon puoi donare ma vuoi comunque aiutarci?Puoi contribuire diffondendo questa campagna! Ogni condivisione ci avvicina al nostro sogno e alla realizzazione del documentario, quindi parlane con tutti! Amici e parenti!Seguici su Instagram: @crew.atlantic, e taggaci se vuoi!

story:
Five years ago, our team started this journey... a quest to find justice for Melissa Witt. 

Melissa was only 19-years-old when she was abducted from a bowling alley in Fort Smith, Arkansas.  Sadly, six weeks after her disappearance, Melissa's body was found some 50 miles away in the Ozark National Forest.

After 26 years, Melissa's murder remains unsolved.

This documentary, Uneven Ground: The Melissa Witt Story, could crack her case wide open....

But we need your help!

  • As we work to complete this documentary and prepare for a national release, our team needs to raise funding to cover expenses for marketing and distribution.  We need to purchase billboards, send out postcards, and flood the community of Fort Smith, Arkansas with information about the murder of Melissa Witt.  Someone knows something.
  • Each investor in our documentary will receive a t-shirt, bracelet and virtual VIP access to the documentary premiere!
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, every dollar raised will be used for our efforts to bring attention to Melissa's case.  This is our best and only chance to find #justiceformelissawitt!

Other Ways to get Involved

  • Share this campaign along with this: #justiceformelissawitt
  • Visit our website at whokilledmissywitt.com
  • Follow us on Facebook and Instagram @whokilledmissywitt

Melissa was only 19-years-old when she was abducted from a bowling alley in Fort Smith, Arkansas.  Sadly, six weeks after her disappearance, Melissa's body was found some 50 miles away in the Ozark National Forest.
After 26 years, Melissa's murder remains unsolved.
This documentary, Uneven Ground: The Melissa Witt Story, could crack her case wide open....

But we need your help!

As we work to complete this documentary and prepare for a national release, our team needs to raise funding to cover expenses for marketing and distribution.  We need to purchase billboards, send out postcards, and flood the community of Fort Smith, Arkansas with information about the murder of Melissa Witt.  Someone knows something.
Each investor in our documentary will receive a t-shirt, bracelet and virtual VIP access to the documentary premiere!
Even if we don't reach our goal, every dollar raised will be used for our efforts to bring attention to Melissa's case.  This is our best and only chance to find #justiceformelissawitt!
