story:
Documentary Summary

Hello and welcome to our fundraising page for our mini series films titled 'Where Do I Belong'!

'Where Do I Belong' is a 4 part series of 3-5 minute mini profile documentaries, to be released via high-traffic online platforms weekly over Black History Month.

The films aim to explore the positive and negative feelings members of the BAME community have with regards to the concept of ‘belonging’ in the workplace.

Ultimately we will objectively reflect where we currently sit with regards to the status of BAME inclusivity in well-known modern British workplaces.

 

Eno Enefiok x Sonder 

You are backing a film directed by award winning director Eno Enefiok and emerging documentary and music video director Joel Barney. Produced by the talented London based film production company Sonder. 

 

WE NEED YOU!

Unfortunately documentaries aren't made for free! We want to be able to tell the stories of our subjects in the most engaging and beautiful way possible.

Your money will be going towards factors that will help us make our documentary series to the best ability we can. 

We are looking for an initial backing of £10,000. This will get us through production, as we aim to get the film out in time for Black History Month (October).

We have some pretty unique perks for both individuals and businesses, so put your name to a good cause.

Who Are We?

Director - Eno Enefiok

Eno Enefiok was born in and raised in Nigeria until moving to the UK with her family, aged nine. Over the years she has worked as a Producer and 1st Assistant Director on a variety of feature films, Brand films, music videos, shorts and more. Her short script 'Asylum' won best live script at the 2019 British Urban Film Festival (BUFF).

Eno came to Sonder to help produce this documentary. The subject matter is something that is very close to her heart and with the stories being very personal.

Director - Joel Barney

Joel Barney is a London based director specialising in documentary and music videos. In 2017, Joel founded production company Sonder with good friend and DOP Oscar Ferguson. Joel has discovered a huge passion for using clean and  bold visuals to create films for brands and artists. His work has been featured on NOWNESS, NME Magazine, Clash Magazine as well as being screened at the Cinedans Film Festival and Sadler Wells Theatre. He is fascinated with delving deep into the lives of people and finding out what it is that makes them tick.

Producer - Ozzi Sanderson

Sonder Producer Ozzi Sanderson has been working hard on our documentary from the start. Getting involved in almost every facet of film from camera, to sound, to production has allowed Ozzi to gain a greater understanding into each individuals roles in a production. This knowledge has benefitted him in becoming a greater producer. With a creative passion and business mindset Ozzi has the tools to see out a production from start to finish.

D.O.P - Oscar Ferguson

Sonder D.O.P is heading up the filming of our series. With a passion and talent for using stunning visuals to tell stories, Oscar’s work has been fundamental to building Sonder’s visual identity.

Why This BAME Doc Is Not Your Usual BAME Doc

This is a mixed media film but the analogue moments aren’t simply there to look good. It'll help the audience get and feel that intimacy, with the speaker that is needed in order for this film to have the impact it deserves. 

There’s something about watching an old super 8 film or VHS home movie that makes you feel like in a past life, you were in the same space and time as person or people you’re watching. You experience the same euphoria or melancholy that they do. 

Even though in reality, you probably have never been to these places. You don’t personally know this people but in viewing them this way, you feel like you have. 

This is important as this a film for a wider audience about the BAME community, not a film about the BAME community, made specifically for the BAME community only.

This Is An Inclusive Film

This an inclusive film. With this in mind, the audience of this film must exceed the BAME community.

Distribution

Each episode will premiere weekly on various social media platforms including FB, IG and Twitter over the course of Black History Month. 

Our current situation has encouraged every demographic to rely solely on their devices to communicate, for entertainment, information and more. These habits may lessen after lockdown, but the behaviours will stay the same.

Like the sound design and score, the overall edit/film should feel polished, visceral and clean. The sound is the extra component to ensure that our intent with this film is exceeded in the finished product. We record as much sound as possible, even during B-roll and compose a score that is enigmatic, punchy and authentic to the real thing.

If you would like to know more or see our visual reference documentary please email ozzi@sonder.london

Thanks for your time!

story:
Short Summary

Hi there! Are you hungry for videos that are not just inspirational, but transformational? Hi, my name is Jeremiah Teo. I am a Charisma Coach, Storyteller, and Motivational Speaker. Charisma film series is all about igniting mindset shifts in how people should view charisma in themselves. In my 10 years of coaching experience, I had discovered through conversations and research that there is a growing identity crisis  (especially during this COVID 19 season) amongst millennials and Gen Z individuals which not only affect personal confidence in relationships but also performance in career.  

Charisma Film Series comprises of 11 episodes, namely:

1) Self-Esteem (Released)

https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=664469494303845

People Reached on Facebook:  7,573 (as of 10th Jul 2020)

# Organic: 193

# Paid: 7,447

Total Reactions, Comments, and Shares:

# Reactions: 49

# Comments: 0

# Shares: 3

Total Clicks:  807

# Link Clicks: 71

# Video Plays: 572

# Other Clicks: 164

Total Views: 5,966 (as of 10th Jul 2020)

2) Joy (Released)

https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=2962690883845560

People Reached on Facebook:  7,269 (as of 10th Jul 2020)

# Organic: 620 ( 427 more than previous film "Someone Like Me" )

# Paid: 6,687

Total Reactions, Comments, and Shares:

# Reactions: 12

# Shares: 2

Total Clicks:  697

# Video Plays: 535

# Other Clicks: 132

Total Views: 5,839 (as of 10th Jul 2020)

3) Peace (Released)

https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=3236038816416273

People Reached on Facebook:  16,638 (9,369 more than the previous film "My Joy" )

- (as of 10th Jul 2020)

# Organic: 11,723 ( 11,103 more than previous film "My Joy" )

# Paid: 5,197

Total Reactions, Comments, and Shares:

# Reactions: 120 (108 more than previous film "My Joy" )

# Comments: 3

# Shares: 116 (114 more than previous film "My Joy" )

Total Clicks:  1,180 (483 more than previous film "My Joy" )

# Link Clicks: 33

# Video Plays: 507

# Other Clicks: 640 ( 508 more than previous film "My Joy" )

Total Views: 7,745 (as of 10th Jul 2020)

# Bonus Testimony:  https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=3177898269102482

4) Patience (Released)

https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=153...

People Reached on Facebook:  16,274 (as of 10th Jul 2020)

# Organic: 8,871 

# Paid: 7,755

Total Reactions, Comments, and Shares:

# Reactions: 175 (55 more than previous film "PEACE" )

# Comments: 7

# Shares: 148 (32 more than previous film "PEACE" )

Total Clicks:  1,313 ( 616 more than previous film "PEACE" )

# Link Clicks: 0

# Video Plays: 513

# Other Clicks: 808

Total Views: 7,047 (as of 10th Jul 2020)

5) Kindness (Released)

https://www.facebook.com/jeremiahteocharisma/vi...

People Reached on Facebook:  10,016 (as of 10th Jul 2020)

# Organic: 6,055

# Paid: 3,961

Total Reactions, Comments, and Shares:

# Reactions: 89 

# Comments: 7

# Shares: 104 

Total Clicks:  594 

# Link Clicks: 0

# Video Plays: 252

# Other Clicks: 342

Total Views: 6,194 (as of 10th Jul 2020)

6) Gentleness (to be released on 29th Aug 2020)

7) Goodness (to be released on 26th Sept 2020) 

8) Faithfulness (to be released on 31st Oct 2020)

9) Self Control (to be released on 28th Nov 2020)

10) Love (to be released on 26th Dec 2020)

11) Charisma (to be released on 30th Jan 2021)

My vision for Charisma Film Series is to get viewers emotionally and rationally impacted by our stories and see their lives transformed for the better while they are navigating through daily struggles.

My mission for Charisma Film Series is to create inspirational short films about Charisma-related themes and illustrate how everyone can live a fulfilling life amidst trials and challenges.

With your investment, not only would you be contributing to the vision and mission of the Charisma Film Series, but it will also extend our audience reach through marketing and elevate the standards of our filmography.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to extend our audience reach through marketing to 1 million individuals (mainly through Facebook, followed by Instagram and Youtube) and elevate the standards of our filmography through better equipment, we would need $25,000 AUD that will only be invested in the following order of priorities:

1) Salaries for the chief videographer and sound director

Cost: $8,000 AUD

2)  Marketing campaigns for Episodes 4-11 of Charisma Film Series on Social Media platforms such as Facebook and Instagram.

Cost: $5,378 AUD

3) Purchase of better Videography and Audio Equipment (in the following order of priorities):

- Blackmagic Design Pocket Cinema Camera 6K (Canon EF/EF-S) 

Cost: $3,000 AUD

- Camera Lenses

Cost: $4,000 AUD

- Stabilizer (Gimbal)

Cost: $900 AUD

- Editing Software

Cost: $290 AUD 

- Music Licencing

Cost: $300 AUD 

- Shotgun Mic (Rode NTG 1)

Cost: $400 AUD

- Recorder (Tascam DR-40X)

Cost: $330 AUD

- Boom Pole

Cost: $170 AUD

- Deadcat wind muffler

Cost: $35 AUD

- Tripod

Cost: $150 AUD

- Shure SM7B Mic

Cost: $728 AUD

- Mic Stand for Shure SM7B

Cost: $35 AUD

- Cable for Mics

Cost: $40 AUD

4) 5 % platform fee to Indiegogo:

Cost: $1,250 AUD

Total Cost: $25,000 AUD

The collected funds will be spent based on the order of priorities above.

The Impact

In today's Covid 19 season that is unprecedented of the 21st century, Charisma Film Series had impacted at least tens of thousands through our positive messages and we believe that we would be able to impact 1 million individuals with your support.

# You can analyze the impact so far based on the statistics provided above for the films' outreach on Facebook.

Risks & Challenges

With a resilient team of audio professionals and videographers through the proven track records for the previous 5 films, we believe that we have what it takes to manage the risks and overcome any challenge ahead. Although it will be really helpful to have the requested funds collected, we will maximize and utilize whatever we have to produce high-quality films to add value to our audience regardless of the outcome of the campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not financially capable to contribute, you are still able to champion our cause in a zero-cost manner through liking and sharing our (1) crowdfunding campaign and (2) our previous and upcoming films, on various social media platforms and through the Indiegogo sharing tools.

story:
Help us tell an inspiring story of progress.

 

No Place Like Home introduces the world to brave, everyday people fighting for LGBTQ equality and refuting stereotypes about Kansas. You'll meet people who are out, loud and proud, as well as those who have quietly spent their whole life working for this cause. 

Academy Award-winning director Kevin Willmott is adapting the book by C.J. Janovy (winner of the Stubbendieck Great Plains Distinguished Book Prize and a finalist for a Lambda Literary Award in LGBTQ Nonfiction). Joining them on the Do Good Productions team are veteran film producer Scott Richardson and Sam Zeff, morning anchor at KCUR (Kansas City's NPR station), a national Emmy Award winner for investigative reporting.

No Place Like Home will empower activists of all kinds — not only those working for LGBTQ equality but for any cause that once seemed hopeless. 

Watch the trailer:

How you can be part of the team:

We've spent the last two years filming in locations throughout Kansas, thanks to generous support from individuals and foundations. Now, we need $25,000 to help with editing and finishing costs.

Everyone who contributes any amount will be listed in the credits.

Those who contribute at higher amounts can receive T-shirts and signed book copies.

What's next:

No Place Like Home  is set to air on public media outlets in the spring. The country’s wider political narrative will be shaped by November’s election. But whoever wins, at all levels of government, there will always be politicians trying to reverse hard-won progress on many fronts. This story shows how everyday activists find strength and resilience to keep fighting.

 

Other ways to support the cause:

Any contribution helps. If you aren't able to make a donation, you can forward our campaign to others and spread the word on social media.

Or, quite simply, support all activists and vote for candidates who fight for equality and justice for all.

Or, quite simply, support all activists and vote for candidates who fight for equality and justice for all.

story:
BOILER ROOM

After suffering a traumatic loss, Josh feeling insecure and uncertain, is dragged into a perilous situation by Calvin, a brash and apathetic boy who declares he's found the perfect place to hide out during class, the Boiler Room. Mila a rebellious extravert, along with Rebecca, timid, worrisome and easily influenced, join the boys as they skip class in the mechanical room under the school. Once inside their carefree adventure takes a turn for the worse and they must find a way out before it’s too late.

--

Hi, my name is Nico Wilcox. I’m a 16 year old high school junior from Spain. I’ve always known, from a young age, that I’ve wanted to pursue a professional career as a Film Director. My friend Andrew Tingler and I have put a lot of effort into writing this script and organizing this group of talented teenagers for making this short film. But to make it come true, we need your help. 

With this movie we want to tell the story of a kid who is melancholy and having difficulty coping with the loss of someone dear to him. At school he is pressured into a situation he wouldn’t normally be in. We want to show how peer pressure affects teenagers but also show them that they’re not alone; everybody has their doubts fears and insecurities. All people have gone through difficult moments in their lives. By telling this story we want to show that even though you can find yourself in a terrible situation there is hope for a better future.

 

MISSION /  OBJECTIVE

Our goal with this project is to create an environment and opportunity for teenagers who have a passion for acting and film, to create a professional level short film. To provide an outlet for our creativity, while at the same time fostering team work, cooperation, and respect. 

Through my own personal experience of dedicating a year of my life to making a feature length film, organizing and encouraging other people to keep with it, while at the same time maintaining my studies,  I learnt something incredible. When people are met with a challenge, then encouraged to stick with it, be positive and persistent, the effort of working together to accomplish a common creative goal leaves you with such an awesome positive feeling, that your self-confidence and self-esteem sky rockets.
 
This is the experience we want to help other kids to have and we are asking for your collaboration to make it happen. 

 

SAMPLE WORK 

You can see some of my previous work by clicking the links below. These are trailers for my feature film “Iberion” which I co-wrote, directed, shot, and edited. A film on which I organized and managed over 30 people.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qz5PXTzpJL8

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y9OSKCo_HEM

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP US

As high school students, we are not capable of providing all of the funds out of our own pockets. By contributing you would be helping us collect the budget for the film. 

The money collected will allow us to pay the required film licenses for music and audio sound effects. It will help to cover the costs for equipment, props, costumes, set design materials, hair & make up, transport, distribution, marketing, as well as catering for the cast and crew. 

We have some great perks that might interest you. When you choose the higher level perks, you will also receive all of the items from the lower categories.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you can not contribute financially, that does not mean you can't help. You can share the campaign with your friends and family. We want to get as many people as we can to know about our film project and you can play a big role in spreading the word.  

Finally, I want to sincerely thank you for taking the time to read our campaign. And remember, Live your dreams and encourage others to do the same!

story:
Short Summary

Charlotte Thompson-White is a university student on her gap year, after a hitchhiking incident she finds herself alone in Pendley Cliff - a quiet town with a dark secret. When a sudden power outage warning sends the town into a frenzy, the truth comes to light as desperate strangers find shelter in the local pub. But how long can they stay in the light?

What We Need & What You Get

We are a small film company who want to succeed in the film industry, we want to send our film to festivals and get our name known in this sector. We are striving for the best locations to make our visions come to life. We hope you will help us achieve this.

The rewards range from a thank you to an invitation to a special screening of the film and our extra special press pack and your name in the credits.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We want you to get MOONWALK known, Tell your mum, your dad, your sisters and your dog. 
  • Share this campaign.
  • You can find us on Facebook and Instagram under MOONWALKPICTURES. Give us a follow. 
  • We need you to get involved and SHARE SHARE SHARE

story:
Summary

We're seniors in the UNM Film Program. We're passionate about film. We have a big crew of excited filmmakers. Our film Gazelle Turned Lion is the culmination of work leading to our senior project. It's our last film as film students before we are thrust into the belly of the beast and we want to make sure it counts. The contributors will help us achieve in telling a story about a young office worker who learns to dance to impress his office crush, only to find out that his attempts were all in a pursuit of something greater. Symbolizing the importance of self-worth and self-determination. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're aiming to reach a goal of $2,500 dollars to accommodate our cast and crew. This avant-garde production involves collaboration with unique members of our community. In the industries of live entertainment, exotic dancing, and food service. Your collaboration will be honored with  an accreditation in the film.  

 

The Impact

This project gives an opportunity for its cast, crew, and audience to reflect on the value of learning new skills and self-betterment while having a laugh or two along the way. Our cast and crew have a combined wealth of experience working on independent films during our time at UNM and this is our chance to display our talents to a larger audience.  Filmmaking is our passion we have assembled a lot of talent and have a lot of faith in our characters and story. We know people will enjoy the film when they see it. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Investment in our project carries very little risk. No Senior Capstone has fallen through ever. We have the support of one of the finest film departments in the country. Every member of our crew is capable of producing top quality work and determined to create a quality picture. We have a solid plan that will ensure money is well spent. The maximum quality project will premiere at the Kimo Theatre in May.  In the event that we do not reach our funding goal, not to worry! We have contingencies in place for stretching the money that we do receive and still delivering on our promise. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word of our campaign to family members, friends, colleagues, etc.... Click the share buttons to spread the word. Follow us on Instagram @something and Like us on Facebook!

story:
EARTH INHABITANT
there is an arbitrary milestone of $150 left to reach in the next 5 hours

WHAT WILL HAPPEN IF WE SUCCEED?

WHAT WILL HAPPEN IF WE FAIL?

is it just arbitrary?

 

SEEDS BEGIN TO BLOSSOM. WE HAVE RECEIVED A TRANSMISSION FROM ARTIST "GOLDCONSCIOUS". HERE IS A PEEK. IF YOUR HEART IS STIRRED, CONSIDER YOUR GOLD, AND HOW IT MIGHT TRANSFER INTO MY MACHINE THAT MAKES MORE OF THESE HEART-STIRRING MOMENTS.

LAUGHTER COUNTS AS STIRRING.

SO DOES DEPRESSION.

 

maybe.

 

 

--------INTERRUPT TRANSMISSION--------

DOWNLOAD LINKS

BRING HEAVEN IN (EP)

ON SEVERAL LEVELS (LP)

PIANO ARRANGEMENTS VOL. 1 (LP)

STREAMING LINKS

BRING HEAVEN IN (EP)

ON SEVERAL LEVELS (EP)

PIANO ARRANGEMENTS (LP)

DON'T DREAM TIL IT'S OVER - MEDITATIONS ON A CROWDED HOUSE (EP)

 

---------RESUME TRANSMISSION---------

 

Looking for an easy, small investment into the creative with a fast, easy-to-witness turnaround? Here's why you should put a portion of your gold into powering my machine:

  • Who am I? You might think of me as an extra-terrestrial, here to bring you a rainbow-colored portal of exciting vibrations that are alien, yet familiar, ready to help people process emotion at an accelerated, ever-more-comprehensive rate. Or, you may think of me as a musician, here to audition steps to a new dance in hopes of lightening the spirit of the crowd. An alchemist, transmuting information into waves. A pompous, unwieldy bard, perhaps. All are true on some level. Who I am to you, is largely dependent on who you are, to you. 

  • To make the experience of this music complete, visual stimulation from another point of seeing is key for drawing a wider audience into its space for a more diverse, transformative experience. So, the relative pittance and nest egg (depends on one's point of seeing) of gold I require to satisfy the craftsman needs to come from others' curiosity and wish, and not my own desire, for these ends to be met honestly, with quality.
  • If the next stage of development can be summoned and observed by a broader group than before, the next stage of development can take hold, and more will be possible.

 

We raised $250 for a sensory-integrating story video, for an obscure B-side derived from a song from my first professional EP. If I could just pay the artist out of pocket to do the whole set of this current vehicle's current output, I would, but for this work to be of the quality desired, it's going to take incremental work and interest-building. This started with the first fusion of my unique art and another's unique art, when one of my favorite international artists, Ed Unitsky, developed the cover concept for my first full-length, professionally-produced, self-released album. This momentum can continue, strongly, if new alliances can produce a stimulating multimedia presentation to accompany this music, via cooperation with other unique artists. As for this video series--I would like to complete it, and see where we go from there. I can't wait to see the first video in the series--can you?

 

--------INTERRUPT TRANSMISSION--------

i've paid the artist to begin work on the first video. when it arrives, it will serve to better illustrate this fundraiser's purpose, which is integrate others' perspectives and artistries into my musical world, propelling our conscious universe toward expansion::::COMMUNICATING WITH EARTHLINGS IS DIFFICULT FOR ME::::i hope the effort is appreciated and reciprocated

---------RESUME TRANSMISSION---------

 

Here's What We Need To Bring This Dream To You, And What You Get For Doing It, Probable Earthling

Try to follow me here:

  • In the first stage of this fundraiser, I needed $198.91 to cover the artist's fees and the associated platform fees and taxes, and the rest was to account for this platforms fees and taxes, as well as provide a modest cushion for any unexpected arising needs. A small cushion sure would've been nice to prevent my initial fundraiser video from looking like an advertisement for the subtitling site--that's a lesson learned while putting this fundraiser together. Help me do better this time!
  • Bonus tracks, bonus tracks, bonus tracks. They're just going to keep coming. Sure, anyone can access them--but you'll be the first to know. 
  • Anything funding left from this fundraiser, if there is any, will be re-invested into further developing this video series until it reaches completion, encompassing my publicly-aimed "professional" output of June/July 2020. If that is accomplished, emerging future structures that integrate more of my work will integrate this project, but for now, this fundraiser money will be used for funding this series and preparing for the next stage of integration. When each video is complete, it'll be available here. 

 

--------INTERRUPT TRANSMISSION--------

 

I'm not sure how weird you like your music/lore, but if you enjoy this pitch, consider sharing it in your network. I've got a professionally-produced album with a top-tier artist on the cover, already complete and ready to be enjoyed today. Currently, I'm trying to fundraise a very modest budget to contract a budding 3D animation artist to transform this music into a story you can enjoy with more than your ears.

 

---------RESUME TRANSMISSION---------

 

The Future Of Music:

A lot of people want to tell you why their campaign is one of a kind. I love music as life itself, so now, you will hear me speak:

  • Deep love for music is my blood in every sense. It's an incredible and potent gateway to the depth and richness of life and spirit. I've recently free-released my first "professionally" self-produced EP and full-length LP, but this is built on the back of the creation of hundreds of songs comprising countless dozens of hours of music over more than two decades, many independently-produced (and independently-produced-sounding!) EPs and LPs in various forms and vehicles, thousands of hours of practicing instruments, and always-as-much but never-enough live performance--and a life lived raggedly turned to the wind, to match. Things really kicked into overdrive when I was commissioned on a shoestring budget to develop the soundtrack to an unannounced, genre-integrating video game from a fledgling developer that seemed to have endless possibilities--so many possibilities that I felt responsible for developing endlessly explorative music, to match that ambition. In that fusion, a musical monster of love was born. Recently, COVID-19 has placed live music on a near-lockdown, and I wish to do something new and revitalizing to help raise the collective consciousness. This "professionally-produced" music is the current vehicle for that "something new". And now, I'm ready to share the results of the grand experiment with you, and introduce them to a new vehicle. I invite you to examine my current vehicle: listen to my EP, Bring Heaven In, and my LP, On Several Levels, to show you what I can do with hard work and targeted investment. And then, I ask you to show me what we can accomplish when we work together.
  • So, this is cool. I'm going to make When Gardens Grow's music and associated media as open-source as I possibly can. Creating this integration music video (and taking the first step in creating a series of them) is a big step in that, by providing a tool to grow the community and stoke interest in this free, freely-manipulable, freely-incorporative music. When the fundraiser is done and the money's released to me, I'll immediately pay the artist, and when their part is done, I will make the result publicly available--and you will be able to download the full-quality version of the video for your own enjoyment, uninhibited by DRM or strict limitations, to be used in a personal way, in whatever format you'd like. In fact, you can listen to and download all of When Gardens Grow's professional-tier releases now, as well as listen to a variety of eclectic music I've created throughout the ages. Want to sample something? Sample! Need some high-quality source files or downloads? Please, take them! And if what you want is not there, like some sort of MIDI for a track, or maybe an arrangement that sounds like your favorite prog band after soaking in the acid--ask for them, I'll make them as available as I can, at as reasonable of a rate as I can muster. My email address is erinsjennings@gmail.com, I'll fulfill your request as quickly as I'm able. :) Maybe that'll encourage you to contribute and help me fulfill my dream. 

--------INTERRUPT TRANSMISSION--------

:) It's coming up roses. If you're in a position to, do you think you should share this, or even throw a few bucks to it? At $250, I greenlit the first syntesthetic video production. When we reach enough to greenlight the next stage, we will.

---------RESUME TRANSMISSION---------

 

But what if it's scary?

Sometimes, things in life are scary. What if things don't pan out as expected?

  • It's possible that I won't elicit the required gold in the time allotted.  
  • Should this happen, I will grovel before the craftsman, present what I have, and scrape the rest up from the very rocks and dirt of the earth, in hopes that they will show mercy and understanding--would I be able to meet my commitment in a meaningfully material way.

 

What if you don't have any gold, but still want to learn the steps?

Your ability to accumulate gold and distribute it does not determine your value as an entity, nor your value to this project.

  • You can listen to the music. Listening changes the music, and the music changes you. You can shape the music--make your own remixes, fan-art, videos, poetry, stories, and share freely, paired with the music, in any vehicle you wish. Though I haven't identified a specific open-source licensing structure yet, I understand that I own my music and I have the right to let others do as they please with it, within reasonable bounds. 
  • You can share this individual campaign, as well as the broader music, any way you wish, without inhibition. This campaign platform provides built-in tools to facilitate this process.

 

End transmission.

:) It's coming up roses. If you're in a position to, do you think you should share this, or even throw a few bucks to it? At $250, I greenlit the first syntesthetic video production. When we reach enough to greenlight the next stage, we will.

---------RESUME TRANSMISSION---------
 
But what if it's scary?
Sometimes, things in life are scary. What if things don't pan out as expected?

It's possible that I won't elicit the required gold in the time allotted.  
Should this happen, I will grovel before the craftsman, present what I have, and scrape the rest up from the very rocks and dirt of the earth, in hopes that they will show mercy and understanding--would I be able to meet my commitment in a meaningfully material way.


 
What if you don't have any gold, but still want to learn the steps?
Your ability to accumulate gold and distribute it does not determine your value as an entity, nor your value to this project.

You can listen to the music. Listening changes the music, and the music changes you. You can shape the music--make your own remixes, fan-art, videos, poetry, stories, and share freely, paired with the music, in any vehicle you wish. Though I haven't identified a specific open-source licensing structure yet, I understand that I own my music and I have the right to let others do as they please with it, within reasonable bounds. 
You can share this individual campaign, as well as the broader music, any way you wish, without inhibition. This campaign platform provides built-in tools to facilitate this process.

 End transmission.

story:
Hey now!

My name is Lonnie Frazier, I am a producer, a documentary filmmaker, and a Deadhead. I'd love to tell you about my latest project, Box of Rain. Box of Rain is a documentary film that explores the history and shared experiences (including mine) of fans of the Grateful Dead: Deadheads.  My team and I have spent several years traveling around the United States meeting with and interviewing other folks in the Deadhead community. We have collected hundreds of photos, concert tickets and Grateful Dead memorabilia...and we’ve heard so many stories. Now we’re ready to complete the film and share it with you!

 

How we got here

It started with a road trip and free tickets to see the Grateful Dead at Red Rocks in Colorado; and in a way, it ended with a road trip to revisit Red Rocks. This film has a very personal angle for me...I found the Deadhead community at a dangerous and pivotal time in my life. Being accepted by that community changed everything for me. This film is a chance for me to repay that debt, to show the beauty of Deadhead culture, and the power of acceptance.

 

Money, Money

So I guess you’re wondering exactly what we need and what we’re going to do with the funds we raise. I know I would be! We will spend every cent we make from our crowdfunding campaign on post-production expenses:

 

Paying the amazing artists working on this film

  • Editor - $7,000
  • Sound Editor - $7,000
  • Color Correction - $2,000
  • Music - $1,000

  

Additional Post-Production Costs

  • Legal Fees - $1,500
  • Licensing Fees - $1,000

  

 

Tell me more 

Sure thing! We need to pay our super amazing editor, and we need color correction to help enhance the exciting archival footage we’ll be using. We have secured access to some cool footage of the Deadhead community and can’t wait to share that! We also need to hire a talented sound engineer to help us create the most spectacular film experience possible for you. Deadhead culture is many things, but the music is central to the story, so we really need to have excellent sound quality! We’re working with independent musicians who will be writing original songs for our film...we want to get this right, but that takes money, and it takes people like you helping us move things forward. 

We would love to have you join us on the last leg of this journey and experience it with us.

 

Don't forget the perks!

If you do decide to join us, we have some fantastic perks for you! Please 'click' on the title of any perk on this campaign, and you'll see all the awesome things we're offering to thank you for believing in us! Social media shout-outs, exclusive access to the film when it’s completed (we're shooting for the end of the year), custom bumper stickers, a custom tote bag or keychain for your next road trip, and a one-of-a-kind hardcover book of photos (some from the film, some exclusives) that includes quotes from the folks we interviewed, and original writings by a poet who has been involved in this project from the very beginning. We’ll be printing a limited number of books and they won’t be available in stores, this is just a very special thank you to people who support this project. For those who are interested in being involved at a higher level, we are also pleased to offer Producer and Executive Producer credit on this film. We'd love to have you on the team!

We won't give up!

If we don’t reach our goal, we will still move forward with this project, but it will definitely take us longer to complete, and we really want to finish this film and share it with you by the end of 2020. We’ll use any money we raise on this campaign to keep the project alive and to keep us moving forward.

 

Social Impact

Ultimately, this film is about finding your tribe...finding acceptance, and finding a safe space to be yourself and to heal. I found this in the Deadhead community, but it’s a struggle we all understand. In a divided society, it is important to recognize the beauty to be found in every culture and community. 

You got this?

Yeah, we've got this! I have been working on documentary films and independent film projects for over a decade in many capacities: research, production, camera crew, producer, and director. I also serve as a Community Outreach Coordinator for other filmmakers, helping films reach the people who would be most impacted by their content. My team and I have also been fortunate enough to have so many wonderful folks from the Deadhead community serving as contributing producers and advisors. By pooling our talent and experience, we know we can create a beautiful film for you.

 

Not easy, but totally worth it!

Making a film is difficult, no doubt about that, but we’ve already done most of the hard work! We've spent years reaching out to folks within the Deadhead community who were willing to be interviewed and we traveled to meet them and hear their stories. We've gathered memorabilia and photos from people who wanted to share treasures from their time on the road following the Grateful Dead. And we've researched archival footage and images that will help us make this story come alive for the viewer. We will likely still face hurdles in this final stage, but this story is personal and our team is passionate and dedicated. We’re ready to face any challenge we meet so that we can finish our film and send it out into the world. We hope you’ll join us! This film has been an amazing journey about an amazing journey. We’re hoping you’ll help bring us home.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that we are living in really strange and uncertain times, so if you aren’t able to contribute financially right now...we get it. We totally get it. If you can’t donate funds, you can still help us. Please talk about our film and share our crowdfunding campaign with other folks and get the word out. If we reach enough people, we can make this happen...together. 

If you're interested in finding us on other platforms, we've got you covered:

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/boxofrainfilm/

Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/boxofrain.thefilm/

Twitter - https://twitter.com/BoxofRain18

Website -  https://boxofrainfilm.com

IMDb - https://www.imdb.com/title/tt12762788/?ref_=nv_sr_srsg_0

story:
Howdy!

Welcome to the crowdfunding page for the short-film Glass House. Thanks for stopping by and taking the time to learn a bit about me (Shannon C. Keith) the writer/producer/director, and my MFA thesis film.

Before you click to the next project seeking support, ponder this for a moment: What is it really like to live the life of a powerful politician, especially on the heels of a pandemic like COVID-19? 

Meet protagonist Madeleine Tremont (portrayed by actress Irene Krause Keen). She isn't happy living as as a political conservative in a post-pandemic world. Sick and tired of living inside a “glass house” and doing all she’s expected, she’s questioning everything about her life-- from her lack-luster marriage of three decades to cold and controlling husband Franklin, to her own sexuality. 

Meanwhile manipulative Franklin (portrayed by actor Dan Yeager), won't let anything keep them off the path he's made leading directly to the White House. 

When the opportunity to explore what it means to live authentically and be her own self finally seems to present itself, via "inspiration" from her new communications coordinator Kelly Koval (portrayed by actress Andrea Danne Peterson), Madeleine soon realizes the true responsibility of leading authentic lives lay in our own hands; our choices have consequences.

Simply put, if you were a fan of the famed House of Cards and fictional political power couple Francis and Claire Underwood, then Madeleine and Franklin are sure to give you the feels.

As writer/producer/director (me, pictured above, with the goofy expression) the primary objective is to produce a high quality short film that will be used for my MFA thesis qualification, be entered in film festivals and distributed online to be shared and seen by as many people as possible. It is then my hope that it will serve as "proof of concept" and someone will opt to make a larger investment in a feature-length script, allowing for the narrative to be continued.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I've opted for a flexible funding campaign because every little bit will and can help. The final script is 24 pages (typically a film this size would run $25K). I've called in a ton of favors and have been able to get the budget down to $15K.  The funding will be used to cover production costs such as travel, locations, insurance and equipment. Even if I don't reach my goal, the film will be made, as I need a complete film to qualify in February 2021.

There are some basic perks listed with more to come, and you also have the option to make a simple donation, sans any swag.

There's no such thing as a donation that's too big or too small! Even sharing this page counts and is appreciated!  Remember to follow the film's progress on the official Facebook page @GlassHouse_THEMOVE  and Twitter (@GlassHouseFilm) for updates, character "sidequels", and to communicate with the cast, crew, and fans.

story:
In this whimsical musical, Gabriel is on the verge of his 15th birthday and dreams of having his own quinceañera, a tradition reserved for girls. When his father - steeped in tradition - sets himself against the quinceañero, the timid and soft spoken boy will have to rally his family to make his dream come true.

This is a story about a passionate young boy breaking free from gender norms for a chance at authentic self expression.  As he questions the conventions and culture around him, Gabriel is coming into adulthood and by doing so coming home to himself.

As a team, we are looking to usher Gabriel home. We want him to find his joy and feel his own happiness while representing the specific and unique latinx experience. We want to bring it to life in the most loving way. 

We want to give Gabriel the glamorous quince he deserves - music, gowns, and a beautiful time. We also want to make sure our small independent team is well taken care of so that they feel safe enough to give it their all. Your contribution would go towards:

  • Gabriel’s ball gown 
  • COVID testing / PPE
  • Location rentals 
  • Paying the crew 

In partnership with LALIFF, all contributions are tax deductible- please ask us for the non profit tax ID if interested.   501(c)3 non-profit  Donations are TAX deductible.

SPREAD THE WORD AMIGO!

Money isn't everything! Please share this with all your friends and family! Tell your tios and tias, your primos y amigitos, tu abuelita tambien! Post about us on your Insta, Tik Tok, and all that jazz.

PRODUCT PLACEMENT

If you're in LA and would like to support the film, we can feature your product/brand on the screen as production placement in return for your contribution. Please don't hesitate to reach out! We don't bite, we promise. 

FOLLOW US

@Quinceanero_

story:
About the Film

A woman tries to survive a post-apocalyptic world, she ends up getting captured and forced to kill to survive Drexes and his ruthless war dogs.

Short Summary

Hello, my name is Masharne Nixon. I am a film director based in Maryland. My passion for film goes way back to my childhood. I loved how films were made and I always tried to figure out the special effects. I worked hard to put myself through school and I was the first in my family to get a degree. I got my degree in Multi-Media Production. As a kid and as an adult I would always come up with these unique stories. Originally it started with comic books where I was drawing comic books to create my own stories. When I became an adult I started turning my stories into short films. The film Jenocide is my first serious film where I had a large cast and crew. I was able to bring together a lot of people with similar passions to make my story come to life. It was completely volunteer and even international. Jenocide took on a life of its own and I would like to turn it into a full film. I feel like Hollywood often recycles ideas, while a post-apocalyptic world is not in itself original, I feel that my characters and take on it is. I was very impressed with what my cast, crew and I accomplished with literally no funding and I want to take this as far as I can and see my full vision come to life. In order to do that we need funding. This is where contributors like yourself come in. By donating we will be able to take this short film and turn it into a full feature.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking for $65,000. With this money, we would be able to pay for the actors, get quality special effects, hire a real stunt coordinator, be able to get a better production value, get better filming equipment, hire staff and secure/expand upon our filming location. As thanks for contributing and being involved in this project, you will get email updates on the project, behind the scenes photos, and video. Also, for contributing $5 or more you will get a digital copy of Jenocide, the short film/pilot that started all of this.  If we don't reach our total goal we will take whatever we do achieve to finish the film accordingly. This may mean scaling things back some but we will see this dream through one way or the other.

The Impact

I feel like post-apocalyptic films have become like zombie movies where they are all relatively the same. I created something different with Jenocide that got people excited with no budget at all. I think with a budget I can create something exciting that is different than what's currently saturating the market. Something that makes people take note as Mad Max did for my parent's generation. Having a budget will allow me to expand on the characters and the story itself. In my daily life, I'm a project engineer and that has taught me how to successfully manage projects and manage multiple moving pieces. I think that background and experience will make this project very successful. My passion for this film and my knowledge of film and managing projects will be key and instrumental to the success of this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, support Jenocide by spreading the word. The more people who know about the project, the better our chances of success. You can follow my page on FB for updates and casting calls. If you're local, support us by being a volunteer extra and help us create the society visual I have in mind for Jenocide. Tell your friends and family and bring them too.

https://www.facebook.com/MasharneNicNixon/

story:
SYNOPSIS 

Art installation at Tijuana border

Roberto Marquez is an immigrant of Mexican descent who came some 40 years ago as an undocumented individual. He came full of dreams with the hope of a better future. He started to envision his ascent in life early on, starting off by doing different trades. The agriculture industry was the first door to open, allowing him an opportunity to the American dream, thereafter, a server, and finally a construction worker. Today, he is an American citizen. The United States has been his home where his children were born and raised. Here, he made his dreams a reality. After many years of back breaking work, untold stories, and a soul full of repressed creativity; Robenz, as he goes by artistically decided to portray the struggle of the undocumented Latin American immigrant that attempts to cross the USA border.

His art breaks down borders, bringing cultures together, at times even being a voice for millions of people who have been coming to the country for hundreds of years with the intention of providing a dignified future for their families. 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Art installation at Tijuana border

 

During the development of this documentary, we have faced moments and situations that have put our reputations and even safety at risk. Despite being intimidating at times, these experiences triggered us to continue constructing a story that paints the vivid memory and drama of hundreds of immigrants that succeed or fail crossing the US border on a daily basis.

We have been at protests first hand to experience the authorities teargassing children and defenseless women, and without a doubt police harassment. On several occasions the authorities have detained the production team when travelling for expressing something they are not willing to say, the bigger question is, what are they scared of? For them, guns, tasers, batons and their armor are their form of intimidation. For us, art is our most powerful weapon in the toolbox. Roberto is our inspiration, his paintings clearly voice the feelings of a mistreated and discriminated community that envelop hard work ethic, peace, and bravery. Despite these historic difficulties they always overcome adversity.

Our team invites you to join us and to contribute. We are close to filming the majority of the documentary, but we need help. Through art, we dream about a world with no borders, no differences, and no social or racial affliction. From Roberto's story, we want to portray the story of millions of immigrants who have come to this country to help build a better society, a better future, a better world. 

SOCIAL IMPACT

 

Robenz working with immigrants at Honduras.

One of the immediate goals we aspire to fulfill is to generate a support system for vulnerable communities in Central and South America. We will do this by donating a percentage of the budget and profits to different Non-profits organizations in order to promote the practice of art with social and communitarian means. With this said our purpose is to encourage a more educated society that uses critical thinking in regards to policies and to unfold meaning to the social context in which the immigrant is exposed to.

ROBENZ AROUND THE WORLD

 

 

 

PRODUCTION TEAM

 Oscar Cardona: Producer/Post-Production/Co-Director

Oscar Cardona is a visual artist and documentarian filmmaker. Oscar has developed projects with a social impact in the arts and received many awards for his works ranging from expositions and exhibitions both in the local and international arena. Among some of the prizes he has won are; Premio Nacional Sin Formato de Fotogarfía del Ministerio de Cultura de Colombia, nominated for Premios India Catalina (Colombian Emmy's), Art exhibitions in Colombia, Brasil, Mexico and the United States. Among his most recent projects Una Cancha Llamada Medellin is an artistic documentary that examines how soccer is a tool of social transformation in the communities of Medellin, Colombia.

 

Felipe Barrientos: Co-Producer/Co-Director

Felipe was born and raised in Medellin, Colombia. Here he received his educational and family upbringing, he learned the value of family structure and how important it is but he also gained a love for academic, artistic and sport endeavors. In the early years he started his sports career which gave him the discipline for his studies as an engineer, singer and actor.

As soon he graduated from the University he left for the United States, like many immigrants, he had a diverse variety of jobs. Fifteen years years later a big dream of his to become an actor in Hollywood productions became a reality, this came after he landed the role 'Charger' in the hit TV show Queen of the South. He was nominated for Best Actor in the Short Film Mortal Dilemma at the Long Island International Film Festival, which also entered competition in the final phase for the Oscars. He has worked in several films and shows in Colombia and Argentina.

His passion for learning more behind the scenes action landed him  the role as a producer for Golden Ceiba Productions where they did films such as Blue Family and The Strike. In 2018, along with his friend and colleague Christopher Marquez, they founded 369 Cinema, a company focused on documentaries as well as fictional films with a social and humanistic drive. His first film as a Director and Producer will be El Paracaidista which is now in post-production.

 Christopher Marquez: Co-Producer/Co-Director

From a very early age Christopher always knew that words can either open doors or create destruction. His father, Roberto, early on inculcated the importance in developing communication skills, something he himself always felt that he was lacking; so he introduced him into the world of great orators and speech masters. This was the beginning to fully realize the power of presentation and delivery of the spoken word. In 2008 when Christopher was still trying to navigate the waters of his purpose in life he discovered acting by chance by doing a small role in a short film at the University of North Texas. Soon after, the bug got him and he dedicated himself to the craft by studying at the New York Film Academy under Maggie Reed and David Triacca. Filled with a new vigor, he joined Golden Ceiba Productions an independent film production company as Vice President, where he got his start in the indie world and later moved on to greener pastures. Since then, he has starred in such films as Habana Instant, The Strike, and co-starred in TV shows such Queen Sugar, Queen of the South, The Suicide Squad, DMZ, Black Lightning, and MacGyver. In 2018, Christopher embarked on his directorial debut documentary and is re-exploring themes of cultural and social significance that he finds close to his heart such as immigration.

 

 

SOCIAL MEDIA

Instagram: @369cinema

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/369cinema

 

ADDITIONAL PERK ITEMS INFORMATION

We have 14 unique protest flag art pieces that were used during real life protests in Mexico. For this reason, we give you the option  to pick the piece of art you desire. Ranging in sizes from 46 x 26.5 inches (smallest) to 108 x 65 inches (largest).  

 

STREET ART

 

 

AUTHENTIC PAINTINGS

 

 

FRAGMENTED ART
story_txt: SYNOPSIS Art installation at Tijuana borderRoberto Marquez is an immigrant of Mexican descent who came some 40 years ago as an undocumented individual. He came full of dreams with the hope of a better future. He started to envision his ascent in life early on, starting off by doing different trades. The agriculture industry was the first door to open, allowing him an opportunity to the American dream, thereafter, a server, and finally a construction worker. Today, he is an American citizen. The United States has been his home where his children were born and raised. Here, he made his dreams a reality. After many years of back breaking work, untold stories, and a soul full of repressed creativity; Robenz, as he goes by artistically decided to portray the struggle of the undocumented Latin American immigrant that attempts to cross the USA border.His art breaks down borders, bringing cultures together, at times even being a voice for millions of people who have been coming to the country for hundreds of years with the intention of providing a dignified future for their families.  RISKS AND CHALLENGESArt installation at Tijuana border During the development of this documentary, we have faced moments and situations that have put our reputations and even safety at risk. Despite being intimidating at times, these experiences triggered us to continue constructing a story that paints the vivid memory and drama of hundreds of immigrants that succeed or fail crossing the US border on a daily basis.We have been at protests first hand to experience the authorities teargassing children and defenseless women, and without a doubt police harassment. On several occasions the authorities have detained the production team when travelling for expressing something they are not willing to say, the bigger question is, what are they scared of? For them, guns, tasers, batons and their armor are their form of intimidation. For us, art is our most powerful weapon in the toolbox. Roberto is our inspiration, his paintings clearly voice the feelings of a mistreated and discriminated community that envelop hard work ethic, peace, and bravery. Despite these historic difficulties they always overcome adversity.Our team invites you to join us and to contribute. We are close to filming the majority of the documentary, but we need help. Through art, we dream about a world with no borders, no differences, and no social or racial affliction. story:
Short Summary

   This is a short based on a series of mysterious coincidences compose an uncanny encounter between a woman and a man. Through their transparent share of each other’s lives, she is led further into facing her years of unspoken yearning for consolation and prolonged reconciliation of her past. The story explores life’s mystery through the experience of raw and vulnerable human connections that inevitably lead to something beyond logical understanding.

   Set in the modern 21st century, Messenger is about the multi-aspects of Human Connection under the spotlight of individual vulnerability and yearning of belonging, as well as individual pain and suffering. The story explores the intricate yet universal sides of contemporary human interactions through the very act of connecting with someone in person.

What We Need & What You Get

   We have already gathered some fund from our own pockets, but it's not enough to cover the entirety of our ambitious project. We need supporters of the arts to help us make ends meet.

  • A Thank you in the Credits ($5)
  • Digital copy of the final product ($20)
  • Access to Behind the Scenes footage and pictures ($50)
  • Personalized thank you from the cast and producers in your digital copy ($100)
  • Associate Producer Credit ($200)

The Impact

   "In our current world of constant shift and change, where the speed of problem-rising is faster than the speed of problem-solving, many things remain unknown and uncertain when we try to look into the future that is both dauthing and unpredictable. We have more questions than the initiatives to answering them, what lies at the bottom of the suffering and grief that we experience? What does human connection mean in a world where physical touch is diminishing and isolated? What is it that we individually seek, driven by our primal desire to belong and to be connected?
    As an international student and a fellow human being, the past eight years of being exposed to multicultural content has challenged me and pushed me to cast more questions than getting answers in search of the width and depth of human conneciton’s puzzle. What does it mean to be human in our current world with regards to the relations we have with others and with ourselves? 
    The short film Messenger(s) seeks to explore the transformative nature of human connections and interactions, as well as shedding light on the unspoken reality that every single one of us is coming from a different place with unique stories that we hold within our core, of which is deeply in touch with the vulnerable, honest and powerful essence we each hold and share. " (Baolong Song, Writer/Director)

Risks & Challenges

   The last thing we want is to put the safety of our artist at risk, so we will be following the safety measures put out by our college to maintain a healthy working environment. This includes but is not limited to the following Covid 19 safety measures.

●      Daily symptom screening (via mobile app) required to enter campus facilities

●      Face coverings required to enter all campus facilities and classrooms

●      Detailed schedules for cleaning and sanitization (Clorox 360 machines)

●      Stockpile of protective equipment and supplies for employees and students

●      Contact tracing program with more than 20 contact tracers identified on campus

●      Comprehensive staff de-densification plan (staff presence capped at ~15% of total)

●      Reconfiguration and de-densification of all campus facilities, including residence halls and classrooms

Other Ways You Can Help

   Even if you can't donate money, we really apprieate you taking the time to read over what we have in store. We would absolutely love it if you could share this on any of your social media cites or with any of your friends, so we can get the word out about our project.

   In addition, we are working with the Mariposa Bakery to make this film a reality. You can help us by supporting them. They have curbside pickup from 8 am to 1 pm Wednesday through Friday at 424 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MA 02139. You can also find them at the Union Square Farmer's Market or by checking out their website www.mariposabakery.com

story:
Synopsis

Misguided Women is an action comedy that follows hit woman, Zora Castillo, who is hired to babysit social media star, Kendra Wells after the disappearance of Kendra’s parents. Kendra's parents, a world renowned lesbian scientist duo, have created a top secret supernatural device, but have recently gone off the grid. Zora does her best to discreetly get intel out of Kendra, all while being strung along on a wild ride as Kendra prepares for the release of her new song. When the two become besties, chaos ensues.

 

Meet the Family

Writer/Executive/Producer/Actress - Anna Sophia Moad

Multi-talented Anna Sophia Moad is a Northern California actress and stuntwoman from Sacramento. She has toured all over the United States and abroad as a professional dancer and entertainer for artists and brands  such as Taylor Swift, J-Lo, Tyga, French Montana, Mc Lyte, and Nike. You've seen her cross your TV screens in major network shows like Lucifer on Netflix and Sin City Saints on Yahoo.

 

Writer/Executive Producer/Actress - Liz Richman

"Triple threat" Liz Richman is an actress, singer, and 3rd degree black belt from Needham, Massachusetts. Since coming to LA she has kicked butt as Kim Possible's stunt double on Disney Channel and has appeared on 9-1-1 on FOX. She is also a recording artist, set to release her new single "Pieces" alongside the release of Misguided Women.

 

.

Writer/Associate Producer/Actress - Jul Kohler

Trilingual Jul Kohler was born in Berlin, Germany. Jul has worked all over the world, acting and doing stunts on film and TV, as well as dancing for artists like Katy Perry, Rihanna, and New Kids on the Block. Her female-driven Western Bury Me Not is currently circulating film festivals. Jul aspires to inspire with her voice as a writer and filmmaker by creating from the heart while empowering women by telling their side of the story, however complex and layered those stories may be.

 

Actor/Stuntman - Neil Angevine

Neil Angevine is an actor, stuntman, and Hollywood trainer originally from Missouri. Neil has worked on large Network shows such as 13 Reasons Why, and How to Get Away with Murder. He also works with clients to get them "camera ready" for their own roles!

 

Stunt Coordinator/Stuntman - Reuben J. Lee

Reuben J. Lee is a well rounded stunt performer who has worked on many shows like The Rookie, Seal Team , SWAT , 911,  and Outer Banks to name a few. Also catch him in the Venom sequel: "Let There Be Carnage" due in theaters in 2021 

 

*ADDITIONAL CAST COMING SOON*

 

How to Help

We accept donations in ALL FORMS!!! Financial support is more than appreciated, but so is the sharing of our social media pages/shoutouts and general support. We hope you'll join our weird family on this journey!

Be sure to follow us on INSTAGRAM!

 

Budget Breakdown

 

COVID-19 Procedure

The safety of our cast and crew are of utmost importance. We believe in proper protocols to ensure our set meets state and federal laws regarding COVID-19.

Some protocols include, but are not limited to:

  • Daily thermometer health checks for all cast and crew members
  • Swab testing for actors closer than 6-feet apart
  • Cloth masks on at all times
  • The proper social distancing of 6-feet between all crew members
  • Hand sanitizer available at all times
  • Established procedures for any member exhibiting coronavirus symptoms or for those who test positive

A COVID crew member onsite designated to ensure protocol is being followed.

story:
Why Fund Live Laugh Die?

The cast and crew of Live Laugh Die are passionate about creating and presenting a truly mind bending experience that fans of horror, comedy and romance can enjoy both for its noticeable influences and uniqueness. 

Live, Laugh, Die synopsis: Is a dark comedy centered around Steven, a down on his luck loser who has recently been broken up with after a failed proposal to his long time girlfriend. We follow Steven's downward spiral into darkness alongside his dark internal counterpart Joe. Joe's goals and Steven's don't always seem to align but not necessarily in the ways we think. As Steven's lust for rekindling his relationship continues so does his demise into a fumbling accidental serial killer.

Live, Laugh, Die will be Directed by Christopher Gatrost of True North Productions KY. Chris Gatrost has a history of directing short films while improving his craft and further cementing his style with each project. 

Our campaign is here to raise the funds necessary to pay experienced, quality actors while being able to utilize all practical special effects and quality locations. $5,000 is the cost of creating Live, Laugh, Die. The film already has guaranteed distribution. 

The ultimate goal is to create a film that threads through multiple genres.

Meet the Announced Cast and Crew

Adam Joseph Turner (Judas and the Black Messiah, Killing My Obsessions)

 Nicholas Edwards (Co-host True Crime Garage.)

Shawn Weston Thacker (Cobra Kai)

See who is involved in our cast and crew by visiting our IMDb page! https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13206586/?ref_=nv_...

What We Need & What You Get

Equipment use and rental: $0.00 - Why? TNPKY owns all of the equipment necessary for a quality cinematic film!

One of the great things about contributing is that even the smallest contribution gets you something. Even $1.00 gets you a shout out on the Facebook Production Page. A simple contribution of $5.00 gets you a digital streaming copy of the film as soon as it is completed. Beyond that, you can buy autographs, DVDs, time on set, a chance to act in the film, props and prosthetics,  producer credits, access and VIP attendance at a premiere, and more. As creators yourselves, you can even buy product placement in Live Laugh Die, whether it be your movie or a product you make.

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will complete a follow up fundraiser and also attempt to raise private donations. The film will be completed no matter what - your contribution ensures it will be as good as possible. 

Risks & Challenges

Covid is our primary challenge and we do not take that lightly. We have had lots of experience filming during Covid and have learned how to approach filmmaking in the safest way possible. 

All of the normal procedures for Covid-19 safe practice will be practiced: Masks, sanitizing and cleaning frequently, monitoring of symptoms and temperature, and social distancing as possible. 

Our biggest tool against Covid-19 is our ability to film with the best quality while maintaining a small cast and crew. Live Laugh Die has been designed over the last year and is written in a way that will have no more than 3 actors present in an indoor location at a time while keeping a minimal crew. Clever scheduling and staggering of cast/actors will provide smooth filmmaking and safety for everything while actually using the small size to create an increased sense of terror and isolation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Please help share this project with everyone you know.

story:
Meet Michelle Murad:

(That's me, with the sunflower top, directing family and friends).

In the third grade, during the end of the year swim team banquet,  I was awarded "Best Gossip." While all my other classmates were given trophies, I was gifted a Cosmopolitan Magazine. Little did I know then that storytelling was my calling.  Twenty years later, I packed my bags, picked up my SAG-AFTRA card, and moved in with an 87-year-old woman in North Hollywood. No, I do not still live with her anymore, but I have stories.  I have over ten years of professional experience in the entertainment industry. I have experience working in production as a production assistant, as a producer, writer, and actress. 

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3443003/

http://www.michellemurad.com

I am an alum from the UCLA Professional Program in Acting for the Camera(2016), Producing (2020), and TV Writing in Comedy(2018), where my musical tv series received "Honorable Mention" for best original comedy, which was later featured in Deadline. I am currently in the Women in Film Mentorship program, where I work alongside some of the top women in Hollywood.

SOME PREVIOUS WORK:

"Jewish By Association" (2018) Honorable Mention for Best Original Series in the UCLA TV Writing Contest! 

BLACKLIST REVIEW of "Jewish By Association" - 

This pilot is solid and works successfully on multiple levels. The narrative is helmed by the offbeat
Misha, a Millennial, defined (and arguably enslaved) by a childhood steeped in swirling Disney
romanticism. Between the female protagonist and the script's likelihood to spiral into
Disney-inspired, musically-inclined fantasy sequences, there are many memorable moments within the pilot:  Overall, the script is charming and entertaining and peopled with likable characters capable of sustaining a series and holding the audience attention. 

#BECOMINGWOKE (2019) 

Comedy Series receives a Recommendation from WESCREENPLAY! Only top 1% of scripts receive a "Recommend."

"The concept is pretty strong. There have been a lot of Go Back in Time sitcoms over the years. But this feels like it could be a fresh update on the subgenre."

 

SENIOR HOUR (2020)  Romantic Comedy/ Short Film

"This is a cute and quaint and pointed short film that nails the current moment but does not lean into it as a gimmick. It is still more about the characters and how they, particularly Alex, somewhat change their perspectives over the course of this Senior Hour at the grocery store." 

 

ABOUT "THE CHARLOTTE CHRONICLES":

COVID-19 has been a b*tch. Being quarantined from the rest of the world has been INCREDIBLY isolating and depressing, so I ADOPTED  a dog from Dogs without Borders, "Charlotte." Her original name was "Muffin," but I get weirded out by naming animals after food (more about that in the show).

(The day I adopted Charlotte 8/9/2020)

 She weighs in at a whopping 3.7 pounds! She has ears that probably weigh more than her entire body, and she's just the best thing that has ever happened to me (aside from sh*tting in the house).  Now the stories that have happened and the "characters" we have met since her adoption have just been one long Curb Your Enthusiasm episode. I've never seen LA from this angle before, and let me tell you, and it's funny, frightening, and fabulous all at once! I decided there were too many bizarre, OUTRAGEOUS, and lovely moments that have happened since her adoption, so I wrote it into a series. 

MEET SOME OF THE CAST:

Drea Renee as "Emily"

Born and raised in the great state of Texas, her Mom told her she came out of the womb “looking for the stage!” She excelled in school and joined every club possible. She was not only the Homecoming Queen but Captain of the drumline and Ms. Congeniality in the San Antonio pageant. After graduating from UT Austin with honors and a Radio Television Film degree, she worked hard, saved up all that she could, and moved to LA. When she parked her U-haul in the City of Angels, she had six dollars to her name and a dream. It wasn’t easy, but she stuck with it and eventually found her way in acting and hosting. She has most recently worked on short films, “This is 35” with director Tara Imperatore and “Baby” with director Cole Swanson. She can also be seen in commercials for Bandolier and Sprint. Drea has also worked in the poker industry, hosting various shows including “Poker After Dark” and “Deep Issues.” She’s a known face in the industry after 10 years and has interviewed all of the top poker pros in the game. She is vibrant, funny, and loves to make people laugh. You can catch her singing karaoke or making people laugh at an open mic night. More will be revealed for her as she continues to pursue her dreams on screen. She’s one to watch!

https://pro.imdb.com/name/nm11688240/?ref_=instant_nm_1&q=drea%20renee

Selina Ringel as "Sabrina"

Selina Ringel received her MFA from AFI Conservatory and was selected as an emerging Latino creator for the Tomorrow's Filmmakers Today program. She wrote and produced THE BEST PEOPLE, which won the Special Jury Award for Best Comedy Feature at WorldFest Houston. Selina moved in front of the camera, writing, producing, and starring in TUNING IN. She has also starred in a digital series for the Duplass Brothers and a few other shorts. She was in the groundlings and performed stand up regularly at The Comedy Store, Improv, and The Ice House​!

https://pro.imdb.com/name/nm3950326/?ref_=insta...

Lecia Papadopoulos as Michelle's "Mom"

Lecia Papadopoulos was born in 1961 in Denver, Colorado, USA, where her mother worked as an elementary school teacher. The family later moved to Casper, Wyoming, USA, where her father worked as a physician. She left high school early to study dance, later moving to New York, where she performed with Senta Driver, Calck Hook, and Glenn-Lund Dance. As an actor, Lecia has appeared in film, commercial, short-form improvisation, dance, and theater. She has served as a local spokesperson for various charities, including the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, Early/Head Start, and the United Way.

http://imdb.me/LeciaPapadopoulos​

Venk Potula as "Dennis"

Venk Potula is an award-winning Indian American filmmaker and actor based out of Los Angeles, CA, via Atlanta, GA. He is a graduate of UCLA’s School of Theater, Film, and Television, where he studied Theater and English. While in school, Venk studied filmmaking and acting with professors James Franco, Peter Weller, and Charles Haid. After graduating, Venk started a production company where he edits and directs digital branded content for various brands, including Bai, Vice Golf, Fnatic, Warner Sisters, Rise-Nation, and ARRI. His branded projects have aired on NBC’s Golf Channel and achieved 500K+ views on various digital platforms.​

http://imdb.me/venkpotula

Scot Hartman as "Patrick"

Scot Hartman is an American Actor born in Buffalo, NY. He began his career in NY, performing various stage/film roles, and then transitioned his career to CA. Scot has starred in “The Right Girl,” “Sophie” and was also cast in numerous projects at the Tamarind Theatre in Hollywood, CA. He has trained with some of the world’s most renowned acting coaches (Mel Shapiro, Uta Hagen, Steven McKinley Henderson, Felix Ivanov & Yuri Belov). Scot is thrilled to take on the role of Patrick in “The Charlotte Chronicles!"

Charlotte as "Charlotte"​

Kesha Mathews as "Jessica"

Kesha Mathews is a Uta Hagen trained actress based out of Los Angeles. Her diverse schooling includes training by Shannon Sturges, Indrani DeSouza, and Killian McHugh. Kesha can be seen in various commercials and made her theatrical debut in “Hot Pink.” Other projects include lead roles in “Ralph” and “A Short Farewell.”  
 

Teddy as “Gi Gi The Pomeranian”

MEET SOME OF THE CREW:

Dan Levy Dagerman - Director. 

Dan got an MFA from AFI Conservatory. His feature directorial debut THE BEST PEOPLE premiered at Cinequest and won an award for Best Comedy at WorldFest Houston. He directed several shorts that screened at festivals worldwide, including Palm Springs Shortfest, Gothenburg, and Mill Valley. Dan runs Two Hands Productions with his wife Selina Ringel.

https://vimeo.com/339373699

 

WHAT'S NEEDED:

We will be filming 5 episodes (5-7) minutes each! We’ve already raised almost 5k.  The goal is to rise an extra $15,000! That way, we will have 5k per episode! 

 We want this to be a fun working environment and to ultimately get people excited about adopting dogs because you just never know how your life can open up for the better.  Every bit helps and we could not be more grateful that you have decided to help make this story come to life!

Production is slated to start filming 1/23/21 ! 

WHY FUND THE SERIES? :

Why wait when you can create?! I'm inspired by so many people. I'm taking advice from some of my favorites, Reese Witherspoon, Issa Rae, Tyler Perry, Oprah, Eugene and Daniel Levy, and a few more. 

When you donate, YOU LITERALLY ARE HELPING CREATE JOBS!

Covid has been brutal to many, especially the Entertainment industry. With your help, we can pay our well-deserving, crew, team, and all those that will work on it!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Dennis von Hagen, actor and first time director/producer

The campaign is meant as a fundraiser for all the expenses we face: location, crew wages, props and submission fees for festivals. I have been planning this project for a long time, so I hope the funding will help get the project finally off the ground.

It is very hard to start a collaboration like the making of a movie without funds. The crowdfunding campaign will definitely help to gain momentum in order to turn this dream project into a real film that can be watched by a large audience.

What We Need & What You Get

Working with the bare minimum, we are trying to raise $10,000 and your contribution will make it happen. Depending on the amount you can spare, we will supply you with perks that are fun, and make you become part of the movie making business. From unique behind the scenes pictures to signed copies of the original script, to being listed in the credits as a producer, it's your call how much of the fun you want to experience.

The Impact

Your contribution will help me pay a minimum to my actors and crew, which in turn will motivate them to spend their valuable time on making this movie. I found a great location in the east bay, which we can rent by the day, however the building management, even though providing a very good deal, needs to make some money as well. And finally, in order to find a wide audience, we are going to submit our film to as many festivals as possible.

In the unlikely event, that we do not reach our goal, we will still commit to spending whatever amount we can raise as efficiently and sensible as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

At last but not the least, help us getting the word out about our project. Tell your friends about the movie and your involvement and make them jealous. Then, tell them how they can help us make this reality. and let them know about the Indiegogo share tools
