story:
Faking Filmation is a documentary that explores the depths of fandom, intellectual property and the dangerous intersection between them while tracing the origin and evolution of cartoons, the history of Filmation and one man's mission to create the ultimate love letter to the creators of his favorite cartoon show.

Synopsis:

James Eatock has an obsession: 80s cartoons. While most fans of the era can quote various episodes and talk in depth about character backstory, James' encyclopedic knowledge goes much deeper. He can tell you when and where characters appear with slightly different color shades, when lines were dubbed in, when and where storyboards were different than the final episode, and knows all about unproduced shows and future plans. He lives and breathes it and specifically, He-Man and the Masters of the Universe. Ever since he was a kid, he's wanted to tell He-Man stories and while he's authored books for Dark Horse detailing every single episode of the beloved cartoon, edited the celebrated fan magazine, cereal:geek, and remains a popular resource for 80s cartoons, his childhood goal has alluded him - until 2017. 

Four years ago, James decided he was going to fulfill his dreams and create an unofficial He-Man cartoon that, ideally, would seamlessly fit into the heralded Filmation version of the famed character. The look, the sounds, the voices, the music - It was all going to be like the Filmation series. After 3.5 years of hard work with a handful of collaborators all volunteering their efforts because they shared the same passion as James, the cartoon was completed and ready to showcase at Power-Con - and then came the legal warnings from NBC/Universal, the rights holder for He-Man and the Masters of the Universe. With his childhood dream on the precipice of becoming a reality, James must now choose what he wants to do: does he shelve it and save himself from expensive legal action? Does he find a way around the situation? Does he release it no matter what - because dreams matter more than money? Of course, he has decided to journey forward!

While chronicling James' journey to create and release his unofficial cartoon, we will talk to industry insiders, animation aficionados, and cartoon lovers from everywhere about the impact of cartoons, the current state of cartoon culture, Saturday morning, weekday and prime time Cartoons, the rise and fall of Filmation, the impact of He-Man and the Masters of the Universe, Fan Films and so much more!!!

While the main drive of the film will be James' story including his beginnings, personal life and so forth, it's all being wrapped in a giant discussion about cartoons with some of the most respected and talented people on the planet. So what kind of topics will the film showcase? LOTS:

Cartoon history/evolution, the rise and fall of Saturday Morning, emergence of afternoon/weekday cartoon dominance, prime time toons, cartoons and learning, hand-drawn vs CG, Cartoon Network and 24/7 cartoons, cartoons for adults, branding/licensing, cartoons and politics, cartoons and toys, viewer impact, domestic and foreign production, cartoon heroes and villains, from movies to television to youtube and SO MANY MORE!

Those are some very broad topics but just know our focus rests in episode content created for television - that's what we consider cartoons for the purposes of this film - even when practice was to bundle theatrical shorts for air on TV.

But what cartoons will we discuss and showcase?

Of course, we'll discuss He-Man and the Masters of the Universe and She-ra: Princess of Power given the obvious tie to James' story, but we'll also explore other shows like G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero, Transformers, M.A.S.K., C.O.P.S., Visionaries, The Mighty Hercules, Blackstar, Bravestarr, The Real Ghostbusters, Captain Planet, Reboot, Scooby-Doo, The Flintstones, The Simpsons, South Park, Rick and Morty, Adventure Time, Batman: The Animated Series, X-Men, Spider-Man, Thundercats but basically whatever  people bring up during our discussions! There is certainly a heavy 80s and 90s influence with the above shows, but it would be impossible to tell this story and leave out hits from the 60s and 70s, plus everything that's happened in the last 20 years too!

Here are some of the people who have agreed to participate in our production if we get funded:

Erika Scheimer - Producer/Production Coordinator/Voice Actor, He-Man, She-Ra

Rob Lamb - Writer/Storyboard Artist, He-Man, She-Ra, Filmation's Ghostbusters

Tom Tataranowicz - Director/Producer/Animator, He-Man, She-Ra, Biker Mice from Mars

Andy Mangels - Co-Author, Creating the Filmation Generation

Larry Houston - X-Men: TAS, G.I. Joe, TMNT, C.O.P.S., Batman: TAS, Exosquad

J. Larry Carroll - Writer, TMNT, Captain Planet, G.I. Joe, Thundercats, Bravestarr, She-ra

Victor Dal Chele - Director/Storyboard Artist, Extreme Ghostbusters, Exosquad, SWAT Kats

Ron Friedman - Writer, Transformers: The Movie, Bionic Six, G.I. Joe, Fantastic Four

Brynne Chandler - Writer, Batman: TAS, Spider-Man, Gargoyles, TMNT, He-Man, She-ra

Christy Marx - Writer, Bucky O'Hare, G.I. Joe, Dino-Riders, Jem

Zadoc Angell - Co-founder of The He-Man and She-Ra Episode Review Website & Producer, Van Helsing

Val Staples - Event Director, Power-Con

"MOTU Joe" Teague - Masters of the Universe collector and pop culture expert

Daniel Benedict - Filmmaker, Fall of Grayskull, The Bloody Man

Dusan Mitrovic - Director/Producer, The Return of Faker

Andrew Cramer - Lead colorist, The Return of Faker

Keith Seymour - Special FX, The Return of Faker

Jukka Issakainen - Writer, Dark Horse MOTU books / Colorist, "The Return of Faker"

Jay Bartlett - Toy Collector, Action Figure Adventure, Nintendo Quest

Jordan Morris - Writer, Former Toy Store Owner

Glenn Stanway - Video Game Producer

AND MANY MORE PROFESSIONALS, FANS, COLLECTORS, INSIDERS AND PEOPLE LIKE YOU!

Many of you visiting this campaign are curious if we will include The Return of Faker as  bonus material, in some sort of uncut, unaltered capacity. I can say our current goal is to include The Return of Faker as a piece of bonus content. To make this possible, we will seed the cartoon center-frame and have various "pop-up facts" that appear throughout the runtime that further showcase the process to make the unofficial cartoon come to fruition. None of the pop-ups will cover the cartoon but will appear beside the cartoon and point out things like dialogue that was used from other episodes, instances where other Filmation cartoon characters were used for reference poses, FX work etc. This is important because a lot of time and effort went into creating this unofficial cartoon and given that the focus of this documentary is the cartoon, it's creation and hopefully, it's release, showcasing it uncut and in full, further showcases our goals.

But there's more...

I firmly believe this is a rare opportunity to take James' love for cartoons from the 80s and his efforts to make The Return of Faker as a vehicle to unpack all of cartoon history, and of course, Filmation. I've been waiting for a great, current day story about 80s cartoons for a long time and to have one that follows an individual who's hellbent and driven beyond any relative rational sense of sanity to most people is RARE. It'll be great if we hit our base goal and showcase how James and his team made The Return of Faker, but it will be special and significant if we can showcase the James' journey to see his childhood dream come true. Specifically, there are NINE key goals that James has and wants to accomplish with "The Return of Faker" - and they're all awesome!!!

It's no secret that making films is not a cheap endeavor. Below you will see the projected cost of this film, for the full blown feature length, global release version - which is only a starting point depending how long the journey takes to truly unfold and resolve. On average, documentaries take 3-5 years to shoot, edit and complete. We think our story will resolve sooner than that with delivery around the 2 year mark. 

Rob McCallum - Writer/Director, Pyre Productions

Locked in a tower in parts unknown, Rob McCallum spends his time building elaborate story-driven worlds, playing with action figures, video games or air drumming to some of his favorite tunes. This Emmy-nominated and award-winning filmmaker has been featured on NBC, CBS, CBC Radio•One, WIRE, /Film and Destructoid over the course of his career that includes sales to Netflix, Super Channel, Tubi, and other broadcasters around the world. He’s obsessed with all things Jim Henson, has a deep love of Masters of the Universe and one day wants to visit Duckburg.

www.RobMcZob.com

This motion picture is protected under the copyright laws of the United States and other countries throughout the world. Country of first publication: United States of America. Any unauthorized exhibition, distribution, or copying of this film or any part thereof (including soundtrack and "bonus materials") may result in civil liability and criminal prosecution. If you become a backer of this project, you pledge to retain your rewards for private exhibition only and will not share, showcase, or upload any of the associated material.

Risks and challenges

We're created this campaign with scalable goals and expectations. The backers determine the end result with their level of support. We will be able to create a better end product with the more we raise, but that also means more time. The people involved in the creation of this film hail from at least 3 or more countries that have different styles of governments with different ways of operating - in other words, who knows what obstacles might arise, as we've seen with the pandemic, but we will do our best to give you an amazing film commensurate with the amount we raise, just like all our other projects.

Special Thanks to the London Arts Council of London, Ontario for supporting our endeavor!

story:
Welcome to Our compaign!

This film is an epic drama, which can become a discovery for many people! Thanks to your participation, every investment will be a small brick, which will enable to finish this picture.

Synopsis: A shooting in Maidan haunts the mind of the ex-activist – his friend is killed. Wishing to avenge, he and his girl become prisoners of a warlord, who occupied a part of Ukraine’s territory, who doesn’t obey anybody and dispenses his own justice. Both hostages are sent to the family of three brothers-militants, two of them fight in the Ideologist’s detachment; the third one is disabled from childhood boy, nicknamed Freak, who buries a faceless bodies of the war. A hostage girl is a sex slave of the eldest brother, Maidan activist is tried to be exchanged profitably. The term is 6 days, otherwise he will be killed. But the chain of appeared conflicts is tearing the militants’ family up inside.

Thanks to your support, together, we’ll be able to tell people about the tragedy concerning the whole world, which appeared in Ukraine. It is our anti-war manifesto that we would like to convey to every viewer along with you!


A film “Of humans, horses and heinous” will be the second one from the cycle of stories about present-day Ukraine we want to show the world.

We have already shot an exclusive artistic picture about EuroMaidan events “Once upon a time in Ukraine”, which is unprecedented and unique, socially significant work in the World Cinema, because live-action scenes were shot directly during the real events in Maidan. 

     


Our team, in spite of the lack of finance, considers it our duty to shoot this film. We have already managed to make 70% of the whole material by our own forces! But our resources are not limitless, that’s why we appeal you to join this project.  

Your support can help us all together to complete the project in the nearest time. However, you shouldn’t think this film is intended just to remind the world community about problem in Ukraine.The main thing is that we want to avoid such conflicts in the whole world in the future and think this film can make a contribution to the struggle for peace.

Photos from the film-making process

  

 

    

  


A team working on the film “Of humans, horses and heinous” has many years of implementation and realization of socially important projects. It is an organization and holding of the International Human Rights Film Festival "Steps", annually bringing together participants from more than 50 countries around the world under its roof; tens of congresses, actions, conferences on human, animal and environmental rights. Making socially-significant cinema; at the moment the film studio "STEPS" has shot 16 films, 9 of them are full-length feature films,  which took part in dozens of international film festivals and received numerous awards.

A film director, producer, actor, scriptwriter.

Since 1997, he has been a president of the Human Rights Centre "Steps" n. a. Leo Tolstoy. His active social activity and creativity are related to the protection of human, animal and environmental rights. In 2000 he received the title of "Person of the Year - Person of the Millennium" in the “Nature Defender of the Year” category (Ukraine, Kiev). In 2004 he created a film studio “Steps”, the main idea of which is making socially significant films. Since 2007, he has founded and organized the International Human Rights Film Festival "Steps", which is held over 7 years, gathering films from more than fifty countries of the world every year. The films demonstrated at the festival, are the films devoted to the human rights, animals and nature protection, as well as films of spiritual, philosophical and social themes. Since 2011 he is a member of the Ukrainian Association of Cinematographers. 

In the project “About humans, horses and heinous...” he works as a film director, a scriptwriter. 

Cetalife

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


A repeated champion of Ukraine, a participant of the Rhythmic Gymnastics European Championship, actress. At the age of 19 she joined a public organization The Human Rights Centre "Steps", where she participates in numerous campaigns, promotions and demonstrations not only in Ukraine but also at the international level. In 2007 she became an art director of the film studio "Steps". In the project “About humans, horses and heinous...” she works as an actress, production designer and manager of the project. 

 

 

 

   

A cinematographer of the first category.

Many years he works as an operator with Alexander Sokurov. Among his works such pictures as "The Second Circle", "Father and Son", "Alexandra", etc. In 2000, Alexander Burov was nominated for the European Film Award for Best Сinematography - film "The Wedding" by Pavel Lungin. In the project “About humans, horses and heinous...” he works as a cinematographer.  

We have managed to make 70% of the whole material by our own forces! Our team thinks that it’s our duty to show the world this uncomfortable truth, which is going on in Ukraine; that’s why the project will be completed anyway, even if we won’t get an expected financial support, which is necessary to shoot the film in full measure, with all planned scenes, and also for performing the highest quality post-roduction.

After completion of the campaign, the film is expected to have numerous premieres, festival life, as well as shows in cinemas and on television. 

“Of humans, horses and heinous...” is the second film of trilogy. And after the successful completion of the project, the preparatory stage for the shooting of an independent third part will begin. The script is already being written. We do not disclose the plot of the next film. But we promise that it will be not less important for Ukraine and the world!

story:
Short Summary

'E&H' is a love story that transcends time and place. It is a story of hope and family and about coming face to face with a past that haunts you to be better able to deal with life for a better tomorrow. This film is important to me and to this group of artists because it is an opportunity to achieve something really great, the ability to produce a film and be able to tell this incredible story our own way without a studio dictating the terms of funding based on what story they want to tell.

By contributing to our campaign, you will be supporting the voice of some fantastic female writers, Sorel Kairé and Gabriela Lopez de Dennis and an award-winning director, Allison Bergman. The producing team is also comprised of an award-winning group of producers, Stephanie Wiand, Melissa Perl, Michael Perl and myself.

Here is our "Proof of Concept" trailer for the film:


We were able to put something together to give a feel for the film, of course this isn't the actual footage from the movie, just something to show mood and some imagery.

OUR DIRECTOR - ALLISON BERGMAN:
Twitter: @BergmanDirector

She comes from the stage and as such, she gets this script. 'E&H' unfolds from one evening into the dawn. It is a character driven drama and Allison's specialty has always been  about extrapolating the nitty-gritty of what makes people tick in a play. In essence, she is the perfect fit to tell this story, her director's eye and experience is just what we need.

*****

THE SCREENWRITERS - GABRIELA LÓPEZ DE DENNIS & SOREL KAIRÉ:
Twitter: @TheGabriela & @leroseriak, respectively

These two ladies wrote the award-winning 'Fixing Paco' starring Gloria Garayua and Paul Rodriguez and then translated all 9 episodes into Spanish. Both versions of this story have received international attention for the groundbreaking work done on the project. We are so very lucky they happened to write this little script of ours with so much depth and clarity.

*****

PRODUCER - MELISSA PERL:

Deep theater roots drivee this artists soul. Her background as an actor, choreographer, and now producer have provided a thorough understanding of the inner workings of production. She just wrapped art direction on an epic web series spanning 5 decades and producing a short film.

*****

PRODUCER - MICHAEL PERL:
Twitter: @MichaelAlanPerl

No stranger to producing, Michael has produced theater, film and an ambitious science fiction web series.  As an actor, he has been a series regular and guest star actor on several series over the years as well as worked in the theater. His background will provide an immense knowledge base for our production.

*****

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER - STEPHANIE WIAND:
Twitter: @StephanieWiand

Stephanie has produced several award-winning projects over the eyes with 'Fixing Paco' being the most recent, garnering two Imagen Foundation Award Nominations in 2012 & 2013; People's Telly Silver Winner 2013; 2012 Reel Rasquache Film Festival Best Webisode, Fixing Paco; Official Selection, 2013 Reel Rasquache Film Festival, Fixing Paco: Changing Lives. Her first feature film as producer, Revenge of the Bimbot Zombie Killers, a B-Movie spoof, took Best Picture honors at the Reel Rasquache Film Festival in 2011. It just got picked up for distribution in the US and Canada and screened to an enthusiastic audience at Comikaze Expo 2014 in Los Angeles.

*****

PRODUCER - JOE CAMARENO:
Twitter: @JoeCamareno

With numerous awards under his belt as a producer and director, and a canon of work spanning from critically-acclaimed theater productions and web series to B-Movie spoofs and in international film shot on two continents, Joe brings a unique perspective to this production. His awards and nominations include: 2006 PARSEC Award, Virgin Falls; 2010 IMAGEN Award, Ylse; People's Telly Silver Winner 2013, IMAGEN Awards Nominee 2013, 2012 Reel Rasquache Film Festival Best Webisode, Fixing Paco; Official Selection, 2013 Reel Rasquache Film Festival, Fixing Paco: Changing Lives; Best Feature, Reel Rasquache Film Festival 2011, Revenge of the Bimbot Zombie Killers.

*****

OUR DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY - GILES ANDREWS:

Hailing from the UK, Giles will be flying in to work on our film. He DP'd the last film that Joe and Stephanie produced together called, 'Tin Holiday.' 'Tin' is still in post and should be finished by the time we start production on 'E&H' this summer. He is also a screenwriter and filmmaker. He plans on making Los Angeles his home as production starts on 'E&H' this summer.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $55,000! It's a lot of money, but for a film, it is not much. We are working with a bare-bones crew and plan to shoot this film in 12 days. The writers, director, producers and most of the actors are all donating their time for now, they are working on a deferred pay plan, meaning if the film does well upon being released, and we can recoup some funds, then and only then will they get some money for their work. The only folks getting paid are the crew for production, post-production, rental companies, insurance and of course food to feed the cast and crew. The funding will also pay for some wardrobe and props and a dog sitter.

We have some really great perks from film merchandise like T-shirts and posters to some astrological readings and hypnotherapy sessions and a week stay at an incredible location in Guatemala. The owner of this property has offered up a room in her AirBnB registered home that is quite popular on their site. She is excited about our project that she offered up her space as a perk. We will feature this perk in a few weeks. :)

If we don't make our goal, we will probably still go ahead, but it will be on our credit cards and while that isn't the most prudent way to do things, it would be the most efficient as far as getting it done. We are looking to private investors, but so far we have been unable to secure funding.


The Impact

This project is different because we are making a film in a very non-traditional way for Hollywood. If this film had made it's way through the Hollywood machine, it would have never made it past the reader. It would never have been cast with these fine actors and our director would never have been given this opportunity and the writers would probably have never had a chance to even get their work produced. Why? Not because it isn't good. It is. It is a fantastic script, but because it isn't a film about cliches and the expected pretty cast of 20 somethings. It is an adult story with adult circumstances, there's no sex, or violence. It is a story of the human condition and connection and family that is being told from a very unique perspective, a different perspective with a traditional indie film vibe.

Your contribution will help us tell this story. And this story should be told if not to give the brilliant female writers and director an opportunity to shine in a male dominated industry. Yes, I am male, but I do believe in shining the light on talent in whatever form that talent takes. This film is worth your contribution. Personally, I am a multi-award-winning producer and director. I do not like talking about myself this way, but I know and understand that awards do mean something. It means someone has approved of your work, you have been vetted. My first film 'Revenge of the Bimbot Zombie Killers' was crowdfunded successfully in 2011 and took Best Feature honors at a Los Angeles film festival. It was picked up for distribution and is now available for streaming and download. 'Bimbots' is a Mel Brooks type B-movie spoof, which screened at Comikaze Expo in 2014 to a very enthusiastic audience. My web series 'Fixing Paco' starring legendary comedian, Paul Rodriguez, has garnered several awards for direction and producing including a Telly Award and two nominations for an Imagen Award in 2013 & 2014. 

Help us tell the story in 'Edith & Harvey' and be part of our success. We can't do it without you!

Risks & Challenges

As producers of lower budget productions, we've always been able to find a way to do things and make it happen. We've learned to be very careful with money and budget wisely to make the money we have designated for specific line items on a film to last, which is why we can make this film for so little. Believe it when we say we could use a whole lot more, and if we do surpass our goal, the folks volunteering of their time will get something for their troubles as it were. So your hard earned money will go to great use!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute for whatever reason and the story of our film resonates with you, you can help us by sharing our link with your friends and family. You can do this easily by using the Indiegogo share tools on this page. Share on FB, Twitter or email the link. It's easy!

Thanks for reading this tome! :) And I hope you will help us make this awesome film and be part of our success!

story:
Are you addicted to your cell phone? Or are you dismayed everybody else seems to be addicted to theirs? Either way, THE THRILL OF BEING FOLLOWED is for you!

Hi there! My name is Mickey Newman. I've been writing and directing films for over ten years, I freelance as a videographer and editor, and I am currently an MFA candidate in the Film and Media Arts department at Temple University. 

And right now? I'm excitedly gearing up to shoot my graduate thesis film: 


THE PLOT!

After her smart phone is kidnapped and held for ransom, a neurotic woman and her mischievous boyfriend embark on an amusing adventure to retrieve it.

Inspired by the charm and wit of Amelie and God of Love, this short comedy pokes fun at cell phone addiction and features a treasure hunt, a clever twist ending, and a narrator with a voice like Barry White!            

                 

THE THEME!

Many people today are so dependent on their cell phones that they are unable to function without them. It's almost as if they're drugs! In fact, it's been scientifically proven that cell phone vibrations raise dopamine (i.e. pleasure) levels in the brain.

After all, an incoming text message makes us feel wanted/desired/important (i.e. someone need us!) and it also presents us with a mystery -- WHO needs us? Is it someone important? Is it someone you're dying to hear from?

Most people will interrupt anything they’re doing to find out. Of course, what we never realize is that if it was really that important, they'd, you know... call.
               

                 


PROJECT GOALS!

1) Make a great film that's easy to relate to and brings a smile to people's faces 
2) Submit this film to national and international film festivals
3) Use it as a pilot episode for a TV show that pokes fun at social eccentricities
                       (this will be much easier to do if it gets into film festivals!)


                 
                 (We will submit this film to A LOT MORE festivals than appear above)



JOIN US!

Anybody can make a movie, but it takes time, patience, and funding to do it right. That's where we hope you come in.

I am hiring experienced actors and a professional crew, shooting on the RED Epic camera (one of the most revered digital cameras in the world), renting auxiliary equipment (such as LED lights, jibs, steadicams, car rigs, etc.), purchasing props, securing permits for a restaurant, a scenic boardwalk, the forest -- and much more.

Though I'm lucky to have received a grant from my university, we need to raise AT LEAST $6000 to afford the necessary tools to really make this film shine (*should we fail to reach that goal, Indiegogo will take away 9% of what is raised! If we do reach our goal, they will take away only 4%*)

We would love for you to join us in making this project a reality. Any contribution can help – for example, even a donation as small as $10 could go to buying a pizza that would help feed the cast and crew. And all contributions come with various rewards as you can see on the right. 

We're on the plane getting ready to jump out. Help us get a parachute and jump out with us!

WHO WE ARE!

                                                       

                                                               MICKEY NEWMAN
                                                   Writer, Director, Editor

From Pittsburgh, PA, Mickey is a screenwriter, director, videographer, editor, adjunct professor and professional musician whose films have screened at various film festivals and theaters around the US. After earning a BA in film studies from the University of Pittsburgh in 2009, Mickey sailed the world as a drummer in show bands and jazz trios on cruise ships before enrolling as a graduate MFA student in Temple University's Film and Media Arts program. In addition to working on his thesis film, he has been teaching theory and production courses at Temple University since 2013. His work can be seen at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GAiNaFbNxSY and http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3883402/  


                                                      

                                                                   PATTI HOBFOLL
                                                                 Producer

Since earning her BA in Musical Theatre in 2003, Patricia has worked in numerous aspects of theatre and film. In 2012, she was a managing partner at the Angler Movement Arts Center. As an actor, she was nominated for a Barrymore award in theatre for outstanding ensemble for Joseph...Dreamcoat and appeared in a leading role in the feature length film A Rose on Ninth Street. As a designer, she has costumed professional theatre, community theatre, and school drama. Patricia has also worked as a teaching artist for Theatre Horizon. She is currently an MSP graduate student at Temple University.

                                            

                                                   ROBBIN (YUCHAO) FENG
                                                    Director of Photography
Born in China, Robbin's visual style uniquely blends together eastern and western aesthetics. Since enrolling at Temple University, he has worked as a director of photography on numerous films. When he was only a sophomore in college, his stop-motion short, The Puppet, was selected by the 2013 Diamond Screen Film Festival for Best Animation. In addition to being a cinematographer, Robbin is also a professional colorist. He brings a deep understanding of the interplay between lights and color both on set and in the editing room. To see more of Robbin's work: https://vimeo.com/107319184

                                                           

                                                       MATTHEW GELZER
                                             Sound Mixer / Boom Operator
Matthew is an experienced sound mixer and boom operator who has worked on dozens of feature films, short films, narratives, documentaries, and web series in New York City, Philadelphia, Detroit, Savannah, Newark, Long Island and more. With an excellent ear and ability to assess locations, Matthew is a true professional known for consistently delivering an immensely important and often overlooked element of film shoots -- pristine sound! For more of Matthew's work, visit: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5176524/ 

                                                          

                                                    MELISSA MARTINELLI
                                                     Lead Actress (Denise)
Melissa has been acting in films, TV, and theater since she was a child and regularly works in Los Angeles, New York City, Philadelphia, Washington DC, and Atlanta. Often cast in leading parts, her solid body of work includes playing the starring role Ann Parrish in the EMMY-winning documentary Fever: 1973 as well as Sunny Hill in Happy Acres -- a narrative film which won several awards including Best Family Script at the Action on Film Festival (named as one of the top festivals in the country). In addition to constantly studying and working on her craft, Melissa has also graced the cover of "The Atlantic" and "Luxe International Fashion Magazine." To see more, visit: www.melissamartinelli.com and http://www.imdb.me/martinelli

                                                      

                                                        

                                                        JEFF BLOMQUIST

                                                        Lead Actor (Jerry)
Jeff has regularly participated in the Philadelphia/South Jersey theater scene for over two years. Specializing in comedy, his recent roles include Paul Bratter in Neil Simon's Barefoot in the Park, Ben Hecht in Moonlight & Magnolias, and Brad Majors in The Rocky Horror Show. He has both acted in and written several award-winning narrative short films created for the Los Angeles and the Philadelphia 48 Hour Film Festivals. In addition to acting, he is also currently involved in Broad Street Beat, a Philadelphia based a capella group. To see his work, visit: http://www.vimeo.com/3921835 and http://www.vimeo.com/26677332
story_txt:
Are you addicted to your cell phone? Or are you dismayed
everybody else seems to be addicted to theirs? Either way, THE
THRILL OF BEING FOLLOWED is for you!
Hi there! My name is Mickey Newman. I've been
writing and directing films for over ten years, I freelance as a
videographer and editor, and I am currently an MFA candidate in the Film and
Media Arts department at Temple University. And right now? I'm excitedly gearing up to shoot my graduate
thesis film: 
THE PLOT!
After her smart phone is kidnapped and held for
ransom, a neurotic woman and her mischievous boyfriend embark on an amusing
adventure to retrieve it.
Inspired by the charm and wit of Amelie and God
of Love, this short comedy pokes fun at cell phone addiction and features a treasure hunt, a clever twist
ending, and a narrator with a voice like Barry White!                              THE THEME!
Many people today are so dependent on their cell
phones that they are unable to function without them. It's almost as if they're drugs! In fact, it's been scientifically proven that cell phone vibrations raise dopamine (i.e.
pleasure) levels in the brain.
After all, an incoming text message makes us feel
wanted/desired/important (i.e. someone need us!) and it also presents us with a
mystery -- WHO needs us? Is it someone important? Is it someone you're dying to
hear from?
Most people will interrupt anything they’re doing
to find out. Of course, what we never realize is that if it was really that
important, they'd, you know... call.                                
PROJECT GOALS!
1) Make a great film that's easy to relate to and brings a smile to people's faces 
2) Submit this film to national and international film festivals
3) Use it as a pilot episode for a TV show that pokes fun at social
eccentricities                       (this will be much easier to do if it gets into film festivals!)                                   (We will submit this film to A LOT MORE festivals than appear above)JOIN US!
Anybody can make a movie, but it takes time,
patience, and funding to do it right. That's where we hope you come in.I
am hiring
experienced actors and a professional crew, shooting on the RED Epic camera
(one of the most revered digital cameras in the world), renting auxiliary equipment (such as LED lights, jibs, steadicams, car rigs, etc.), purchasing props, securing permits for a restaurant, a scenic boardwalk, the forest -- and much more.
Though I'm lucky to have received a grant from my university, we need to raise AT LEAST $6000 to afford the necessary tools to really make this film shine (*should we fail to reach that goal, Indiegogo will take away 9% of what is raised! If we do reach our goal, they will take away only 4%*)
We would love for you to join us in making this project a reality. Any
contribution can help – for example, even a donation as small as $10 could go to buying a
pizza that would help feed the cast and crew. And all contributions come with various rewards as you can see on the right. We're on the plane getting ready to jump out. Help us get a parachute and jump out with us!WHO WE ARE!                                                                                                                      MICKEY NEWMAN                                                   Writer, Director, EditorFrom Pittsburgh, PA, Mickey is a screenwriter, director, videographer, editor, adjunct professor and professional musician whose films have screened at various film festivals and theaters around the US. After earning a BA in film studies from the University of Pittsburgh in 2009, Mickey sailed the world as a drummer in show bands and jazz trios on cruise ships before enrolling as a graduate MFA student in Temple University's Film and Media Arts program. In addition to working on his thesis film, he has been teaching theory and production courses at Temple University since 2013. His work can be seen at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GAiNaFbNxSY and http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3883402/                                                                                                                           PATTI HOBFOLL                                                                 ProducerSince earning her BA in Musical Theatre in 2003, Patricia has
worked in numerous aspects of theatre and film. In 2012, she was a managing
partner at the Angler Movement Arts Center. As an actor, she was nominated for a Barrymore award in theatre
for outstanding ensemble for Joseph...Dreamcoat and appeared
in a leading role in the feature length film A Rose on Ninth
Street. As a designer, she has costumed
professional theatre, community theatre, and school drama. Patricia has also worked as a teaching artist
for Theatre Horizon. She is currently an MSP
graduate student at Temple University.                                                                                               ROBBIN (YUCHAO) FENG                                                    Director of PhotographyBorn in China, Robbin's visual style uniquely blends together eastern and western aesthetics. Since enrolling at Temple University, he has worked as a director of photography on numerous films. When he was only a sophomore in college, his stop-motion short, The Puppet, was selected by the 2013 Diamond Screen Film Festival for Best Animation. In addition to being a cinematographer, Robbin is also a professional colorist. He brings a deep understanding of the interplay between lights and color both on set and in the editing room. To see more of Robbin's work: https://vimeo.com/107319184                                                                                                                  MATTHEW GELZER                                             Sound Mixer / Boom OperatorMatthew is an experienced sound mixer and boom operator who has worked on dozens of feature films, short films, narratives, documentaries, and web series in New York City, Philadelphia, Detroit, Savannah, Newark, Long Island and more. include Paul Bratter in Neil Simon's Barefoot in the Park, Ben
Hecht in Moonlight &

The Rocky Horror Show. He has both acted in and written several award-winning narrative short films created for the Los Angeles and the
Philadelphia 48 Hour Film Festivals. In addition to acting, he is also currently

story:
What is Dystopia Capitol City?

"Dystopia Capitol City" is a gritty Scifi series created by Andrew Bard of Neo Phoenix Studios. The show explores the post apocalyptic, neo Industrialized, practical steampunk world of Capitol City and the fight for survival of its inhabitants.
After Zylphia murders the High Lord who oversees the Parliament and City she takes control and rules with an iron fist. A small group of people band together and form a resistance to stop her. Throughout this world characters are revealed from all walks of life introducing the audience to a rich character driven story showing the truly dark side of humanity along with glimmers of hope. This series is not only original but touches on some very real current events we all face in the world today set in a landscape of science fiction. 

ENOCH MEETS KAVEH (Video Clip)

About Neo Phoenix Studios

Founded by Andrew Bard and Janet Llavina in 2012 Neo Phoenix Studios has carved a solid name for itself as a professional team. Their Feature Film Hypnagogic (Currently being remastered) has been picked up for international distribution. Before forming the company Andrew and Janet have worked in the industry since 2007 giving them over 15 years experience between the two of them. 

Check out more of our stuff: OFFICIAL NEO PHOENIX STUDIOS PAGE

                                                         OFFICIAL HYPNAGOGIC PAGE

Our Talented Team Behind Dystopia Capitol City

Creator and writer Andrew bard has several screenplays under his belt , working hard to create rich entertaining character driven stories and giving the audience a story they will remember.
Director and casting director Janet Llavina has an incredible eye for talent. Her unique directing style, and her ability to connect with the actors has earned her both praise and the respect of her peers.
Editor Stephanie Brock is a graduate from SMCC.  As an editor, she brings a meticulous eye for detail and is becoming a strong force in the film world.
Director of Photography James Harmon is not only a talented director of photography but is also a high school teacher with high standing within his community. His love for film drove him to  create a film club within the school, as well as the Sanford International Film Festival.
Our Sound mixer Ricky Dunton owns and operates his own sound engineering company, Rugged Sound.  He records live sound for concerts, records bands in his studio and does onset sound mixing and ADR.
Composer Avery Stemmler is a graduate of Berkley School of Music and is a professional composer working on films throughout the United States.  His style and range has already made him a sought after film composer.
Stefani Plante is our wonderfully talented SFX Makeup artist. becoming a powerful force in the industry her talent can be seen in multiple films and modeling photography by being diverse she has become sought after by many filmmakers.
We have a fantastic hair and makeup team comprised of Alicia Nave, Trina Metcalf and Samantha Wood. Their dedication and creative eye has brought these characters to  life.
Angus McPhearson is the man behind our props, weapons and some costume pieces. He has been involved in the steampunk culture for over 20 years and was part of the team who created the statues for the Transformers Age of Extinction Premiere.

Achievement Unlocked!

Neo Phoenix Studios is driven to encourage upcoming filmmakers by having local students who want to pursue a career work on set as PA's and gain first hand experience.  By helping fund this project you will not only be helping an original scifi series complete the first season of production, you're also helping future filmmakers fuel their passion by continuing to be able to work on a successful ongoing series. 


What We Need & What You Get

Immerse yourself in the world of Dystopia Capitol City with these awesome and unique perks just to the right ---->
You'll have concept art, original music, exclusive behind the scenes access, props, updates and messages from the set of Dystopia, Capitol City journal with snipits of the scripts, directors notes, photos and more, original custom made board game straight out of this world and other awesome prizes!
Your much appreciated contributions to this show will be used for the following!
1) Locations:
Dystopia is a very unique and original world. This makes it difficult to set up scenes just anywhere. It has a steampunk flair and as such we need certain locations that will enhance the drive of not only the visuals but the story as well. Since there are two sides to Capitol City the poor broken down side (The Burrows) and the rich aristocratic side (The Chatham District) we need specific locations to suit both of those needs. Some locations do come with costs such as the Chatham District and with your help we can secure those specific locations and get truly amazing and beautiful shots.
2) Compensation for cast and crew:
We have been very fortunate to have a strong team that shares our passion for this world and project, who have agreed to work within our budget, even if it means taking a pay cut.  However, some of them have specialty skills, live a long distance away or simply need to make a living. Our small budget only goes so far, and expenses such as lodging, and travel reimbursement are going to play a big factor in upcoming episodes since we have talent from all over involved.
3) Wardrobe and props:
This is another area where we have a very specific look that we need to achieve which means we can't just pick out a pair of blue jeans for a character (Though sometimes it would be easier). This world must hold a consistent look through every facet. We have been so lucky with our prop designer to only charge for materials but every weapon, tool, prop and costume piece cannot hold a likeness to anything really contemporary which means the volume of specific items for certain scenes is a large number and all of those items are designed and created specifically for the show.
4) SFX:
 There are scenes that require a professional practical, makeup or post production effects to make the scenes look real. This is an area that can not be overlooked, as it will hurt the integrity of the scenes and make the overall product suffer.
5) Food:
Simply put its the fuel that keeps the midnight oil burning. A fed crew is a happy and productive crew and we want a happy and productive crew.
6) Misc:
Too broad of a category? Perhaps but this is what we consider misc. additional hard drive storage, batteries, printing supplies, yada yada yada...

    The Impact

    We have an excellent track record and always grow from our past projects by constantly adapting, learning and enhancing ourselves!
    We always strive to produce quality, rich and entertaining films viewable by anyone from ages 12 and up, and this show is no different.  

      Risks & Challenges

      There are always risks and challenges going into production. The great news is there are none involved here. The excellent thing about this project is we are in production and just need help completing it which means by contributing to this it is a guarantee that it will be completed. We have 2 international distribution companies very interested in seeing the finished product as well so we are only asking for help to complete the final leg of the journey (aka production season)! Also, having worked on many different sets with many different budgets, we know how to overcome challenges and obstacles that always appear on even the most organized set and work past them efficiently so we can stay on schedule.
      The absolute best thing about this is that you wont have to wait and ponder when production will begin, how long before its completed or where you can see your investment because we're already in the production season and we're releasing it online next year! See, no risk. How often do you get to see that?

        Pick Up That Bullhorn!

        There are so many ways you can help besides contributing financially. You can always share and help us spread the word! Share this link on your wall and pages on facebook or on your twitter! Word of mouth is a powerful tool, don't be afraid to use it, we wont be!

        FIND US ON FACEBOOK and check out some behind the scenes pictures, stills and more! OFFICIAL FACEBOOK

        Spread the love and share this campaign on Steampunk groups/pages
        Scifi groups/pages and any other dark corner of the universe where scifi fan's unite!

        Tweet about this series and campaign on using #dystopiacapitolcity #nowisthetime #jointheresistance

        Don't forget to use the indiegogo share tools!

        Lastly, WE THANK YOU for your support in helping us make this project a success! A lot of blood (true) sweat (lots of it) and tears (too many to count) went into this show! Help us create something nobody has ever seen before and be a part of it! Thank you all again!

story:
BCactionMR.com is a site that I created while living in Las Vegas, NV in 2011-2013.  Some nights my friends and I would have very lengthy discussions about upcoming films and movie trailers that we had seen, and what we were excited to see come to the big-screen. 

I was constantly asked how I knew so much about all the movings coming out, who was starring in them and what the premise was.  It was in those moments I discovered my passion for movies, and being "In the know" about whats new.  At the same time I realized how much I enjoyed being the first to tell someone about what I had discovered, and my wanting  to get them just as excited as I was about what I knew.  

One marvelous day April 10, 2012,  after seeing a commercial for a free 30 day trial to "Create your very own website."   I began building BCactionMR.com.  Seeing as I had never created a website before, nor had I gone to school for web design, it definitely was a trial and error process.  But my hobby became something more. It has become my passion and my dream.

As the site has grown, so has the demand for information to be released more efficiently and effectively.   I have recruited my brother and a few friends to help with BCactionMR.com.   But the demands for more aren't being met.  

We are fundraising in hopes to establish a headquarters here in Iowa.  We would also like to recruit some amazing web designers, and writers to help us take our site to the next level, and be able to continue sharing our dream and love of movies with the world.  We plan to track our progress via Twitter. 

Thank you all for you support,

Brandon
story_txt: BCactionMR.com is a site that I created while living in Las Vegas, NV in 2011-2013.  Some nights my friends and I would have very lengthy discussions about upcoming films and movie trailers that we had seen, and what we were excited to see come to the big-screen. I was constantly asked how I knew so much about all the movings coming out, who was starring in them and what the premise was.  It was in those moments I discovered my passion for movies, and being "In the know" about whats new.  At the same time I realized how much I enjoyed being the first to tell someone about what I had discovered, and my wanting  to get them just as excited as I was about what I knew.  One marvelous day April 10, 2012,  after seeing a commercial for a free 30 day trial to "Create your very own website."   I began building BCactionMR.com.  Seeing as I had never created a website before, nor had I gone to school for web design, it definitely was a trial and error process.  But my hobby became something more. It has become my passion and my dream.As the site has grown, so has the demand for information to be released more efficiently and effectively.   I have recruited my brother and a few friends to help with BCactionMR.com.   But the demands for more aren't being met.  We are fundraising in hopes to establish a headquarters here in Iowa.  We would also like to recruit some amazing web designers, and writers to help us take our site to the next level, and be able to continue sharing our dream and love of movies with the world.  We plan to track our progress via Twitter. Thank you all for you support,Brandon

story:
Short Summary

Blackout Fest is a bold celebration of blackness between Black people, other people of color, and our allies. It aims to serve as a safe space filled with positivity, good vibes, great music, great people, and ample learning opportunities.:

  • Blackout Fest is the manifestation of several Black members of the Baton Rouge community. Some of these members represent local organizations such as Baton Rouge Organizing, as well as groups on LSU and Southern University's campus (Qroma, etc)
  • We believe this festival is important because there is a significant lack of events catering to progressive Black audiences in Baton Rouge created and promoted by Black people. We want to provide more unity for the Black residents in the area and ensure that their voices are heard and that their desires are represented.
  • Your contributions will be aiding to set up the first Blackout Fest in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. That means, we'll need money for just about everything. However, we aim to make this event either free to the public or very, very cheap.

What do you think? Maybe I can be a bit more specific...

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown:

  • First, we want to be able to provide you all with great music and performances! That means we'll try to switch it up between DJ sets and some live performances. We also want to incorporate a powerful poetry slam. This will cost a few dollars.
  • Second, we want you to be smothered in art! Of course, we'll try to get some local artists to showcase their works, and maybe even do some live work.
  • Third, what's a good time without food? It's our goal to support local food trucks and other vendors while also providing you with a wide selection of great food.
  • Number four: Location Location Location! We're aiming for this to take place in Downtown, Baton Rouge. We're making the efforts to get that space reserved ASAP. Any funds raised for this will be reimbursed to those that paid for the space.
  • We have a ton of other ideas of things to do: step shows, fashion displays, a play area for the kids, educational booths on everything from Black women and hair to how to be a good ally! Of course, we welcome any additional ideas as well.

The Impact

In an area such as the one we are living in, it is important that we make a space for our voices to be heard; a space where we celebrate ourselves and our existence:

  • This is our contribution to the Baton Rouge community as a whole. Through this, we will all be reminding the city of a different perspective, and of different desires.
  • While this event is a celebration of Black culture and people, everyone is invited to come! In fact, we encourage that you do. This event aims to promote the dialogue on race that is happening all over the country. Plus, we're sure you'll have an amazing time.
  • Bring the entire family! We'll be sure to have things to educate the children as well as keep them entertained.

Risks & Challenges

This is our first attempt at creating such an event, and we're just as nervous as we are confident and excited. Not only do we want this to be successful, but we want to make sure we're communicating the right messages and providing the right environment.

  • Members of Baton Rouge Organizing have experience in putting together impromptu demonstrations, rallies, and protests in Downtown Baton Rouge and on college campuses in the city.
  • Qroma has provided a safe space on LSU's campus for many LGBTQ students of color. They have also created ample opportunities of education on gender, race, and sexuality.
  • The Poetry Alliance showcases amazing, award winning poets in Baton Rouge every Tuesday night at the Eclectic Truth Poetry Slam & Open Mic.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially but still wanna help? Well how sweet of you:

  • Share this campaign with more people! Just getting the word out helps us a ton! Who knows how capable you are generating lots of interest in this project.
  • Interested in volunteering your art, talent, or any other services! Let us know, and we'll find a way to thank you!

And that's all there is to it. I hope you all are as excited as I am.

story:
"The Castle"


"The Castle" (Working Title) is a feature film that will be shot entirely in Victoria, BC, Canada in January 2016. This is a 100% Canadian film production that will promote Vancouver Island the world over.

"The Castle" (Working Title) is a feature film that will be shot in Victoria, BC, Canada in January 2016.

Note: Teaser trailer deliberately dark to subdue significant physical elements in the movie.

Synopsis


"The Castle" is the story about eight eccentric young adult characters who are all haunted by a common spirit.

The film begins with eight feature characters receiving a haunted message inviting them to spend an evening as guests at Craigdarroch Castle in Victoria, British Columbia. Craigdarroch Castle is a spectacular Victorian nineteenth century castle complete with dark wood finished ceilings, floors, and furnished with antiques. It is a perfect setting for a paranormal thriller. The guests arrive just before dinner and are greeted by the castle’s staff, a group of eccentrics in their own right.

The guests are joined for dinner by their host Randal McRay, who is in his mid sixties and has looked after Craigdarroch Castle his entire life. His appearance resembles that of a British intellect, a man with perfect charm and mystery . He is thought to be the last surviving member of the McRay family and is ready to retire. Randal explains how a family dispute has resulted in a curse that has committed his family to a horrible state of purgatory in their afterlife. It is during dinner that the eight guests learn that they are all descendants of the McRay family!

Lastly, Randal confides that he has been in contact with their trapped haunted ancestors and the ancestors have chosen the eight guests to resolve the dark mystery of their family curse. The guests have 12 hours to solve ancient mythic riddles if they want to make it out of the castle alive.


What’s unique about our film?


  • Our film The Castle is a reinvention of the “paranormal thriller” genre. Our producing team is collaborating with professional Vancouver Island paranormal investigators that are helping us incorporate documented paranormal activities into our movie.
  • The majority of talent in our 100% Canadian production will be from BC and wherever possible, Greater Victoria.
  • Taking a unique approach in developing our screenplay, we are diverging from the way independent film usually develops a script. Instead of attempting to find or build a location that serves the needs of the script, we had the screenplay written specifically to suit our location. The screenplay was inspired by, developed and written at our filming location, Craigdarroch Castle. In the long run, this will save time and money on props and location management when we begin to shoot.
  • This feature film will be a brand ambassador for Victoria, BC. We will proudly ensure that there are recognizable elements of our community prominently visible in our movie. We want audiences to exclaim, “Wow! Where is that?”
  • We have been in contact with some amazing BC talent and crew, but at this stage, it’s too early to reveal any names.
  • The local work force and economy will definitely benefit from our film production. We will invest back in our community by using local businesses like hotels, restaurants, prop supplies, electrical generators, caterers, tools, car rentals and VFX (special effects) to name a few.
  • We have developed a solid and long-term relationship with local filmmakers and businesses, thanks to the great help and effort of Kathleen Gilbert our Film Commissioner and the Greater Victoria Chamber of Commerce.

Indiegogo Campaign

With the launch of our Indiegogo campaign, managed by Maria Bances and supervised by Patrick Bensen (Co-producer), we invite you, the people of Victoria and BC, to be an active part of our feature film.

There are 15 levels of amazing perks for all budgets ranging from super cool souvenirs to experiences of a lifetime. For our most generous contributors we have some “special treats” that won’t soon be forgotten. These include attending the film shoot, being in the movie, seeing your name in the film credits, and even attending the wrap party with the cast and crew .

Expect to watch our movie, filmed entirely in Victoria, in Fall 2016...


As we say in our industry: 

To be continued... 


Act now and be part of our film!

story:
Short Summary

I am Jesse Chance, I am a professional photographer and believe i am one of the best BMX photographers in Australia. I would like to provide the BMX community with professional photos, free of watermarks at NO cost.

What We Need & What You Get

  • To fund this i will need around $5000 AUD which will cover flight, accommodation and living costs for the time i attend the event.
  • Professional high quality photos for the BMX community free of charge and free of watermark.
  • I do not wish to make a profit
  • If the goal is not reached or this is money remaining after the trip. I would like to donate it to a local BMX club that is in need.

The Impact

  • BMX riders around the world pay thousands of dollars to race at the Worlds and then are still either having to pay for the photos or be forced to deal with the watermark.
  • I have worked for many organizations as a photographer to help raise funds like this before.

Risks & Challenges.

  • It is likely i will not be given access to the the track but i have the right equipment and will be able to get amazing shots from spectator viewing.
  • It is very likely i will not raise enough funds but they will still be put forward to a good cause.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this post with as many people as possible. Word of mouth is a great thing.
  • If you happen to know anyone that can arrange cheaper flights or accommodation please let me know. I am happy to share with someone or even sleep on there couch

story:
Amigos de las Américas inspires and builds young leaders through collaborative community development and immersion in cross-cultural experiences. This year the Portland Chapter of Amigos is preparing 16 teens from Portland, OR for full-immersion cultural exchange and community service projects in Nicaragua, Dominican Republic, Panama, Costa Rica, and Mexico.

The Portland Chapter of Amigos tries to assure that no youth is unable to participate based on family income.  The youth volunteers and parents work hard to contribute to group fundraising that supports all participants.  

Despite strong group efforts for the last 6 months, we have still not met the fundraising goal that will cover the expenses of all 16 youth. Unmet need may require families to increase their family contribution creating a barrier for some of the dedicated youth volunteers.

Your contribution will go towards supporting the volunteers' training and materials, travel, and helps fund the community-based initiatives in country once they arrive.

    Program Impact

    Amigos de las Américas gives young people an opportunity to gain life experience and leadership training over 4 to 9 weeks of living and working with communities across the Americas. Program participants work with Latin American peers to design and lead community projects related to areas such as public health, youth engagement, and environmental sustainability.

    AMIGOS training prepares participants to manage projects, organize community members, solve problems, accept responsibility, and learn from others. Program participants live with a host family in a community, experiencing day to day life as a local, not a tourist.

    Many present-day challenges can be solved through more effective community engagement. AMIGOS is helping to make this a reality by building the skills for young people to become critically engaged leaders and active global citizens.

    Who Are You Supporting?

    Gwen ∙ Madriz, Nicaragua
    Ashley ∙ Madriz, Nicaragua
    Cassia ∙ Madriz, Nicaragua
    Hadley ∙ Madriz, Nicaragua
    Zoe ∙ Matagalpa, Nicaragua
    Ian ∙ Matagalpa, Nicaragua
    Harrison ∙ Azero, Panama
    Nelly ∙ Bahoruco, Dominican Republic
    Emma ∙ Bahoruco, Dominican Republic
    Katie ∙ Bahoruco, Dominican Republic
    Willow ∙ San Juan, Dominican Republic
    Sarah ∙ San Juan, Dominican Republic
    Melanie ∙ San Juan, Dominican Republic
    Gabe ∙ Perez Zeldon, Costa Rica
    Julia ∙ Oaxaca, Mexico
    Kaitlynn ∙ Oaxaca Mexico

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute or can only contribute a little that's okay!  You can still help the mission in other ways by:

    • Spread the word! Share this link with people you know who want to support a youth who are working to become a life-long catalyst for social change
    • Contact the Portland Chapter Board  to inquire about the many ways you can volunteer to support this organization! info@portlandamigos.org
    • Contact the International Offices of Amigos to find out how to get involved in your community. www.amigoslink.org

story:
Enjoy the New Trailer!!!

Let's get the ball rolling here! Helpppppp!!! Thank you

If wit is “educated insolence” (Aristotle), then Mark Twain was the epitome of wit.

“Carnival of Crime“  is Endeavor’s second period short film, it is an adaptation of a witty and relatively unknown short story by the American literary genius Mark Twain. Carnival of Crime is a comical story about the predicament that is the human conscience. What happens when a man confronts the personification of his own conscience? What could be worse! It knows all your foibles, and weaknesses, where you acted wrongly and when you failed to act....Things could go very badly and in Twain's autobiographical analysis of what is clearly his own conscience, it does.

Producers Jessica Jones-Carson and Gualberto Garcia Jones got behind this project because they found Mark Twain's brilliant examination of his own conscience  darkly humorous and timeless. They were thrilled by the challenge of representing the ethereal nature of conscience on film.  The project came together thanks to David Schutt's faithful adaptation, sensitive directing  of Opal Wilberforce, stellar performances by Jude Moran ( Mark Twain) and Jordan Leigh ( Twain's Conscience) and the beautiful work of a strong and vibrant supporting cast and crew.  The film's potential exploded thanks to Todd Debreceni's prosthetic genius and cinematographer, Laffrey Witbrod's  imaginative and masterly digital filmmaking.   

We have sunk every penny that we received from the New Mexico Tax Incentive rebate from our first short film “Emancipation” into this Mark Twain classic.  Now we are asking you, Mark Twain fans and supporters of independent film, people of conscience, to help us make it over the finish line. 

But if the film has been shot, what is left to do?

We are asking for your help with postproduction:

Please enjoy our trailer and help us get through post. Your funds will help us edit the film, complete the sound design, commission the score, polish some awesome special effects and color the final project. 

Please feel free to visit our website www.endeavorpics.com to see other Endeavor Pics projects and to see BEHIND THE SCENES photos of the shooting of "Carnival of Crime."

We need more than we have asked for so give generously, please! Any funds that exceed the cost of post will be put towards our next project, a detective/mystery web series that is in the cooker!

story:
About the Boxing for Christ documentary

In this documentary we will explore a strong willed, resilient mother, Sonia Ramos (once a heavily respected drug dealer and gang member), whose faith and perseverance led her to give back to the underrepresented youth in San Jacinto, California. The defining moment for Sonia was when her son David (a former 4-time Silver Glove USA Boxing Champion) was facing a 27 year prison sentence. Growing up in a very religious Mexican American home Sonia returned to her faith in God. She prayed like she never prayed before and she made a Promise to God that would revolutionize her life. She Promised to turn her life around and vowed to help wavering children and teens stay off the path of self- destruction through a boxing outreach program, if God would save her son.

Throughout the programs existence Sonia has been tested in her walk of faith by a diagnosis with a tumor, a corrupt Pastor extorting her programs money, family separation, the loss of her house, cars, employment, and the burden of personally funding the Boxing for Christ program.   Despite Sonia’s arduous journey she remains committed to her promise to save the sons and daughters of her community from the corruption of the streets.

In this film we will hear directly from Sonia, her four children, and from some of her most spectacular boxing students that have had to endure major hardships. We will bring our cameras into Sonia’s home, her doctors appointments, and into her church to show you the true magnitude of her sacrifices and loyalty. We will vividly show the process of what it takes to make this financially struggling program a large-scale success. 

 

The Impact

In 2010, the Washington Post reported that about 70,000 teenagers and children are detained everyday in juvenile detention centers.  Sonia and the Boxing for Christ program are giving kids the opportunity to fight for their lives and for their futures by teaching them values, discipline, and respect. We believe that this film will inspire other community and world leaders to whole heartedly pursue their calling to IMPACT the world with their love for humanity. 

 

Our Campaign Goals

Our intent with this film is to reveal the heart of Sonia Ramos and her never-ending dedication to the promise she made to God. We want to help her raise money for such a powerful program, a program that should not be struggling to keep the lights on and a roof over their head. This organization has truly been a lighthouse in the community and we believe that with your contributions to this film we will attract major attention and support to help this program soar beyond belief.

$70,000 is the minimum amount needed to produce this IMPACT Documentary. Our goal is to produce a quality film that will gain national and international exposure. This film is not just about Sonia and the Boxing for Christ program. This film is about every unsung hero who is sacrificing their all for their communities, and every person who has turned their Challenges into Championships. This film is to inspire changemakers like you to get out in the world and to use your God given talent to IMPACT those who need your help.

 

What your Contributions DO

  • Your contributions will help with the cost of crew, equipment, logistics, insurance, permits, travel, editing, motion graphics, sound, project management, marketing and distribution.
  • Your contributions will also help us get this incredible story to the world through film festivals and with private screenings in your city. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Word of mouth - tell everyone you know about this story and how then can support the film

  • Share it online everywhere - You can use the Indiegogo share tools to send to your networks and encourage everyone else to do the same!

  • If you know any of these specific people please do us a huge favor and drop them a line or two about us... we would love to include them in our film or promote this film to their audience.
  • Manny Pacquiao, Rosie Perez, Oscar De La Hoya, Oprah, Ellen De Generes and anybody in the boxing community, daytime talk shows, bloggers, podcast etc.. 

 

What You Get

For your generous support and contributions we have set aside a few amazing items to say thank you.. thank you.. thank you... 

 

IV I II STUDIOS

We are a For Profit Social Enterprise in Southern California made up of a group of passionate DreamDivers & IMPACT Filmmakers on a very clear mission. Our mission is to use storytelling & filmmaking to ignite, to inspire, to empower, and to influence you and your audience to Dive for your dreams and to take action on your goals that will IMPACT the world. Simply Put.. We are The IMPACT Production Company... Our cameras don't come on unless there's IMPACT to be made.. www.iviiistudios.com

Ira Davis - Chief DreamDiver | CEO & Executive Producer

Niketa Calame-Harris - Chief DreamCreator | Producer & Assistant Director
story_txt:
About the Boxing for Christ documentary
In this documentary we will explore a strong willed, resilient mother, Sonia Ramos (once a heavily respected drug dealer and gang member), whose faith and perseverance led her to give back to the underrepresented youth in San Jacinto, California. The defining moment for Sonia was when her son David (a former 4-time Silver Glove USA Boxing Champion) was facing a 27 year prison sentence. Growing up in a very religious Mexican American home Sonia returned to her faith in God. She prayed like she never prayed before and she made a Promise to God that would revolutionize her life. She Promised to turn her life around and vowed to help wavering children and teens stay off the path of self- destruction through a boxing outreach program, if God would save her son. 
Throughout the programs existence Sonia has been tested in her walk of faith by a diagnosis with a tumor, a corrupt Pastor extorting her programs money, family separation, the loss of her house, cars, employment, and the burden of personally funding the Boxing for Christ program.   Despite Sonia’s arduous journey she remains committed to her promise to save the sons and daughters of her community from the corruption of the streets.

In this film we will hear directly from Sonia, her four children, and from some of her most spectacular boxing students that have had to endure major hardships. We will bring our cameras into Sonia’s home, her doctors appointments, and into her church to show you the true magnitude of her sacrifices and loyalty. We will vividly show the process of what it takes to make this financially struggling program a large-scale success. 
 

The Impact
In 2010, the Washington Post reported that about 70,000 teenagers and children are detained everyday in juvenile detention centers.  Sonia and the Boxing for Christ program are giving kids the opportunity to fight for their lives and for their futures by teaching them values, discipline, and respect. We believe that this film will inspire other community and world leaders to whole heartedly pursue their calling to IMPACT the world with their love for humanity. 
 


Our Campaign Goals
Our intent with this film is to reveal the heart of Sonia Ramos and her never-ending dedication to the promise she made to God. We want to help her raise money for such a powerful program, a program that should not be struggling to keep the lights on and a roof over their head. This organization has truly been a lighthouse in the community and we believe that with your contributions to this film we will attract major attention and support to help this program soar beyond belief.
$70,000 is the minimum amount needed to produce this IMPACT Documentary. Our goal is to produce a quality film that will gain national and international exposure. This film is not just about Sonia and the Boxing for Christ program. This film is about every unsung hero who is sacrificing their all for their communities, and every person who has turned their Challenges into Championships. This film is to inspire changemakers like you to get out in the world and to use your God given talent to IMPACT those who need your help.
 

What your Contributions DO

Your contributions will help with the cost of crew, equipment, logistics, insurance, permits, travel, editing, motion graphics, sound, project management, marketing and distribution.
Your contributions will also help us get this incredible story to the world through film festivals and with private screenings in your city.

Word of mouth - tell everyone you know about this story and how then can support the film
Share it online everywhere - You can use the Indiegogo share tools to send to your networks and encourage everyone else to do the same!



If you know any of these specific people please do us a huge favor and drop them a line or two about us... we would love to include them in our film or promote this film to their audience.
Manny Pacquiao, Rosie Perez, Oscar De La Hoya, Oprah, Ellen De Generes and anybody in the boxing community, daytime talk shows, bloggers, podcast etc.. 

 

What You Get
For your generous support and contributions we have set aside a few amazing items to say thank you.. thank you.. thank you... 
 
IV I II STUDIOS

Our mission is to use storytelling & filmmaking to ignite, to inspire, to empower, and to influence you and your audience to Dive for your dreams and to take action on your goals that will IMPACT the world. Simply Put.. We are The IMPACT Production Company... Our cameras don't come on unless there's IMPACT to be made.. www.iviiistudios.com
