story:
You're invited to a fabulous VIP event to support this faith-based film project!

RSVP for you and a friend here.

THANK YOU to all our Indiegogo supporters! We appreciate your contribution and cherish your continued support of this film project.

YOU CAN STILL GIVE TO HELP MAKE THIS SHORT FILM A REALITY!
New contributions are now tax-deductible. Give today!

Exciting developments are happening with the short film project Two Keys. Get updates on our website and stay connected on Facebook. (You can also follow us @twokeysmovie on Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest!)

Two keys… Two girls… One choice to decide their destiny in Jerusalem.

STORYLINE and IMPACT
Based on true events, Two Keys is an award-winning short screenplay that offers a strong message of hope to young people in seemingly impossible situations. Whether it's the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, Ferguson, Baltimore or Charleston, Two Keys speaks to young people about the power of a life lived in faith. Your life matters. Your faith can make a difference.

It's about two teenage girls - one Israeli and one Palestinian - whose worlds collide as they struggle to make their lives count in the conflict of Jerusalem.

Adi is a Jewish girl in Jerusalem, soon to be drafted into the Israeli Defense Force.

She’s on a mission to see if her faith can make a difference in the Israeli – Palestinian conflict before she puts on the  battle gear.
  

Etaaf lives in a neglected Palestinian refugee camp, separated from Jerusalem by the cement barrier wall designed to stop suicide bombers from entering the city. She’s seen friends and family suffer and die in this conflict and she’s determined to do whatever it takes to see justice and affect change.

A suicide bomb attack throws the two girls together and they’re forced to make a decision that ultimately determines their destiny in Jerusalem.

Two Keys brings hope to today’s generation. 
Two Keys stirs faith that even in the midst of impossible situations,
your life matters.

BUDGET and STRATEGY
The production budget for the short film Two Keys is $75,000.  Your contribution towards this goal helps us shoot establishing shots and exteriors on location in Israel. We’ll shoot the rest of the film in Kansas City, which opens up opportunities for you to be involved and possibly get a chance to be in the film!
The plan is to shoot the film this summer and have it ready for release by September. The strategy is to qualify Two Keys for the Short Film Category of the Academy Awards.

Gaining this platform in Hollywood exponentially increases the influence of Two Keys and its message. There is a solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and your life counts no matter the impossibility of what you are facing.


SUCCESS
When you partner with the Two Keys short film project, you're joining award-winning talent who are ready to come on board as soon as production funds are raised!

Brad Wilson, Executive Producer

Brad Wilson, Executive Producer – Hollywood-based, Brad managed Robert Duvall’s production company for 11 years. He’s worked with A-list talent like Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman and Sean Penn. Producer of the award-winning TV drama Believers Among Us, Wilson is now managing his own faith-based production company, Higher Purpose Entertainment.

Casey Bond, Executive Producer

Casey Bond, Executive Producer - Known best for his role in “MoneyBall,” starring Brad Pitt, Jonah Hill, and Philip Seymour Hoffman, Casey Bond is an actor, film producer and retired professional baseball player. Casey is currently producing and acting (role of Jerry Meyer) in the film “My Many Sons” which is filming in Nashville, TN. As a producer, Bond has teamed up with producing partner Brad Wilson to form the production company Higher Purpose Entertainment.



Laura Woodworth, Director/Producer/Screenwriter

Laura Woodworth, Director/Producer/Screenwriter – An award-winning screenwriter, Laura’s production experience encompasses award-winning television and feature film. Her education includes postgraduate work at UCLA, one of the most renowned schools for film and television.

Alan Woodworth, CFO/Producer, Source Entertainment

Alan Woodworth, CFO/Producer - Together, Alan and Laura Woodworth head up Source Entertainment, the production company for Two Keys. As CFO and producer, Alan combines entrepreneurial talent with film and television industry experience for the projects of Source Entertainment.


David Woodworth, Cinematographer

David Woodworth, Cinematographer – Multi-talented, David’s production experience includes the award-winning television show The Steve & Kathy Show; live broadcasts of World Revival Church services aired on Daystar Television Network into over 200 countries with a record-breaking response; and the feature film, My 3 Saints (3 Blind Saints).

Katina Zinner, Editor

Katina Zinner, A.C.E., Editor – Daughter of Peter Zinner, the Academy Award-winning editor known for The Deer Hunter and The Godfather, Katina carries on the tradition of excellence in editing. Her film editing has contributed to feature films and documentaries that have garnered Peabody and Emmy awards.

Stelio Savante, Actor

Stelio Savante. Actor, "Bakhet" -  SAG-nominated and winner of the American Movie Award, Stelio Savante will step into the role of “Bakhet,” leader of the Palestinian resistance group in Two Keys (again, as soon as production budget is met.)  He's known for his work on faith-based films, Once We Were Slaves, Jimmy, What If, and A Million Colours; multiple roles on network television, Ugly Betty, NCIS, Person of Interest, Law and Order and more, as well as and studio and independent films.

Savante will be seen playing David Sarnoffin National Geographic's mini-series American Genius and in AMC's mini-series The Making Of The Mob narrated by Ray Liotta, and in theaters this fall in the feature film, Eisenstein in Guanajuato.


Dustin Smith, Composer

Dustin Smith, Composer/Musician - Dustin is an Integrity Music artist, songwriter and worship leader. He brings a quality of music to Two Keys that will increase the impact this film will have on a generation.
Dustin’s music is sung in churches around the world. He collaborates with other top Christian musicians and songwriters like Michael Farren (Pocket Full of Rocks), Stu G (Delirious) and Carl Albrecht (Paul Baloche). Songs from his albums, Everything Inside Me, Open the Floodgates, Healing Waters, and his latest, Rushing Waters, are being recorded by top Christian artists, including Michael W. Smith.

Others on our production team have been involved with award-winning faith-based and Hollywood productions like Finding Hope Now, Spider Man 2, Terminator 3 and more.

ANOTHER POINT OF SUCCESS...
Source Entertainment is pleased to announce that, once funds are raised, Two Keys will be produced in association with Higher Purpose Entertainment, a production company based in Los Angeles, CA and Nashville, TN, and headed up by Two Keys Executive Producers Brad Wilson and Casey Bond. Higher Purpose Entertainment specializes in films and television that inspire, forming a good match with Source Entertainment for this short film project.

THE KEY
Keys are very symbolic in the Palestinian culture. Many still have the keys from their homes that they left behind in 1948 when Israel became a nation.

Etaaf holds a key passed down through her Palestinian family. Adi holds a key of faith in Yeshuah (the Hebrew word for Jesus). 

You hold a key too. You can be the key that can make this short film a reality.

The Two Keys short film project is your chance to take a stand for something that counts. When you contribute, you’re bringing hope and faith to your generation. Can you give something towards our goal of $75,000 today?

Give today and take a stand! Two Keys stirs faith that even in the midst of impossible situations, your life matters.



"TWO KEYS" IN THE NEWS 

·  Watch forTwo Keysin the July edition of Kansas City's Metro Voice!

·  Lee's Summit Tribune:KC-Based Short Film "Two Keys" is Set to Inspire http://lstribune.net/lees-summit-news/kc-based-short-film-two-keys-is-set-to-inspire.htm

·  Freeport Journal Standard:Freeport Native's Film "Two Keys" Seeks Donations to Shoot This Summerhttp://www.journalstandard.com/article/20150620/NEWS/150629977

·  Dustin Smith Ministries Podcast:We Are Warriorshttp://player.subsplash.com/0c5eccd


JOIN THE TEAM and GET A PERK!
Think of it this way... We can have the latest and greatest smart phone out there, but without signal, we’re stuck!

YOU are the signal… you are the key to taking an award-winning script with an award-winning production team and turning it into a movie! 

And, as special thanks for teaming up with your contribution, you get these great perks…

$15.00 and up – Shout out! Public thanks on the Two Keys Facebook. We’ll shout out your name on our main page.

$25.00 – Special Access. Get special access to a Two Keys Secret Facebook page! Behind the scenes photos, videos, insider information and more. You get it first – before anyone else! Includes the Shout Out! on our main Facebook page, too.

$35.00 – Two Keys Survival Bracelet. Wear the gear! Get a Two Keys Paracord Survival Bracelet engraved with #twokeys. This perk includes the Shout Out! and Special Access perks to get you inside the action of the Two Keys film. (Pic below is a mock up; we're looking into a cool dark gray with the hashtag!)

$50.00 – Signed Title Page w/Bracelet.  Get a Signed Title Page of the Two Keys screenplay (digital) PLUS the Two Keys Survival Bracelet... PLUS the Shout Out! and Special Access perks.

(You'll get the bracelet in the mail shortly after the campaign. The digital Signed Title Page will come during production when we've gathered top talent to add their signature for you!)

$100.00 STAND ALONE – Two Keys T-Shirt. STANDALONE PERK: Get an exclusive Two Keys T-Shirt! A great conversation starter about the cool film project you are a part of.

(This perk stands alone - it does not come with any previous perks except for the Shout Out! and Special Access.) NOTE: Pic is a mock up; we'll design this with the cool Two Keys logo!

$200.00 – Get it all! Want it? Get it all!

Two Keys T-shirt
Two Keys Survival Bracelet
Signed Title Page (digital) of the Two Keys screenplay
Special Access to the Two Keys Facebook page AND a...
Shout Out! on our main Facebook page!

$500 – Movie Credit PLUS. Your name on the big screen PLUS all the other perks!  Movie Credit PLUS perk puts your name in the "Special thanks" section of Two Key's end credits.

Includes all prior perks...
Two Keys T-shirt
Signed Title Page (digital) of Two Keys Screenplay
Two Keys Survival Bracelet
Special Access to the Secret Two Keys Facebook page and a...
Shout Out! of thanks on our main Facebook page!

$1,000 – Private Screening/Movie Credit. You and a guest are invited to the private screening of Two Keys AND the after party! Enjoy your  VIP moment with cast and crew of the film.

Includes Movie Credit with your name in the "Special thanks" section... PLUS all prior perks!

(Private screening subject to scheduling and is tentatively scheduled for August or September. Location is tentatively set for Kansas City and/or Los Angeles. Travel and accommodations not included.)

$2,500 – Set Tour/Screening/Credits+. Get in on the action of a real film set! Tour the set of Two Keys AND see your name in the Movie Credits "Special thanks" section AND get two VIP passes to the Private Screening/After Party AND all prior perks! Wow!

(Set Tour date and Private Screening date subject to scheduling. Shooting tentatively scheduled to take place in July in Israel and/or the U.S.  Private Screening tentatively scheduled for August or September in Kansas City and/or L.A. Transportation and accommodations not included.)

$5,000 – Associate Producer PLUS. Get credited as an Associate Producer of Two Keys. We'll help you get listed on IMDB!

Plus, enjoy a Set Tour, two passes to the Private Screening/After Party and all prior perks!

(Set Tour date and Private Screening date subject to scheduling. Shooting tentatively scheduled to take place in July in Israel and/or the U.S.  Private Screening tentatively scheduled for August or September in Kansas City and/or L.A. Transportation and accommodations not included.)

$10,000 – Executive Producer PLUS. For your backing, you get an Executive Producer credit for Two Keys. We'll help you get listed on IMDB!

PLUS, you get a Set Tour, two passes to the Private Screening/After Party and all prior perks!

(Set Tour date and Private Screening date subject to scheduling. Shooting tentatively scheduled to take place in July in Israel and/or the U.S.  Private Screening tentatively scheduled for August or September in Kansas City and/or L.A. Transportation and accommodations not included.)

Help make  movie the brings hope to this generation.
Two Keys stirs faith that even 
in the midst of impossible situations, your life matters.

as an Associate Producer of Two Keys. We'll help you get listed on IMDB!
Plus, enjoy a Set Tour, two passes to the Private
Screening/After Party and all prior perks!
(Set Tour date and Private Screening date subject to
scheduling. Shooting tentatively scheduled to take place in July in Israel
and/or the U.S.  Private Screening
tentatively scheduled for August or September in Kansas City and/or L.A.
Transportation and accommodations not included.)
$10,000 – Executive
Producer PLUS. For your backing, you get an Executive Producer credit for
Two Keys. We'll help you get listed on IMDB!
PLUS, you get a Set Tour, two passes to the Private Screening/After
Party and all prior perks!
(Set
Tour date and Private Screening date subject to scheduling. Shooting
tentatively scheduled to take place in July in Israel and/or the U.S.  Private Screening tentatively scheduled for
August or September in Kansas City and/or L.A. Transportation and accommodations not included.)

Help make  movie the brings hope to this generation.


Two Keys stirs faith that even in the midst of impossible situations, your life matters.

story:
Short Summary

This is a campaign to help supplement funding for the production of the pilot episode of "Rellik" being directed by Tim Russ (Star Trek Voyager, iCarly, Star Trek Renegades) and being filmed in the Sacramento, CA area. 

Logline:
Hot on the trail of a serial killer, a group of investigators face obstacles from their families, co-workers, and even each other, as the trail ultimately leads back to a familiar place.

Some Basics

  • Directed by Tim Russ (Star Trek, iCarly and numerous other credits).
  • Produced and cast by Toni Staniewicz (ToniStaniewiczCasting.com)
  • Stunt coordination by Gary Davis (Amazing Spider-Man, Terminator 2)
  • Original music by EMMY Winner Alex Wilkinson (Stargate-SG1)
  • Story created by Jason F. Knittle, written and produced in partnership with Brian Jagger, Craig DeLuz and Gwen Conklin and co-produced by Rensa Group Productions.
  • Together we have joined forces to create "Rellik Productions."
  • Your contributions will help us as we begin production in Sacramento, with the intent to distribute our original series on an alternate entertainment platform (Amazon Prime, Netflix, HULU, Crackle).  Our ultimate goal is that successful distribution will help bring more entertainment jobs to the region, including producing future episodes of our series.

What We Need & What You Get

As we move quickly into production, we are seeking additional funds.

  • Our current funding goal is $12,000.  This money will help us pay for our production costs, SAG actor wages, crew and gear, location fees, set equipment, post-production and more.

What's It About

Synopsis - Who’s the hunter, and who’s the hunted? Lines quickly become blurred in this modern day ‘Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde’ meets ‘Dexter’ crime thriller. A group of investigators, with inner demons of their own, hunt down a sadistic abuser of women and children. But this split-personality killer is magically elusive. And seems suspiciously familiar with police procedures, as well as the investigators’ personal lives. 

The Impact

This a SAG NEW MEDIA project.  Which means that Sacramento area actors and crew will have an opportunity to participate in a union level acting production being filmed locally.

  • This improves the Sacramento film community by bringing acting and crew jobs to our neighborhood.
  • After all is said and done, this project will involve over 50 actors and crew.
  • Join the Rellik team today and be a part of bringing this professional level production to life in Sacramento.

story:
VIRGIN VIRGIN is a comedy short about a graphic artist who's struggling with her noticeable virginity.

CAST

Crystal Friedman ….. Frances
Jade James ….. Jane 
Rick Shattuck ….. Jesse 
Kati Elizabeth ….. Kate 
Michael Rowland ….. Jeremy 
John Hayden ….. John 
Manuel Domenech ….. Andy 
Abbe Rowlins ….. Frances’ Mom

CREW
Director ..... Crystal Friedman
Director of Photography ..... Michael Greenwood
Set Design ..... Jade James
Assistant Director ..... Morgan McGlothan
Sound Mixer ..... Sicarra Devers
Editor ..... Jesus Rodriguez
Composer ..... Bryant Keith Bayhan

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// 

ABOUT US

Crystal Friedman (writer/actor/producer) is a Los Angeles native living and working in LA. She produces a weekly web show on YouTube where she talks to the camera about various things. She also has a electro/rap duo with co-star Jade James, called Galaxykat. 

Jade James (writer/actor/producer/music supervisor) is a talented musician living and working in LA. James produces music in a duo under Galaxykat and solo as Psychic Radio. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

VIRGIN VIRGIN needs your help to make this short come to life. The money raised will go toward shooting the film. The shoot is projected over three to four weeks in April/May 2015 and the funds will be used for crew, equipment, location fees and feeding crew/actors. We're asking you to help us raise $1,000 and, in exchange, not only will you become a part of the team making this film come alive, but you'll also get perks! Anything you can donate we can use! 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't pitch in $$ just now, there are other ways to help! 

Share our campaign with everyone you know! Link to our campaign and basically help us get the word out about the project. 

Donate your home, business, location, time or equipment. 

We are calling in favors from everyone we know!

story:
A Message To The All of The World.

"Orizuru" means Origami Crane.  It is said that when you have folded a thousand Origami Cranes, then your wish will come true.  The once-athletic Sadako set out to fold a thousand cranes at her hospital bed, so that she may again compete on the tracks.  In her story told by Eleanor Coerr, the leukemia caused by her radiation exposure from the Hiroshima nuclear bomb as a toddler had cut her dream short.  Her legacy, however, lives on and continues to inspire those who work to create a peaceful world for our children.  Seventy years after the end of World War II and the atomic bomb, Sadako and her thousand cranes remain among the most widely recognized symbol of peace and reconciliation, which has come to be embraced by the people, not just from the United States and Japan, but the World over.   This short film shines the light on Sadako's family and the people from both sides of the Pacific, who took down cultural and historical barriers, both big and small, through their hard work and courage.  The story is told from the perspective of a Japanese school boy, who struggles to fit into the American classroom.  Inspired by a class reading of Coerr's book, "Sadako", and with the help of an American WWII veteran, the boy finds courage to reach out to his classmates.  

人種や国境を超え「平和な世界と未来への心」を繋いでくれた「折鶴」の実話を基に、短編映画を通して子供の目線で「相手を理解する事」「想いやりの心」「命の大切さ」「友情」などのメッセージを世界の子供達へ伝えたい。

はじめまして。曽原三友紀と申します。Sakura Production USAにて映画のプロデューサー＆監督を務めております。今年は戦後70周年。戦争体験者の方も少なくなっていく中、毎日何不自由なく平和に暮らしていける感謝の気持ちや命の大切さなどをあらためて子供達と一緒に学び考えていきたいと思い、今回日米の友人たちと共に短編映画「折鶴」のプロジェクトを立ち上げました。

　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　         

Sadako and the Thousand Paper Cranes is a non-fiction children's book written by American author Eleanor Coerr and published in 1977.

The book has been translated to many languages and published in many places, to be used for peace education programs in primary schools.

Producer Miyuki Sohara's children learned this story from school in LA.
She researched an original story, then she found a book written by Sadako's real brother in Japanese.

Miyuki Sohara and her children learned about peace, Sadako's Spirit and friendship from this book.

広島で被爆し亡くなった、佐々木禎子さんを描いた本との出会い

このプロジェクトを始めたきっかけは、アメリカの小学生である私の息子と娘がエレノア　コアさんの「Sadako and The Thousand Paper Cranes(邦題：サダコと千羽鶴）」という折鶴のお話を2年生の時に学校の授業で学んだことがきっかけでした。

「禎子の千羽鶴」は世界30か国以上で翻訳され読み続けられていると言われています。また、ヨーロッパでは教科書の中で、アメリカでは副読本として学校の授業で取り上げられているそうです。

この本の内容は広島で被爆して白血病で12歳の短い生涯を終えた「佐々木禎子さんの千羽鶴」のお話ですが、佐々木禎子さんについて更に深くリサーチを進めていく過程で、禎子さんの実の兄　佐々木　雅弘さんが書かれた「禎子の千羽鶴」が最近日本語で出版されていることも知りました。

このお兄様の本を通し私達は「普段何気なく普通に平和に暮らしていけることの感謝の気持ち」や「命の大切さ」「想いやりの心」「家族愛」「友情」などを深く学びました。

                                                 (Image photo: Satoshi Teachs Orizuru)


　　　　　　　　　　　　　       　（image photo：Kindness）

Sadako's  Legacy is still alive today.  

One day, Miyuki Sohara found a book "Yononaka e no tobira" written by Kazuko Miyamoto which introduces Sadako's crane as a symbol of peace. The book reminded Miyuki of the grassroots 311 Tsunami Orizuru Project involving her Children's school community in Los Angeles.  The donation of over $2500 in Cash and sent to an American Children Cloth Company who exchanged to new children clothes and sent to Japan. 2,500 origami cranes were matched by a US Apparels Company with the same number of childrens clothes for the Tsunami victims.  The practice of making a thousand origami cranes as a gesture of support to those in need was popularized worldwide by the story of Sadako.  It is thus the legacy of Sadako continues to inspire not only those who are remembering WWII, but has become a tool to encourage those suffering hardships in the present time.  


禎子さんの生き様を伝え、癒しや思いやりの心、命の大切さを伝えたい

この様な状況を踏まえ、自分の子供達への教育の為にも、自分自身も一緒に学んでいくべき課題であり、また一方で私の様にアメリカに住む者が、アメリカの子供達や、先生方へ「もう過去の様な出来事が2度と起こらないように。」ということで正しい歴史を伝えていかなければならないと思う次第でした。

又、禎子さんの鶴が平和のシンボルとしてご紹介されている源　和子さん著書の「世の中の扉ー奇跡は翼に乗って」を読み終えて、ふと311の震災の時に息子の学校で日本人ファミリーが中心となりアメリカ人と一緒に「千羽鶴プロジェクト」を行い寄付金を集め、鶴を子供服に交換したりして日本への支援活動をしたことを思い出し、折鶴を通して皆の心が平和を祈って一つに繋がったのを思い出しました。


"Peaceful world and the future that paper cranes connect the mind beyond race and border."

This concept connected our team members to make this film.
In this film, we will reference one of the episodes from the source's book. We want to convey to the children the following message message; in conflict, blame and hate only leads to more, but, kind gestures and reconciliation opens the way to healing and peace.

In 2010, Sadako's older brother, Mr Masahiro Sasaki met Mr Clifton Truman Daniel, the oldest grandson of President Truman in New York, and showed him one of the tiny origami cranes made by Sadako.  Sasaki's outreach was reciprocated by Daniel with his historic visit to the Hiroshima Peace Memorial ceremony in 2012.  This symbolic event garnered significant interest Worldwide and inspired many to take action towards cooperation and reconciliation.   

Once completed, we will work to have this film be seen by as many children as possible, starting with schools in the U.S. and Japan, then to audiences around the world.  Please donate generously for the production and distribution of this film, this is your chance to take action and be involved in spreading of Sadako's legacy of outreach and reconciliation.  

This film is based on the true story about former president's grandchildren etc.

「折鶴が人種や国境を超えた心を繋ぐ平和な世界と未来」

これが今回の映画製作へと私たちのチームメンバーの心を繋いだのでした。

私たちの作品では、源さんの著書の中から一つのエピソードを参考にさせていただき、これからの時代を生きていく子供達へ、過去の歴史を「恨む」「憎む」というのではなく、サダコさんが残してくれた平和の祈りの鶴やそのお話しを通して、「癒し」「想いやりの心」「命の大切さ」「友情」を伝えていきたいと思っています。

アメリカの元大統領のお孫さん等も関わった実話のお話しを基にしています。きっと全国のアメリカの学校、図書館などに保管され時代を超えて視聴される貴重な映画となることでしょう。このプロジェクトに参加して皆様のニックネームをこの映画のプロジェクトに一緒に刻みませんか？ どうか応援よろしくお願いします。

　　　　　　　　　　　　　（image photo：国境を越えたサダコ鶴）

SYNOPSIS

A ten year old Japanese boy has just moved to Los Angeles, but he has difficulties fitting in at school.  A reading of the book, "Sadako", in his class touches the hearts of his classmates, but it is far from enough to instantly make friends for him.  His final lesson comes through a chance encounter with a veteran, a Pearl Harbor survivor, who invites the boy to join him on his trip to the International Peace Day Ceremony aboard the USS Arizona.  As the boy comes face to face with the history of war and reconciliation, he finds courage to actively reach out to his classmates at his new school. 

THE STORY

 Yuriko works as a Japanese language teacher. One day, one of her American students Chloe asks Yuriko for help making an origami crane for her grandfather Mr.Richard Bruner. Yuriko brings along Satoshi, putting him to the task of teaching the elderly man, who has turned out to be a WWII veteran and a Pearl Harbor survivor.  Mr. Richard Bruner is very appreciative of Satoshi's instruction, and to his own surprise, Satoshi enjoys interacting with the old man.  Mr. Richard Bruner senses Satoshi has not been able to let his guard down since arriving in this country, and feels he must help this young boy feel more at home.  

Mr. Richard Bruner is working on an origami crane to dedicate at a peace ceremony in Hawaii.  On a lark, the old man suggests both Satoshi and Yuriko to accompany him at the ceremony to interpret for him.  He jokes Satoshi might feel a little easier if he gets to go back half-way.  Yuriko tries to politely decline, but one more look at her son getting along with Mr. Richards makes her consider the old man's suggestion.  

In Hawaii, Mr. Richards speaks of a 60-year old "Orizuru" they will be seeing at the ceremony.  Yuriko and Satoshi are both in the dark about the significance of such an artifact.  

Who is Mr. Richards?  What is the relationship between him and Japanese "Friends"?

On the eve of the 70th anniversary of the end of World War II, "The One Paper Crane" flies all over the world with hopes for peace.


　アメリカに母百合子と共に渡米したさとし。カルチャーギャップでなかなか現地校の生徒との関係がうまくいかない毎日を過ごしてる。唯一の話し相手はシェルターからレスキューした愛犬のラッキーだった。そんな様子を心配する母、百合子。

ある日日本語の生徒の一人に紹介され、あるアメリカ人の老紳士リチャード氏と出会う。リチャード氏からの依頼は「折鶴の折り方を教えてほしい。」日頃アメリカ人との触れ合いを避けるさとしだったが、折鶴を一緒に折る事によってはじめてアメリカ人に心を開いていくだった。そんな中、リチャード氏から「今週末、日本から大切なお客様が来る為、介護人がいない為ハワイへ同行してほしい」との依頼を受けるさとしと百合子。戸惑う中、気分転換にとハワイ行を決め向かう。
ハワイで待っていたのは　なんとあの「禎子と千羽鶴」の本物の禎子鶴だったのだ。リチャード氏と禎子鶴との関係は？？　ハワイでの経験をきっかけに、その後さとしの周りで「国境を越えた友情と平和のメッセージ」が折鶴を通して世界へと広がっていく。
 

　　　　　　　　　　　　　　  　　　（image photo：Friendship）

▽ A small crane in the box is the same 1.5cm size as Sadako folded by using a needle in her bed when her disease condition was most bad.

箱の中の鶴が禎子さんがおった鶴と同じサイズの１．５ｃｍの大きさの鶴で病状が一番悪い時に針を使って折っていました。


ABOUT THE FILM

TITLE「Orizuru / 折鶴」(about 20min)
Location:　Los Angeles, Hollywood

SAG Short Film (Paper Pending)

■ SCHEDULE　

This film (by Japanese and American creators) is scheduled to be ：

  • Shot and edited in America ー Spring to Summer 2015
  • Completed by Fall 2015
  • Held previews by the end of 2015 and presented a lot of film festivals around the world.
  • Screened in Japan, America and other countries 2016 for public.
  • 日米合作の短編映画製作「折鶴(仮題）」として、日米で活躍するクリエーター達が、アメリカにて春から夏にかけて撮影および編集を予定。 完成試写会を秋に行い、そして世界の様々な映画祭に出品。2016年度には日本及びアメリカ等、様々な場所でも一般上映を予定。


■ THE DISTRIBUTION PLAN

1) Hold Previews.（only in Japan and America / 2015）　 　　

2) Present film to diverse film festivals and others.

(上映、配給の予定について）

1) 完成試写会開催（日本＆アメリカのみ　2015年度秋予定）

2) 様々な映画祭などに出品他　学校、平和イベントへの貸し出し、寄付他


※ 参考資料　 　 L：The premiere of "Hannari"  at the Laemmle Music Hall 3 in Beverly Hills  2006
　　　　　　　 R：The premiere of "Hannari"  at  Roppongi Academy Hills in Tokyo  2007

THE CREW 

MIYUKI SOHARA (SAG AFTRA) 曽原 三友紀　(米国俳優組合員)
PRODUCER & DIRECTOR& WRITER （総合プロデューサー＆監督、企画、製作、脚本)
（SAKURA PRODUCTION USA ,CEO）

Miyuki Sohara Based in Los Angeles and Japan, she has 13 years of experience as a TV announcer and a radio DJ in Japan and the US. Following a stint at Dentsu Tec, Inc. a major production company in Japan, Miyuki produced, coordinated and consulted on many events and plays as well as both short and feature length films. Miyuki studied classical ballet from a very young age and mastered many other dance disciplines from ballroom dancing, in which shehas won national level competitions, to traditional Japanese dance."Hannari -Geisha Modern" might be the first documentary which really penetrates the mysterious world of geisha and depicts its beauty. The director, Miyuki Sohara, hides a strong will behind her graceful attitude. Before the screening of the documentary at the United Nations, she shared how sincerely and passionately she feels about geisha culture.

Hannari Website 　www.hannari.info
Screening info　　 http://www.hannari.info/events
日本　アメリカにてTV＆ラジオアナウンサー、パーソナリティーを経てアメリカへ98年に渡米。

初監督作 ドキュメンタリー映画「はんなり」(監督＆プロデューサー）
ニューヨーク国連映画祭他映画祭、イベントなどに多数セレクトされる。日本では六本木ヒルズの国際会議場でプレミア上映、イベントをし、世界40か国以上の領事様ご夫妻が来場。

SAORI ABE 安部 沙織  / SCRIPTWRITER & ACTRESS（脚本家、女優）
(Pacific Voice Inc(日本)/ Sakura Production USA所属)

ENGLISH PROFILE　http://www.pacvoice.com/management/detail/saori-abe-e.html 

TAKAKO ISHIKAWA　石川 孝子 / SOUND EFFECTS（サウンドエフェクト）

Emmy Award Sound Effect Artist

PROFILE　http://www.takakoishikawa.com/
米国ソニーエンターテーメント勤務、ハリウッド製作のメジャー作品を多く手掛ける。
エミー賞受賞者。

MARGARET MURPHY/ CONSULTING PRODUCER

A three time Emmy Award winning producer/director/writer/editor whose work covers the areas of news, documentary, sports and children's programming as well as dramatic features.
WORKS：Sesame Street,NBC news,PBS and others

ENGLISH PROFILE　https://www.linkedin.com/pub/margaret-murphy/11/672/2a7 

セサミストリートはじめ、様々なドキュメンタリー、ニュース、教育番組、映画のプロデュサー。
3度にわたるエミー賞受賞および4度にわたるエミー賞ノミネート経験を持っている。

HIDETAKA ITO　伊藤 秀隆 / CONSULTING DIRECTOR　

(PLANET KIDS ENTERTAINMENT CEO)

He studied film making at USC in 2002 as an exchange student. After that, he made a several feature film, TV series, commercial and Music Video etc.

Film Ongaku bito info　https://eigapedia.com/movie/ongakubito
Youtube　https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hRa1eRpIpLw

2002年度文化庁在外芸術家研修員として南カリフォルニア大学（ＵＳＣ）で映画製作を学ぶ。
代表作　長編劇場映画　「音楽人」（桐谷美鈴主演）ＴＶドラマ「劇団演技者」や「逃走中」他

JAPANESE PROFILE　http://www.pkth.net/creaters/ 
音楽人予告編　https://eigapedia.com/movie/ongakubito


TAKASHI MORIMOTO　森本隆士 / COSTUME（衣装）

Takashi Morimoto is a costume designer, illustrator and technologist originally from Tokyo, Japan. He works as a freelance costumer extensively in LA area. His wide range of experience includes theatre, dance, film, apparel and Japanese kimono styling. He holds MFA in Theatre - Costume Design and Technology as well as professional kimono dressers license. Takashi is a proud member of the Costume Designers Guild IATSE Local 892 since 2012.
WEBSITE  www.t-timeconcepto.com
東京都葛飾区出身。アメリカで演劇学・衣裳デザインの修士号(MFA)を取得後、LAに移り舞台、映画、アパレルなど幅広いフィールドで経験を積む。2012年ハリウッドの映画組合、Costume Designers Guild Local 892加入。2014年には長年の夢でもあった和装を学び、厚生労働省認可山野流着装着付師免許を取得。

COSMO / STEEL PHOTO & WEB DESIGN（スチール撮影＆ウェブデザイナー）

A Former Hollywood reporter, graphic designer for TV programs and freelance photographer.
元ハリウッドリポーター、バラエティーなどのグラフィックデザイナー、フリー写真家

We've selected 100 actors/actresses from 5,000 applicants for main role, and been under the final decision.

現在メインキャストの百合子、リチャード氏、ジャスティンなどを5000人の応募者の中から100人に絞り、最終審査を行っております。詳細は新着情報をお楽しみに！


TAKAMARO / Role: Satoshi

A singer of "It's a Small World"( The walt disney web Series).He appears on short films,TV programs and stages. Studying opera,ballet,tennis and golf.He appears on the Commercial of "Energizer" NOW!
代表作ディズニー　ウェブシリーズ「It's A small World」の主題歌歌手。ショートフィルム、TV番組、舞台に出演。オペラ（ボーイズソプラノ）、バレエ、ピアノ、テニス、ゴルフ等を学ぶ。現在放映中のEnegizerのコマーシャルに出演中！

She played as Princess Aurora on the promotion video of Disney shop and appears many Commercial, short films and music videos.Her hobbies are ballet and watching musicals.
 ディズニーショップのプロモーションVideoでオーロラ姫を演じる他、数々の米国撮影のコマーシャル、ショートフィルム、ミュージックビデオ等に出演中。
趣味　バレエ、ミュージカル鑑賞

JED MILLS / Role: Mr. Richard Bruner

Jed Mills  has Guest Starred in scores of television programs including Law and Order Los Angeles, Seinfeld, Twin Peaks, Cagney & Lacey and Hill Street Blues as well as such films as Martin Scorsese's Casino and Richard Benjamin's My Favorite Year starring Peter OToole.  

He is a recipient of the LOS ANGELES DRAMA CRITICS CIRCLE AWARD, DRAMA-LOGUE and LA WEEKLY awards for his portrayal of a cerebral palsy victim in the highly acclaimed play "CREEPS" as well as two each LA WEEKLY and DRAMA-LOGUE awards, and an OBIE award for his work in the critically acclaimed improvisation theater company WAR BABIES. 

He has been teaching acting for more than forty years.  He has served as guest teacher and conducted career and life changing intensives on Improvisational Theater Techniques at schools, universities and arts centers including:

American Film Institute
Screen Actors Guild Conservatory
University of California Los Angeles' Academy of Performing and Visual Art
Harvard University
Saratoga Springs Arts Center, New York
Chapman University, Los Angeles

Mr. Mills also works with many casting directors to provide private coaching to actors in the varied techniques necessary for work in commercials, situation comedies, stage and film.

Mr. Mills is very excited and pleased to be part of this extraordinary project and thanks the entire staff the production company that has graced him with this wonderful gift.

ENGLISH PROFILE　http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0590039/

「ロー＆オーダー：LA」「となりのサインフェルド」「ツイン・ピークス」「女刑事キャグニー&レイシー」「ヒルストリート・ブルース」などの数多くのテレビドラマ出演のほか、マーティン・スコセッシ監督の「カジノ」、リチャードベンジャミン監督の「My Favorite Year（日本未公開）」などの映画出演で知られる。またアクティングの指導者としても40年以上のキャリアを持ち、ハーバード大学をはじめとする学校や大学、アートセンターでゲスト講師を務めるなどの指導活動も精力的に行っている。

「この特別なプロジェクトに参加できることにとても興奮しているし、嬉しく思います。このような素晴らしい機会を与えていただいた全てのスタッフとプロダクション関係者に感謝します」


Toshi Toda / Role: Mr. Masahiro Sasaki
Toshi Toda was born in Tokyo, Japan. He began his career as a modern and Jazz dancer before becoming an actor at the famous Gekidan Shiki Acting Company. In 1974, he moved from Tokyo to New York and was invited to act in numerous theater and Broadway plays and over 50 TV commercials. Among other assignments, he performed for the late Tony and Academy Award-winning director Arthur Penn on the National Tour of SLY FOX with Jackie Gleason and Cleavon Little. Toshi also starred in the Broadway musical ANYTHING GOES at the Lincoln Center with Patti Lupone, which ran for 2 years and earned a Tony Award for “best revival of a musical.”

After the show was closed, he moved to Hollywood and worked in films such as LETTERS OF IWOJIMA, CRANK, JUST MARRIED and PEARL HARBOUR among others. On TV, Toshi appeared in shows such as CHUCK, FLASHFORWARD, and ENTOURAGE among others.

ALL THAT REMAINS allowed Toshi to perform for the first time in his native Japan since he left in 1974.

東京生まれ。モダン＆ジャズ・ダンスのダンサーとしてキャリアをスタートする。    劇団四季四期生。1974年にニューヨークに移り、舞台を中心とした活動を開始する。ブロードウェイや有名な舞台に出演。アーサー・ペンの“Sly Fox”のナショナル・ツアーに参加し、ジャッキー・グリーソンやクリーヴォン・リトルらと共演した。リンカーン・センターで上演されたミュージカル「エニシング・ゴーズ」は、2年ものロングランとなり、トニー賞でミュージカル・リバイバル作品賞を受賞。その後、ハリウッドに移り、数々の映画やTVシリーズに出演している。“All That Remains”では、日本で演じたが、それは1974年に日本を離れて以来、初めてのことだった。代表作：『GODZZILA ゴジラ』“Godzzila”(1998/米・日)、「パール・ハーバー」"PEARL HARBOR"(2001/米・日)、『硫黄島からの手紙』“Letters from Iwo Jima”(2006/米)など


Yuji Sasaki / Role: Mr. Yuji Sasaki（本人出演）

Singer-songwriter Yuji Sasaki is Sadako Sasaki’s nephew. 

Sadako, an atomic bomb victim, is the model of the Children’s Peace Monument of Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park.

Yuji was a member of the rock band ‘GOD BREATH’, but when he learned about his aunt, he wrote the song ‘INORI’ in order to tell Sadako’s story and raise awareness. 

In 2010, the singer Kumiko sang ‘INORI’ at the prestigious NHK Kohaku Uta Gassen (New Year’s Eve song contest). 

In 2011, it was covered by American rock singer Eric Martin.Yuji Sasaki attends many peace events all over the world. 

He has held lectures and performances at more than 300 schools.

シンガーソングライター。

広島平和記念公園にある 「原爆の子の像」のモデルとなった少女「佐々木禎子」の甥にあたる被爆二世。

九州在住でロックバンド「GOD BREATH」のボーカルとして活躍していたが、叔母 佐々木禎子のストーリーを父や祖父から聞き、薄れゆく記憶を、そして、禎子を襲った苦難を語り継ぐことこそが自分の使命であると悟り「INORI」を作曲。

「INORI」は2010年のNHK紅白対抗歌合戦で歌手のクミコによって歌われ、2011年には人気ロックミュージシャンのエリック・マーティンがカバーした。

全国の小中学校や世界各地の平和イベントに積極的に参加しており、これまでに講演会＆ライブを行った学校数は300校を超える。



JAMES KYSON LEE / Role:Teacher（友情出演）

He was born in Seoul and moved with his family to New York City at the age of 10. He studied communications at Boston University. Voted by TV Guide among “Hollywood’s 25 Hottest” in 2011, James appeared in an episode of Hawaii Five-0 on CBS, and completed a 4-year run on NBC's Heroes as Ando Masahashi.

韓国のソウル生まれ。10歳の時に家族でアメリカ・ニューヨークに移住。ボストン大学卒。2003年、テレビドラマ『犯罪捜査官ネイビーファイル』でデビュー。2006年から『HEROES』に日本人俳優マシ・オカの親友アンドウ・マサハシ役として出演。

スティービーワンダー所有のFMラジオ局FM 102.3にて平日5日間毎日朝のレギュラーDJを務める。

story_txt:
A Message To The All of The World.

"Orizuru" means Origami Crane.  It is said that when you have folded a thousand Origami Cranes, then your wish will come true.  The once-athletic Sadako set out to fold a thousand cranes at her hospital bed, so that she may again compete on the tracks.  In her story told by Eleanor Coerr, the leukemia caused by her radiation exposure from the Hiroshima nuclear bomb as a toddler had cut her dream short.  Her legacy, however, lives on and continues to inspire those who work to create a peaceful world for our children.  Seventy years after the end of World War II and the atomic bomb, Sadako and her thousand cranes remain among the most widely recognized symbol of peace and reconciliation, which has come to be embraced by the people, not just from the United States and Japan, but the World over.   This short film shines the light on Sadako's family and the people from both sides of the Pacific, who took down cultural and historical barriers, both big and small, through their hard work and courage.  The story is told from the perspective of a Japanese school boy, who struggles to fit into the American classroom.  Inspired by a class reading of Coerr's book, "Sadako", and with the help of an American WWII veteran, the boy finds courage to reach out to his classmates.  
人種や国境を超え「平和な世界と未来への心」を繋いでくれた「折鶴」の実話を基に、短編映画を通して子供の目線で「相手を理解する事」「想いやりの心」「命の大切さ」「友情」などのメッセージを世界の子供達へ伝えたい。
はじめまして。曽原三友紀と申します。Sakura Production USAにて映画のプロデューサー＆監督を務めております。今年は戦後70周年。戦争体験者の方も少なくなっていく中、毎日何不自由なく平和に暮らしていける感謝の気持ちや命の大切さなどをあらためて子供達と一緒に学び考えていきたいと思い、今回日米の友人たちと共に短編映画「折鶴」のプロジェクトを立ち上げました。


　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　         
Sadako and the Thousand Paper Cranes is a non-fiction children's book written by American author Eleanor Coerr and published in 1977.

The book has been translated to many languages and published in many places, to be used for peace education programs in primary schools.
Producer Miyuki Sohara's children learned this story from school in LA.She researched an original story, then she found a book written by Sadako's real brother in Japanese.
Miyuki Sohara and her children learned about peace, Sadako's Spirit and friendship from this book.
広島で被爆し亡くなった、佐々木禎子さんを描いた本との出会い

このプロジェクトを始めたきっかけは、アメリカの小学生である私の息子と娘がエレノア　コアさんの「Sadako and The Thousand Paper Cranes(邦題：サダコと千羽鶴）」という折鶴のお話を2年生の時に学校の授業で学んだことがきっかけでした。
「禎子の千羽鶴」は世界30か国以上で翻訳され読み続けられていると言われています。また、ヨーロッパでは教科書の中で、アメリカでは副読本として学校の授業で取り上げられているそうです。
この本の内容は広島で被爆して白血病で12歳の短い生涯を終えた「佐々木禎子さんの千羽鶴」のお話ですが、佐々木禎子さんについて更に深くリサーチを進めていく過程で、禎子さんの実の兄　佐々木　雅弘さんが書かれた「禎子の千羽鶴」が最近日本語で出版されていることも知りました。

このお兄様の本を通し私達は「普段何気なく普通に平和に暮らしていけることの感謝の気持ち」や「命の大切さ」「想いやりの心」「家族愛」「友情」などを深く学びました。

                                                 (Image photo: Satoshi Teachs Orizuru)


　　　　　　　　　　　　　       　（image photo：Kindness）


Sadako's  Legacy is still alive today.  

One day, Miyuki Sohara found a book "Yononaka e no tobira" written by Kazuko Miyamoto which introduces Sadako's crane as a symbol of peace. The book reminded Miyuki of the grassroots 311 Tsunami Orizuru Project involving her Children's school community in Los Angeles.  The donation of over $2500 in Cash and sent to an American Children Cloth Company who exchanged to new children clothes and sent to Japan. 2,500 origami cranes were matched by a US Apparels Company with the same number of childrens clothes for the Tsunami victims.  The practice of making a thousand origami cranes as a gesture of support to those in need was popularized worldwide by the story of Sadako.  It is thus the legacy of Sadako continues to inspire not only those who are remembering WWII, but has become a tool to encourage those suffering hardships in the present time.  



禎子さんの生き様を伝え、癒しや思いやりの心、命の大切さを伝えたい
この様な状況を踏まえ、自分の子供達への教育の為にも、自分自身も一緒に学んでいくべき課題であり、また一方で私の様にアメリカに住む者が、アメリカの子供達や、先生方へ「もう過去の様な出来事が2度と起こらないように。」ということで正しい歴史を伝えていかなければならないと思う次第でした。
又、禎子さんの鶴が平和のシンボルとしてご紹介されている源　和子さん著書の「世の中の扉ー奇跡は翼に乗って」を読み終えて、ふと311の震災の時に息子の学校で日本人ファミリーが中心となりアメリカ人と一緒に「千羽鶴プロジェクト」を行い寄付金を集め、鶴を子供服に交換したりして日本への支援活動をしたことを思い出し、折鶴を通して皆の心が平和を祈って一つに繋がったのを思い出しました。


"Peaceful world and the future that paper cranes connect the mind beyond race and border."

This concept connected our team members to make this film.In this film, we will reference one of the episodes from the source's book. We want to convey to the children the following message message; in conflict, blame and hate only leads to more, but, kind gestures and reconciliation opens the way to healing and peace. 

In 2010, Sadako's older brother, Mr Masahiro Sasaki met Mr Clifton Truman Daniel, the oldest grandson of President Truman in New York, and showed him one of the tiny origami cranes made by Sadako.  Sasaki's outreach was reciprocated by Daniel with his historic visit to the Hiroshima Peace Memorial ceremony in 2012.  This symbolic event garnered significant interest Worldwide and inspired many to take action towards cooperation and reconciliation.   
Once completed, we will work to have this film be seen by as many children as possible, starting with schools in the U.S. and Japan, then to audiences around the world.  Please donate generously for the production and distribution of this film, this is your chance to take action and be involved in spreading of Sadako's legacy of outreach and reconciliation.  
This film is based on the true story about former president's grandchildren etc.

「折鶴が人種や国境を超えた心を繋ぐ平和な世界と未来」これが今回の映画製作へと私たちのチームメンバーの心を繋いだのでした。
私たちの作品では、源さんの著書の中から一つのエピソードを参考にさせていただき、これからの時代を生きていく子供達へ、過去の歴史を「恨む」「憎む」というのではなく、サダコさんが残してくれた平和の祈りの鶴やそのお話しを通して、「癒し」「想いやりの心」「命の大切さ」「友情」を伝えていきたいと思っています。
アメリカの元大統領のお孫さん等も関わった実話のお話しを基にしています。きっと全国のアメリカの学校、図書館などに保管され時代を超えて視聴される貴重な映画となることでしょう。このプロジェクトに参加して皆様のニックネームをこの映画のプロジェクトに一緒に刻みませんか？ どうか応援よろしくお願いします。


　　　　　　　　　　　　　（image photo：国境を越えたサダコ鶴）
SYNOPSISA ten year old Japanese boy has just moved to Los Angeles, but he has difficulties fitting in at school.  A reading of the book, "Sadako", in his class touches the hearts of his classmates, but it is far from enough to instantly make friends for him.  His final lesson comes through a chance encounter with a veteran, a Pearl Harbor survivor, who invites the boy to join him on his trip to the International Peace Day Ceremony aboard the USS Arizona.  As the boy comes face to face with the history of war and reconciliation, he finds courage to actively reach out to his classmates at his new school. 

THE STORY



 Yuriko works as a Japanese language teacher. One day, one of her American students Chloe asks Yuriko for help making an origami crane for her grandfather Mr.Richard Bruner. Yuriko brings along Satoshi, putting him to the task of teaching the elderly man, who has turned out to be a WWII veteran and a Pearl Harbor survivor.  Mr. Richard Bruner is very appreciative of Satoshi's instruction, and to his own surprise, Satoshi enjoys interacting with the old man.  Mr. Richard Bruner senses Satoshi has not been able to let his guard down since arriving in this country, and feels he must help this young boy feel more at home.  


Mr. Richard Bruner is working on an origami crane to dedicate at a peace ceremony in Hawaii.  On a lark, the old man suggests both Satoshi and Yuriko to accompany him at the ceremony to interpret for him.  He jokes Satoshi might feel a little easier if he gets to go back half-way.  Yuriko tries to politely decline, but one more look at her son getting along with Mr. Richards makes her consider the old man's suggestion.  
In Hawaii, Mr. Richards speaks of a 60-year old "Orizuru" they will be seeing at the ceremony.  Yuriko and Satoshi are both in the dark about the significance of such an artifact.  
Who is Mr. Richards?  What is the relationship between him and Japanese "Friends"?
On the eve of the 70th anniversary of the end of World War II, "The One Paper Crane" flies all over the world with hopes for peace.

　アメリカに母百合子と共に渡米したさとし。カルチャーギャップでなかなか現地校の生徒との関係がうまくいかない毎日を過ごしてる。唯一の話し相手はシェルターからレスキューした愛犬のラッキーだった。そんな様子を心配する母、百合子。

ある日日本語の生徒の一人に紹介され、あるアメリカ人の老紳士リチャード氏と出会う。リチャード氏からの依頼は「折鶴の折り方を教えてほしい。」日頃アメリカ人との触れ合いを避けるさとしだったが、折鶴を一緒に折る事によってはじめてアメリカ人に心を開いていくだった。そんな中、リチャード氏から「今週末、日本から大切なお客様が来る為、介護人がいない為ハワイへ同行してほしい」との依頼を受けるさとしと百合子。戸惑う中、気分転換にとハワイ行を決め向かう。


ハワイで待っていたのは　なんとあの「禎子と千羽鶴」の本物の禎子鶴だったのだ。リチャード氏と禎子鶴との関係は？？　ハワイでの経験をきっかけに、その後さとしの周りで「国境を越えた友情と平和のメッセージ」が折鶴を通して世界へと広がっていく。 




　　　　　　　　　　　　　　  　　　（image photo：Friendship）
▽ A small crane in the box is the same 1.5cm size as Sadako folded by using a needle in her bed when her disease condition was most bad.
箱の中の鶴が禎子さんがおった鶴と同じサイズの１．５ｃｍの大きさの鶴で病状が一番悪い時に針を使って折っていました。


ABOUT THE FILM
TITLE「Orizuru / 折鶴」(about 20min)Location:　Los Angeles, Hollywood
SAG Short Film (Paper Pending)


■ SCHEDULE　


This film (by Japanese and American creators) is scheduled to be ：

Shot and edited in America ー Spring to Summer 2015
Completed by Fall 2015
Held previews by the end of 2015 and presented a lot of film festivals around the world.
Screened in Japan, America and other countries 2016 for public.

日米合作の短編映画製作「折鶴(仮題）」として、日米で活躍するクリエーター達が、アメリカにて春から夏にかけて撮影および編集を予定。
完成試写会を秋に行い、そして世界の様々な映画祭に出品。2016年度には日本及びアメリカ等、様々な場所でも一般上映を予定。





■ THE DISTRIBUTION PLAN
1) Hold Previews.（only in Japan and America / 2015）　 　　
2) Present film to diverse film festivals and others.

(上映、配給の予定について）
1) 完成試写会開催（日本＆アメリカのみ　2015年度秋予定）
2) 様々な映画祭などに出品他　学校、平和イベントへの貸し出し、寄付他

※ 参考資料　 　 L：The premiere of "Hannari"  at the Laemmle Music Hall 3 in Beverly Hills  2006　　　　　　　 R：The premiere of "Hannari"  at  Roppongi Academy Hills in Tokyo  2007



THE CREW 



MIYUKI SOHARA (SAG AFTRA) 曽原 三友紀　(米国俳優組合員)PRODUCER & DIRECTOR& WRITER （総合プロデューサー＆監督、企画、製作、脚本)（SAKURA PRODUCTION USA ,CEO）
Miyuki Sohara Based in Los Angeles and Japan, she has 13 years of experience as a TV announcer and a radio DJ in Japan and the US. Following a stint at Dentsu Tec, Inc. a major production company in Japan, Miyuki produced, coordinated and consulted on many events and plays as well as both short and feature length films. Miyuki studied classical ballet from a very young age and mastered many other dance disciplines from ballroom dancing, in which shehas won national level competitions, to traditional Japanese dance."Hannari -Geisha Modern" might be the first documentary which really penetrates the mysterious world of geisha and depicts its beauty. The director, Miyuki Sohara, hides a strong will behind her graceful attitude. Before the screening of the documentary at the United Nations, she shared how sincerely and passionately she feels about geisha culture.

Hannari Website 　www.hannari.infoScreening info　　 http://www.hannari.info/events

日本　アメリカにてTV＆ラジオアナウンサー、パーソナリティーを経てアメリカへ98年に渡米。

初監督作 ドキュメンタリー映画「はんなり」(監督＆プロデューサー）ニューヨーク国連映画祭他映画祭、イベントなどに多数セレクトされる。日本では六本木ヒルズの国際会議場でプレミア上映、イベントをし、世界40か国以上の領事様ご夫妻が来場。












SAORI ABE 安部 沙織  / SCRIPTWRITER & ACTRESS（脚本家、女優）(Pacific Voice Inc(日本)/ Sakura Production USA所属)

PROFILE　http://www.takakoishikawa.com/
米国ソニーエンターテーメント勤務、ハリウッド製作のメジャー作品を多く手掛ける。エミー賞受賞者。




MARGARET MURPHY/ CONSULTING PRODUCER


A three time Emmy Award winning producer/director/writer/editor whose work covers the areas of news, documentary, sports and children's programming as well as dramatic features.WORKS：Sesame Street,NBC news,PBS and others

セサミストリートはじめ、様々なドキュメンタリー、ニュース、教育番組、映画のプロデュサー。3度にわたるエミー賞受賞および4度にわたるエミー賞ノミネート経験を持っている。


HIDETAKA ITO　伊藤 秀隆 / CONSULTING DIRECTOR　

(PLANET KIDS ENTERTAINMENT CEO)
He studied film making at USC in 2002 as an exchange student. After that, he made a several feature film, TV series, commercial and Music Video etc.
Film Ongaku bito info　https://eigapedia.com/movie/ongakubitoYoutube　https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hRa1eRpIpLw
2002年度文化庁在外芸術家研修員として南カリフォルニア大学（ＵＳＣ）で映画製作を学ぶ。代表作　長編劇場映画　「音楽人」（桐谷美鈴主演）ＴＶドラマ「劇団演技者」や「逃走中」他
JAPANESE PROFILE　http://www.pkth.net/creaters/ 音楽人予告編　https://eigapedia.com/movie/ongakubito




TAKASHI MORIMOTO　森本隆士 / COSTUME（衣装） 

Takashi Morimoto is a costume designer, illustrator and technologist originally from Tokyo, Japan. He works as a freelance costumer extensively in LA area. His wide range of  experience includes theatre, dance, film, apparel and Japanese kimono styling. He holds MFA in Theatre - Costume Design and Technology as well as professional kimono dressers license. Takashi is a proud member of the Costume Designers Guild IATSE Local 892 since 2012.


WEBSITE  www.t-timeconcepto.com

東京都葛飾区出身。アメリカで演劇学・衣裳デザインの修士号(MFA)を取得後、LAに移り舞台、映画、アパレルなど幅広いフィールドで経験を積む。2012年ハリウッドの映画組合、Costume Designers Guild Local 892加入。2014年には長年の夢でもあった和装を学び、厚生労働省認可山野流着装着付師免許を取得。





COSMO / STEEL PHOTO & WEB DESIGN（スチール撮影＆ウェブデザイナー） 


A Former Hollywood reporter, graphic designer for TV programs and freelance photographer.元ハリウッドリポーター、バラエティーなどのグラフィックデザイナー、フリー写真家

We've selected 100 actors/actresses from 5,000 applicants for main role, and been under the final decision.

TAKAMARO / Role: Satoshi

A singer of "It's a Small World"( The walt disney web Series).He appears on short films,TV programs and stages. Studying opera,ballet,tennis and golf.He appears on the Commercial of "Energizer" NOW!代表作ディズニー　ウェブシリーズ「It's A small World」の主題歌歌手。ショートフィルム、TV番組、舞台に出演。オペラ（ボーイズソプラノ）、バレエ、ピアノ、テニス、ゴルフ等を学ぶ。現在放映中のEnegizerのコマーシャルに出演中！








REYNA / Role: Sadako Sasaki 

She played as Princess Aurora on the promotion video of Disney shop and appears many Commercial, short films and music videos.Her hobbies are ballet and watching musicals.


 ディズニーショップのプロモーションVideoでオーロラ姫を演じる他、数々の米国撮影のコマーシャル、ショートフィルム、ミュージックビデオ等に出演中。趣味　バレエ、ミュージカル鑑賞





JED MILLS / Role: Mr. Richard Bruner


Jed Mills  has Guest Starred in scores of television programs including Law and Order Los Angeles, Seinfeld, Twin Peaks, Cagney & Lacey and Hill Street Blues as well as such films as Martin Scorsese's Casino and Richard Benjamin's My Favorite Year starring Peter OToole.  
He is a recipient of the LOS ANGELES DRAMA CRITICS CIRCLE AWARD, DRAMA-LOGUE and LA WEEKLY awards for his portrayal of a cerebral palsy victim in the highly acclaimed play "CREEPS" as well as two each LA WEEKLY and DRAMA-LOGUE awards, and an OBIE award for his work in the critically acclaimed improvisation theater company WAR BABIES. 
He has been teaching acting for more than forty years.  He has served as guest teacher and conducted career and life changing intensives on Improvisational Theater Techniques at schools, universities and arts centers including:
American Film InstituteScreen Actors Guild ConservatoryUniversity of California Los Angeles' Academy of Performing and Visual ArtHarvard UniversitySaratoga Springs Arts Center, New YorkChapman University, Los Angeles
Mr. Mills also works with many casting directors to provide private coaching to actors in the varied techniques necessary for work in commercials, situation comedies, stage and film.
Mr. Mills is very excited and pleased to be part of this extraordinary project and thanks the entire staff the production company that has graced him with this wonderful gift.


ENGLISH PROFILE　http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0590039/


「ロー＆オーダー：LA」「となりのサインフェルド」「ツイン・ピークス」「女刑事キャグニー&レイシー」「ヒルストリート・ブルース」などの数多くのテレビドラマ出演のほか、マーティン・スコセッシ監督の「カジノ」、リチャードベンジャミン監督の「My Favorite Year（日本未公開）」などの映画出演で知られる。またアクティングの指導者としても40年以上のキャリアを持ち、ハーバード大学をはじめとする学校や大学、アートセンターでゲスト講師を務めるなどの指導活動も精力的に行っている。


Jedさんからのコメント「この特別なプロジェクトに参加できることにとても興奮しているし、嬉しく思います。このような素晴らしい機会を与えていただいた全てのスタッフとプロダクション関係者に感謝します」





Toshi Toda / Role: Mr. Masahiro Sasaki

Toshi Toda was born in Tokyo, Japan. He began his career as a modern and Jazz dancer before becoming an actor at the famous Gekidan Shiki Acting Company. In 1974, he moved from Tokyo to New York and was invited to act in numerous theater and Broadway plays and over 50 TV commercials. Among other assignments, he performed for the late Tony and Academy Award-winning director Arthur Penn on the National Tour of SLY FOX with Jackie Gleason and Cleavon Little. Toshi also starred in the Broadway musical ANYTHING GOES at the Lincoln Center with Patti Lupone, which ran for 2 years and earned a Tony Award for “best revival of a musical.”
After the show was closed, he moved to Hollywood and worked in films such as LETTERS OF IWOJIMA, CRANK, JUST MARRIED and PEARL HARBOUR among others. On TV, Toshi appeared in shows such as CHUCK, FLASHFORWARD, and ENTOURAGE among others.
ALL THAT REMAINS allowed Toshi to perform for the first time in his native Japan since he left in 1974.
東京生まれ。モダン＆ジャズ・ダンスのダンサーとしてキャリアをスタートする。    劇団四季四期生。1974年にニューヨークに移り、舞台を中心とした活動を開始する。ブロードウェイや有名な舞台に出演。アーサー・ペンの“Sly Fox”のナショナル・ツアーに参加し、ジャッキー・グリーソンやクリーヴォン・リトルらと共演した。リンカーン・センターで上演されたミュージカル「エニシング・ゴーズ」は、2年ものロングランとなり、トニー賞でミュージカル・リバイバル作品賞を受賞。その後、ハリウッドに移り、数々の映画やTVシリーズに出演している。“All That Remains”では、日本で演じたが、それは1974年に日本を離れて以来、初めてのことだった。代表作：『GODZZILA ゴジラ』“Godzzila”(1998/米・日)、「パール・ハーバー」"PEARL HARBOR"(2001/米・日)、『硫黄島からの手紙』“Letters from Iwo Jima”(2006/米)など



Yuji Sasaki / Role: Mr. Yuji Sasaki（本人出演）

Singer-songwriter Yuji Sasaki is Sadako Sasaki’s nephew. 

Sadako, an atomic bomb victim, is the model of the Children’s Peace Monument of Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park.
Yuji was a member of the rock band ‘GOD BREATH’, but when he learned about his aunt, he wrote the song ‘INORI’ in order to tell Sadako’s story and raise awareness. 
In 2010, the singer Kumiko sang ‘INORI’ at the prestigious NHK Kohaku Uta Gassen (New Year’s Eve song contest). 
In 2011, it was covered by American rock singer Eric Martin.Yuji Sasaki attends many peace events all over the world. 
He has held lectures and performances at more than 300 schools.
シンガーソングライター。
広島平和記念公園にある 「原爆の子の像」のモデルとなった少女「佐々木禎子」の甥にあたる被爆二世。
九州在住でロックバンド「GOD BREATH」のボーカルとして活躍していたが、叔母 佐々木禎子のストーリーを父や祖父から聞き、薄れゆく記憶を、そして、禎子を襲った苦難を語り継ぐことこそが自分の使命であると悟り「INORI」を作曲。



「INORI」は2010年のNHK紅白対抗歌合戦で歌手のクミコによって歌われ、2011年には人気ロックミュージシャンのエリック・マーティンがカバーした。
全国の小中学校や世界各地の平和イベントに積極的に参加しており、これまでに講演会＆ライブを行った学校数は300校を超える。






JAMES KYSON LEE / Role:Teacher（友情出演）

He was born in Seoul and moved with his family to New York City at the age of 10. He studied communications at Boston University.
Voted by TV Guide among “Hollywood’s 25 Hottest” in 2011, James appeared in an episode of Hawaii Five-0 on CBS, and completed a 4-year run on NBC's Heroes as Ando Masahashi.
WORKS　HEROES (2006 - 2010）etc..ENGLISH PROFILE　http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1645304/?ref_=nv_sr_1


韓国のソウル生まれ。10歳の時に家族でアメリカ・ニューヨークに移住。ボストン大学卒。2003年、テレビドラマ『犯罪捜査官ネイビーファイル』でデビュー。2006年から『HEROES』に日本人俳優マシ・オカの親友アンドウ・マサハシ役として出演。






DOMINIQUE DIPRIMA / Role: TV Reporter (友情出演）



A host radio DJ of every weekday's morning programs on FM 102.3.ENGLISH PROFILE　http://kjlhradio.com/dominique-diprima/ スティービーワンダー所有のFMラジオ局FM 102.3にて平日5日間毎日朝のレギュラーDJを務める。





REFERENCE BOOKS 　


L："Yononaka no Tobira- Kiseki ha Tsubasa ni notte" by Kazuko Minamoto
R："Sadako and The Thousand Crane"                      by Masahiro Sasaki(Sadako's real brother)
左：「世の中の扉ー奇跡はつばさに乗って」著者：源　和子（講談社）*講談社特選：「終戦70周年：戦争と平和を考える本」の12冊の中の1冊
右：「禎子の千羽鶴」著者：佐々木雅弘（禎子さんの実兄）（学研出版） 家族の視点からみた禎子さんの実話。



HOW THE FUNDS WILL BE USED


We'll put our own money, time and effort into this project, but this time — with your help — we'll go a great deal further.
The funds will help:
(1) Write and register the script (including the translation)

(2) Get the insurance and permits we need.    
(3) Transportation and accommodation fee.
(4)  Renting camera equipment / buying or building where more inexpensive 　　(dolly, sliders, cranes, etc).　　 Rent lights / Location Fee,buy them where more inexpensive than renting.　　 Feed the cast and crew.
*今回撮影などにかかる費用として具体的には下記の内容となります。
(1) 台本作成、登録費（翻訳費用）   
(2) 映画撮影に入る前の段階の準備費（許可申請、契約書の弁護士費用、保険他） 
(3) 交通費、宿泊費          
(4) 撮影に関わる経費 （機材、美術、出演者＆クルー、食事代、交通費等）




HOW YOU CAN HELP



Claim a perk! In return, we have some unique rewards.
Ask ONE FRIEND to become a supporter. Forward our Indiegogo link to someone you think may be interested.
Spread the word and like us on Facebook, and Follow us on Twitter! Retweet the campaign!

Leave us a Comment. Or ask us a question. We’d love to hear from you. Any comment or question greatly benefits others who may be reading this.

story: My wife's mother is sick. She is 80years old and might not be with us to much longer and I need to get my wife to Germany to be with her. I am a disabled VET living of a disability pay and can not afford the trip pleas help.

story:
Isabella Baronello

I have collaborated with Samson's Video Production making short films in the past with The Ties That Bind.  Six degrees of Limb Separation and The Hairess. 

 I am usually theatre based where I write, produce, act, and direct. I will transfer all my skills of budgeting, promoting, and bringing out the best performances from our talented actors.

 I hope to achieve an entertaining look at four women who have worked together for years but only get to know each other on their Weekend In Girvan. It delves into the complex relationships the women have when they rally to support their friend Agnes after they find her husband dead in her living room. Humour mixed with sadness and beautiful scenery of our South Ayrshire coastline.

  It is our desire to give our cast an IMDB credit, give our film exposure in festivals, pay for music rights and catering. William and I realise that our funding if achieved may not seem sufficient to produce Weekend In Girvan and we will be using our own money to complete our project as most small indie film makers often do . I believe in small independent film makers who do not have the backing to tells stories that blockbusters will never make and therefore will never be told. Every penny will be spent wisely and for the benefit of the film and all involved. If you have read to the end I would like to thank you for your time and if you can't donate please spread the word.

Best Wishes,

Isabella.

William Samson
I like making films.  I make all sorts of movies in all sorts of genres (Horror, Comedy, Drama, Science Fiction, Dance.) under my company name of Samson Video Productions.  Some of my films have picked up awards.  A couple that I am particularly pleased about are Susan Sutton’s “Best Actress” in “What have you Done?”  And Seylan Baxter’s “Best Music” in “Nancy” both at the Raptors Scottish Short Film Festival.  A couple of my other films have even been BAFTA nominated. 
What I do like when I am making a movie is good acting and I have been fortunate in having been able to work with some really great acting talent during my career.  In the films I make, the emphasis is always on the performers and the acting, which is why I want to make “Weekend in Girvan”. 
As I mentioned in the video on this page, I have been able to work with some excellent actresses in the past few years and I have also had the pleasure of watching Isabella’s stage plays.  I do like her writing.  I am not a fan of inequality and there has been much ongoing discussion about there not being enough decent parts for women to play in film.  So I thought, “Can I put at least some of these good actresses together with a script written by Isabella?”
The answer is “Yes!”  The script of “Weekend in Girvan” has those good roles in it for women; it is a good mix of drama and comedy and it now needs to be made.  Once made, our aim is to submit the film to festivals such as Rain Dance and Sundance and to those festivals which are more geared toward women in film like the Female Eye Festival.
We have the experience, we have the script and we have some ladies with tremendous acting skills who I’m sure you will want to see on screen, so any money donated will not be wasted.  All we need now is your support and perhaps you too will want to have your own Weekend in Girvan.

Best Wishes,
Isabella.





William Samson I like making films.  I make all sorts of movies in all sorts of genres (Horror, Comedy, Drama, Science Fiction, Dance.) under my company name of Samson Video Productions.  Some of my films have picked up awards.  A couple that I am particularly pleased about are Susan Sutton’s “Best Actress” in “What have you Done?”  And Seylan Baxter’s “Best Music” in “Nancy” both at the Raptors Scottish Short Film Festival.  A couple of my other films have even been BAFTA nominated.  What I do like when I am making a movie is good acting and I have been fortunate in having been able to work with some really great acting talent during my career.  In the films I make, the emphasis is always on the performers and the acting, which is why I want to make “Weekend in Girvan”.  As I mentioned in the video on this page, I have been able to work with some excellent actresses in the past few years and I have also had the pleasure of watching Isabella’s stage plays.  I do like her writing.  I am not a fan of inequality and there has been much ongoing discussion about there not being enough decent parts for women to play in film.  So I thought, “Can I put at least some of these good actresses together with a script written by Isabella?” The answer is “Yes!”  The script of “Weekend in Girvan” has those good roles in it for women; it is a good mix of drama and comedy and it now needs to be made.  Once made, our aim is to submit the film to festivals such as Rain Dance and Sundance and to those festivals which are more geared toward women in film like the Female Eye Festival. We have the experience, we have the script and we have some ladies with tremendous acting skills who I’m sure you will want to see on screen, so any money donated will not be wasted.  All we need now is your support and perhaps you too will want to have your own Weekend in Girvan.
